loans.name: Matda

texts.en:
Wanting to save for the education of her children, Matda manages a general store business at Rang-Ay, San Agustin, Isabela.  She wants to request a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva for her to have additional capital. With that, she will be able to produce more products for her store, which may result in a higher income.

She is blessed with three children: Zynah Mary, who is 8 years old and currently enrolled in elementary school; Lyzah Mae, who is 3 years old; and John Lloyd, who is 6 months old. Matda is very grateful for having a happy and loving family.

loans.use: Business capital to produce more products.

loans.name: Ngô Thị

texts.en:
Ngô Thị Q. (1826071498) is a 35 year old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Q. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling liquor such as beer & wine in the local community. Q. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Q. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Q. successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Q. is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Managing a general store is a risky business, says Raquel. There are debtors who pay late, so sometimes she has a problem with cash flow. However, with her skill in customer service, her business continues to slowly grow.

Like other businesswomen, Raquel is interested in venturing into other businesses in order to earn more income for her family, so she decided to borrow from Kiva. She knows that with PHP 5000 she can start another type of business. “With my determination, I know that I will be able to manage another business in addition to my general store”, Raquel said.

Raquel's husband, Jonard, is a construction worker. They are helping one another support the needs of their children, most especially their education.

loans.use: Start-Up Capital

loans.name: Trần Thị

To make a living, S. owns and operates a business selling herbs and spices in the local community.  S. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2007, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND to TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  S. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her third loan from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling rice cakes in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. L. is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her shop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is the hardworking wife of Teofilo C.. They help each other in making their rice farming business productive. She is already 56 years old but still strong enough to till their field. 

Due to the lack of financial capital, Rebecca wants to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP14,000. She will utilize the loan in purchasing fertilizer that is really needed for their rice crops to grow and develop full rice grains. Rebecca and her husband are working very hard at farming in order to uplift their poor living conditions. Also, they want to give their children a better future through education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: David Ba Group

texts.en:
Joseph is thirty-nine years old. He is married and has two children. He is a trader in hardware. Joseph is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘David Ba’ which literally means Son of David. He is the only male in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors, and farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Fish vending is the business of Renato D. Sr. He is a simple person trying to develop his vending business to give his family a better living. His family lives harmoniously at Barangay Ranga - Ay San Agustin, Isabela, a village that is isolated and mountainous. 

His eagerness to develop his business into a more progressive one gave him the idea of asking financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 that he will utilize in his fish vending business. According to him, his business is a big help in providing his three children their daily fees for school. He hopes that someday his children will earn a degree for their future.

loans.use: Business Capital

To make a living, Thúy owns and operates a business serving breakfast foods to customers in the local community. In 2008, Thúy joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  Thúy is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her second loan from TYM Fund.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị Thât (1815071320), a 45-year-old married mother of three adult-aged children, lives in the town of Đô Lương where she owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in this business for over 10 years, Mrs. Thât earns approximately 2000000 VND a month.

In 2008, she joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, Mrs. Thât is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is already 59 years old. She helps her husband manage their rice fields so that they develop a good harvest every cropping season. In connection with this, she is requesting loan assistance from Kiva amounting to PHP 24,000 to buy their needed farm inputs such as fertilizers, seed variety and some insecticide/pesticide. She is thankful that through ASKI, she learned about Kiva loans and has had an opportunity to have financial assistance for their field. 

Virginia hopes that Kiva lenders will grant their needed amount. Virginia further said that, through farming, they are able to surpass every economic crisis. However, due to the prevalent increase in the prices of farming inputs, and just to survive every difficulty of life, they used to depend on lending traders who charge high interest rates. She hopes that through a Kiva loan, which is more favorable than loans from other traders, she and her husband will soon have a better harvest.

loans.use: To buy their needed farm inputs such as fertilizers, seed variety and some insecticide/pesticide

loans.name: Juana Brigida

texts.es: Juana Brígida Martínez S. tiene la edad de 41 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Juana tiene 10 años de tener su negocio. El dio inicio con una pequeña vitrina en donde coloco galletas, pan, caramelos y repostería. Por lo que sus clientes llegaban en busca de nuevos productos. Con las pocas ganancias que Juan obtenía logro comprar más utilidades, y empezó a modificar su vivienda ya que no tenía suficiente espacio. Y así decide establecer la pulpería en donde ofrece productos de uso frecuente. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, jugos y gaseosas. El sueño de Juana es  establecer otra pulpería para que sus hijos se hagan cargo.
texts.en:
Juana Brígida Martínez S. is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has been operating a grocery store for 10 years. When she started, she only had a small display case filled with cookies, bread, candy and pastries. Soon her customers wanted to find new products. With what little earnings she had, she bought more useful items and remodeled her shop because there wasn’t enough space. She then decided that her store be stocked with the most frequently used items.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy candy, bread, natural sodas, juices and soft drinks. Juana hopes to open another store for her children to run.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells sarongs and fufu (made out of cassava). She is 49 years old and she has 6 children. Felicia is requesting the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs and cassava to sell. She say thanks you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and cassava

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 04 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el jr. Titicaca.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para comprar ropa. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar ropa de adultos, jóvenes y niños en todas las tallas.

Su deseo es mejorar y agrandar su negocio.

A ella le gustan los ahorros  y los encuentros entre los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Leonor belongs to the Santiago Apostol Communal Bank which is located in the Paucarcolla District, San Roman Province, Puno Department. She is 58 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children. She has completed junior high school. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 4 years; her first loan being 300 new soles which she used to buy clothing. She now needs a loan of 2000 new soles to purchase clothing in all sizes for children, adults, and young adults. Her goal is to improve and enlarge her business. She enjoys saving money and the meetings among the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children and young adult clothing.

loans.use: To grow maize

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge Alberto Guzmán, tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en el barrio Monimbo, ubicado en Masaya, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , de 18 y 16 años estudiantes universitarios ,los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ;  don Jorge desde hace 21 años se dedica a darle mantenimientos a Audio, el inicio este negocio con sus propios esfuerzos , Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales para la reparación de Parlantes. Y poder dar siempre una buena atención a los clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con el préstamo ya que a través de ellos ha logrado comprar los productos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto G. is 43 years old, lives in the Monimbo neighborhood in Masaya with his wife and two children. His wife helps with household expenses and his children, 18 and 16 years old, are university students. His goal is to improve his family's living conditions. For the past 21 years Jorge has worked repairing audio equipment, an enterprise he began on his own. With this loan, he intends to buy material used in repairing speakers in order to provide his customers with better service. He thanks Afodenic for the help it's given him through this loan since it has allowed him to purchase the materials needed for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase speakers and other equipment

Su deseo es continuar trabajando. A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Santiago Apostol Communal Bank which is in the Paucarcolla district of San Roman Province, Puno Department. She is 45 years old, married and has 7 children. She has not gone to school. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 6 years and her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used to buy sheep. At the present time, she requires a loan of 200 new soles to buy bread, soft drinks and snacks. Her goal is to continue working. She enjoys her savings and the training seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These people are Isatu M., Baby B., Adama K., and Isatu S.. They named their group 'Tasuthekeh'. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, their businesses will grow, sales and profit will improve. Consequently, their standard of living will also improve.

Isatu M. is the leader of this group. Isatu is now forty years of age. She is married with four children. One of her children is now in secondary school and the other three are in primary schools. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells cucumbers.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Santos Demetrio

texts.es: El señor Santos Demetrio M. Hernández, tiene la edad de 61 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, ubicado en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene seis hijos , ya todos casados e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Santos desde hace 41 años , se dedica a  la agricultura el inicio esta actividad agrícola con esfuerzos propios , los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una mejor producción, lo cual espera vender a buen precio en el M. y obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Demetrio M. H. is 61 years old, lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood, located in the Ticuantepe community. He shares his home with his wife who helps with the household expenses. They have 6 children, all of whom are married and independent. His present goal is to improve his family's living conditions. For the past 41 years he has been involved in agriculture, an activity which he began with his own resources. His plans now are to diversify his crops. With this loan he intends to buy raw materials and fertilizers which he will use to improve production which he hopes to be able to sell at a better market price thereby obtaining greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and fertilizers to improve his crops.

loans.name: Ephraim Plus Group

texts.fr: Henriette B. est vendeuse des haricots, épices, et divers devant sa maison dans la partie nordique et la plus peuplée de Kinshasa. Son savoir faire et la bonne gestion ont fait prospérer son activité commencée avec un sac d’arachides comme capital initial. Aujourd’hui, Henriette est membre fidèle d’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Ephraïm Plus ». Elle compte développer son affaire avec les prêts reçus de Hope RDC. Le prochain crédit lui permettra d’acheter des articles pour renforcer le stock. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $50 par semaine. Son rêve est d’acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Henriette a 49 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont trois entre eux fréquentent l’école.
texts.en:
Henriette B. is a seller of beans, spices, and various other goods in front of her house in the northern and most populated area of Kinshasa. Her know-how and the right management practices are behind the prosperity of her business, which she started with a sack of peanuts as initial capital. Today, she is a loyal member of a Hope RDC group named "Ephraïm Plus". She intends to develop her business with the loans received from Hope RDC. The next loan will enable her to buy goods for bolstering her inventory. Currently her business generated a profit of $50 a week. Her dream is to buy a parcel of land for her children. Henriette is 49 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Three of them attend school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items for bolstering her stock of merchandise

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mme Essi M. est née en 1976 à Ati-Séva et vit actuellement à Wonougba avec ses deux (02) enfants et son mari. Elle est revendeuse de bouillie de maïs et de beignets dans son village. Elle est très appréciée par ses consommateurs pour la qualité et la propreté qui entourent son activité. Malheureusement elle ne dispose pas de moyens financiers suffisant pour constituer le stock des matières qui entre dans la préparation de ses mets. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour constituer un stock important de maïs, acheter du sucre et de la farine de blé afin de pouvoir mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Essi M. was born in 1976 in Ati-Séva and currently lives in Wonougba with her two children and husband. She is a seller of cornmeal porridge and fritters in her village. She is much appreciated by consumers for the quality and cleanliness all about her business. Unfortunately, she lacks sufficient financial means to build up a stock of ingredients for making her meals. This is why she is requesting financing, so as to establish a major stock of corn and to buy sugar and flour in order to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell porridge

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
Here are members of 'Oneness'group. They are local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo town, about twenty-two miles from Freetown. Business has been developing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs due to the lack of sufficient capital. With the opening of an SMT branch office in Waterloo, in partnership with Shine on Sierra Leone, these women have applied for a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. 

Abibatu C. (right) is the leader of Oneness group. Abibatu is now age forty-nine. She was born in Bintin, in northern Sierra Leone. Her husband is already retired. They have two children; one is a nurse and the other a businessman. Abibatu sells food. She sells fried rice, chicken etc. She has been a businesswoman for over thirty years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Seferina Apolinaria

texts.es:
La señora Seferina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 55 años de edad, estado civil viuda, es madre de 06 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (1er grado),  vive en la Comunidad Collana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, harina, conservas, etc. para surtir su tienda.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos  y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Seferina belongs to the Santiago Apostol Communal Bank which is located in the Paucarcolla Province of San Roman, Puno Department. She is 55 years old, widowed and mother of 6 children. She completed first grade and lives in the Collana Community. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 2 years; her first loan of 300 new soles being used to buy groceries. She now requires a 1700 new soles loan to purchase sugar, rice, milk, pasta, canned goods, etc. to stock her store. Her goal is to continue to work. She is pleased with the ease of her loans and the training seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, milk, pasta, flour, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell porridge

loans.name: Nyame Ye Baako Group

texts.en:
Farouk is forty-one years old. He is married and has four children. He is a butcher. He runs a butcher shop. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame ye baako’ which literally means 'God is One'. He is the man standing in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Rolando Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Rolando Concepción R. O. , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio La borgoña en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, el es soltero , habita con sus hermanas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Rolando desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que afectan al cultivo , él inicio está actividad con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes futuro hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Sr. Rolando Concepción R. O. is 38 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of La Borgoña in the Ticuantepe community. He is single and lives with his sisters. He hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

Don Rolando has been farming since he was 21 years old. He started this business with own resources. His future plans include diversifying the types of crops grown on his land. With his loan he will purchase farming supplies and fertilizers necessary for him to obtain a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to increase production

loans.name: Delfina De La Luz

texts.es: Delfina nació en agua blanca Jutiapa el 12 de octubre de 1,958 tiene 50 años de edad y 5 hijos 4 varones y una mujer el mayor tiene 30 años y la menor tiene 22 el mayor de sus hijos ya es casado y los menores viven con ella, el esposo de doña Delfina se fue al extranjero para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y les manda remesas hace 8 años inicio su negocio de tortillas con 1 arroba de maíz y  torteaba con leña así fue subiendo su ingreso y aumentando clientes, actualmente tortea con 1 quintal de maíz diario y  utiliza gas propano solicita un préstamo de Q7,000.00, para comprar una estufa industrial y un fogón para coser su maíz y de esa manera generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Delfina was born in Agua Blanca Jutiapa on October 12, 1958 and is 50 years old. She has 5 children – 4 sons and 1 daughter. The oldest is 30 years old, while the youngest is 22 years old. Most of her children are married, but the younger ones still live with her. Doña Delfina’s husband works abroad to help pay for their children’s education expenses. He has been sending home remittances for 8 years.

She started her tortilla business with only 1 sack (11.5 kg) of corn and some firewood. From that point, she started generating an income and attracting customers. She now goes through 46 kg of corn each day and is cooking with propane gas. Doña Delfina is requesting a loan of 7000 QTZ ($875 USD) to buy an industrial stove and a firebox for roasting corn. She hopes this will help generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, an industrial oven and a firebox

loans.name: Wellington Muslim Ass. Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Wellington Muslim Ass. Primary School, Waterloo. This school was set up in 2001 by Wellington Muslim Association and the Lumpa community people. The school has a total of nine staff and 650 pupils.

SMT in partnership with Shine on Sierra Leone gives out loans to teachers and other monthly wage earners to help them invest in something meaningful since their meager salaries cannot let them do so. Some of these teachers use such loans to invest in business, in order to complete their monthly salaries; or they invest in their wives’ businesses. Some use such loans to pay school fees for their children or for themselves, to pursue further studies. From their monthly salaries, the school’s bursar repays SMT on their behalf.

Abu K. (second from left) is a teacher and head of games and sports at the school. Abu is aged twenty-seven, single with one child. He was born in Joe Town about twenty-six miles from Freetown. Abu has been a teacher for three years now. With this loan, he will invest in business.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Leonarda Avelina

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Paucarcolla, Provincia D. San Román, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 03 hijos y no tiene estudios.  Vive en la Comunidad D. Collana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado menor para engorD..

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y vender  ganado al por mayor.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos  las reuniones y las charlas D. capacitación.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonarda belongs to the communal bank group “Santiago Apóstol ", which is located in the Paucarcolla District of San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She did not finish school. She lives in the community of Collana.

Sra. Leonarda has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase young farm animals. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 600 soles to purchase calves for fattening.

She hopes to continue working and selling cattle at wholesale. She enjoys the ease of her loans, the communal bank meetings, and the training lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for fattening

loans.name: Asaase Wura Group

texts.en:
Theresa is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She is a petty trader. She sells jewelry. She hawks her wares in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well. Theresa is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Asaase Wura’ which literally means 'land owner'. She is seated first from the right in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 67 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 06 hijos (todos ya con familia) y tiene estudios de segundaria incompleta (3er grado),  vive en Av. Puno 501.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su compra de ropa. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ropa para adultos en todas las tallas.

Su deseo es agrandar su negocio para generar mas ganancias.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Teodora belongs to the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank located in the District of Paucarcolla, in San Román Province, in the Puno Region. She is 67 years old and the married mother of 6 children (who all have their own families). She completed her 3rd year of secondary school. She lives at Av. Puno 501.
She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost a year. She started with a 300 PEN loan to purchase clothing.
This time she needs a 1200 PEN loan to purchase clothing for adults in all sizes.
Her wish is to expand her business to generate more profits.
She likes the savings she makes with her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Look To Me Group

texts.en:
These people are Isatu A. K., Rugiatu K., and Makiya B.. They named their group "Look To Me". They are all local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town about twenty-two miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

Isatu A. K. (middle) is the leader of the group. Isatu is now age forty-one. She was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Three are in secondary school and one is still not of school-going age. Isatu sells pepper, foofoo (a staple food made out of cassava), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and other market food in Waterloo. She has been a businesswoman for more than twelve years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: El señor Julián O. M., tiene la edad de 48 años, habita en el barrio San José Los Ríos, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , todos adolescentes , los cuales estudian y trabajan con el en sus tiempos libres , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 20 años , don  Julián se dedica a la agricultura,  el inicio esta actividad  con ayuda de la reforma agraria , los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder tener una buena producción para vender a buen precio al M.. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras a sus cultivo lo que lograra buenos beneficios.
texts.en:
Julián O. M. is 48 years old and lives with his wife, who works and helps him cover household expenses, in the San José Los Rios neighbourhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. They have three adolescent children who attend school and work in their free time. He plans to improve his family’s living conditions.
Julián has worked in agriculture for 20 years. He started out with the help of agrarian reform. He plans to diversify his crops.
With this loan, he will purchase fertilsers and supplies to produce a good yield to sell at a good price in the market. He thanks AFODENIC for making these beneficial improvements on his farm possible.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and fertiliser

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.en:
Junie L. is a 23-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her family in a slum in Puerta Plata. She is originally from Haiti, but moved to the Dominican Republic with her husband in search of a better life. The Dominican Republic boasts a much higher standard of living and per capita GDP (gross domestic product) than Haiti. Even so, there is a great deal of racism toward Haitians, who tend to find themselves working at menial jobs if they are lucky enough to find work at all. Junie has been struggling to adapt to the new culture and language in Puerta Plata.

Junie and her husband live with their children, Ricardo and John Pierre, who are 8 and 5 years old. The children attend a local school where they study hard to make good grades. Junie ultimately hopes to enroll her children into a university, but her income is not currently sufficient to harbor such a dream. She makes 2,000 DRP a month (about 57 USD), but thinks she will be able to significantly increase her earnings through Esperanza.

Junie plans to use her loan to start a small restaurant in her home. She says that she will cook rice, beans, chicken, and beef, which are some of the staples of the Dominican diet. She will buy the raw materials from a local food vendor in her neighborhood. Ultimately, Junie would like to open a fully-fledged restaurant in a busier section of Puerta Plata. That goal is a long way off, but the determination in Junie’s eyes suggests it is a definite possibility. Your contribution will help Junie make the first step to turn her aspirations into reality.

loans.use: To purchase food and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old. She is a married woman with four children, and all her children are in school. Mary works hard to help her husband to provide food for the children. Because of the hard work she is admired by many people. She has been a baker for five years now. She bakes bread and supplies it to her customers who come to buy in bulk.

She supplies it by herself, sometimes in the market center to her customers. She has managed to increase her market share through hard work and commitment. Her only problem now has to do with inadequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. With the loan she wants to buy sugar, flour, margarine, yeast, firewood etc. so that she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 70 years old; she is married and the mother of ten children. Currently all her children are on their own doing their individual work. She is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She gets her stock of cow meat from the surrounding villages and supplies it to her customers. She started her business ten years ago to help her dear husband who is not actively working.

Martha depends on her limited capital to buy a little meat; she is worried because she is not able to pick up enough to sell. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory. And she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Calixta Celia

texts.es:
La señora Calixto, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios de primaria completa. Vive en la Av. Panamericana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para su la compra de golosinas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, etc.

Su deseo es darle una profesión a su hijo.

A ella le gusta la  facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Calixto belongs to the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank which is located in the Paucarcolla district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 42 years old, married, and has 1 child. She completed elementary schools and lives on Panamericana Avenue. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan was for S/.300.00 which she used to buy candy. Today she needs a loan for s/.2000.00 Nuevos Soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, chocolates, caramels, soda pop, etc. Her wish is to provide an education for her child. She likes how the loans help her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, chocolates, caramels, soda pop, etc.

loans.name: Nyame Ye Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She is a petty trader. She sells tubers of yam. She sells in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well.

Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Ye’ which literally means 'God is good'. She is the fair woman in middle foreground of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 23 years old; she is married and the mother of two young boys. They are in school in the community. She dropped out of school as a result of financial challenges but she is working hard to see that her children make it to the expected level. She believes that can be done through hard work and selfless commitment.

Emelia is a petty trader and sells beef. She started the business with a small capital given to her by her husband. She needed extra capital to buy more but when she approached her husband for more, she was denied. Meanwhile her market is doing well, so she is requesting the loan to travel to Kumasi to purchase good quality beef to retail to her customers. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of beef

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La señora Florencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa,  vive en jr. Santa Bárbara 314.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio de preparación de comidas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, gas y verduras para su restaurante.

Su deseo es agrandar su restaurante.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos  y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank located in the Paucarcolla district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children, and has completed primary school. She lives at Santa Bárbara 314. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan for S/.300.00 soles was used for her food business. Today she needs a loan for S/.500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, fuel, and vegetables for her restaurant. Her wish is to enlarge her restaurant. She likes the support she receives from her loans and the Communal Bank’s meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, fuel, and vegetables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old; she is divorced and the mother of five children. Three are schooling, one is breastfeeding currently. She divorced when her husband got another woman and now all the family responsibility is on her shoulders.

Agnes is a petty trader selling costume jewelry; she gets her stock of goods from Kumasi. She sells through hawking, that is, house is house selling. She mostly complains of the stress that she goes through to sell. She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry in bulk to increase her stock. It is her dream to make enough profits to provide educational support to the children and also to rent a store.

loans.use: To buy assorted earrings to sell

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en la Av. Puno.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, para su tienda de venta de abarrotes.

Su deseo es surtir mejor su tienda y mejorar sus ingresos.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Esmerald belongs to the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank located in the Paucarcolla district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 23 yers old, married with 1 son, and has completed secondary school. She lives on Puno Avenue. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan for S/.300.00 soles was used to buy groceries. Today she needs a loan for S/.500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles for her grocery store. Her wish is to better stock her store and increase her income. She likes the support she receives from her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles to stock her store

loans.name: Yovani Francisco

texts.es: El señor Yovani Francisco Gutiérrez, tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio ,Buenos  Aires , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos , un varón de un año y una niña de cuatro años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , desde hace un años trabaja como chofer en una casa particular ,la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para construir su vivienda , con el primer Préstamo hizo parte de sala y ahora con el segundo va hacer las divisiones , don Yovani se siente contento ya que le hemos brindado la mano para realizar sus sueños .Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para comprar los materiales y comenzar a construir.
texts.en:
Mr. Yovani Francisco Gutiérrez is 36 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood of Ticuantepe with his wife who works and supports him around the home. They have two children, a 1 year old son and a 4 year old daughter. He plans to improve his family’s home. He has been working as a driver for a private home for a year. The greatest difficulty he has is that his salary isn’t sufficient to build his home. With his first loan he built part of the living room and now with the second he is going to make walls. Yovani feels content that we have provided him a hand in making his dreams come true. With the loan he is going to buy construction materials to begin building.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Antonieta Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta Sabina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito D. Paucarcolla, Provincia D. San Román, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 06 hijos (2 a su cargo) y tiene estudios superiores (ing. Agronómica). Vive en la Av. Tupac Amaru.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para comprar insumos para su restaurante. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 900.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado mayor para producción D. leche y queso.

Su deseo es poner un establo y producir al por mayor quesos.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Antonieta Sabina is a member of the Santiago Apostol Communal Bank located in the Paucarcolla District, San Roman Province, Puno Department. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 6 children, two of whom are still dependent on her. She has advanced studies (Agronomy). She lives on Tupac Amaru avenue. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 5 years; her first loan of 300 new soles being used to purchase raw materials for a restaurant. At this time, she needs a 900 new soles loan to buy mature cattle for the production of milk and cheese. Her goal is to establish a stable and produce cheeses wholesale. She enjoys the ease of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with four children. She is a 30-year-old trader who believes in hard work and is dedicated to her work. She sees it as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and is very serious with her business. 

Janet trades in foodstuffs like plantain, maize and cassava. She started this business three years ago and trades them at the community market. Through this she has been very resourceful to her family.

Janet wants to use the loan to buy a large enough supply of plantain, cassava and maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She dreams of seeing her business grow to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize, plantains and cassava

loans.name: Erick Miguel

texts.es: El señor Erick Miguel B. C. , tiene la edad de 35 años , habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace un año trabaja para la empresa CLARO como agente de venta , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para comprar materiales de construcción , lo cual opto por un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder hacer las mejoras a su vivienda para poder estar en mejores condiciones. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con lo prestamos ya que podrá hacer sus proyecciones.
texts.en:
Mr. Erick Miguel B. C. is 35 years old. He lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood which is in the municipality of Ticuantepe, with his wife, who is employed and contributes to household expenses. They have a son. Their plans are to improve their family's living conditions and the greatest obstacle to overcome is that their salaries are not enough to allow for the purchase of building materials to improve their home thus the need for this loan. He thanks the institution for the help it gives through these loans in that they will allow him to complete his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old. She is married and is the mother of one child who is a boy. Her child attends school in the community where she lives with her husband.

Ruth is a trader and sells vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. in the main community market. She sells her goods on her table. She always works hard to meet her target and, through that, she has acquired lots of marketing and selling experience.

Ruth buys her goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She is requesting the loan to buy lots of cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions, etc. With the loan she wants to buy in bulk to avoid a vegetable shortage.

loans.use: To buy vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Chua Chua”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chua Chua, distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Ancoputo sector Gojicha.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de sogas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, ella pretende utilizar el 50% para la compra de naylon para la elaboración de sogas, y la otra mitad para la compra de ganado menor.

Su deseo es poder darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros las charlas y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the Santa Cruz de Chua Chua Communal Bank which is located in the Chua Chua Community, Zepita district, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 40 years old, married and has three children. She completed elementary school and lives in the Ancoputo Community, Gojicha sector. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 2 years; her initial 300 new soles loan being used to purchase rope. He goal is to provide her children with an education. She likes the savings and the meetings between Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nylon for rope manufacture and young livestock.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old. She is divorced and is the mother of five children who are currently in school.

For the past three years now, Gladys has operated a clothing shop, selling jeans-clothes, blouses and skirts, women’s slippers, dress bags and underwear. However, she is constrained by not having sufficient funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress.

Gladys believes the loan will help her to be better resourced to purchase good quality clothes in large quantities to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans-clothes, ladies’ wear, etc.

loans.use: To purchase jeans-clothes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet prepares and sells pastries like doughnuts. She is 31 years old, married and a mother with four children who are currently in school. She has been in business seven years now, taking care of the family. In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to handle the demands of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials, as the price of raw materials has gone up. She requests the support of a loan to remain in business. With this loan, she believes she can provide for her family and save money for future eventualities. She says your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 04 hijos  y tiene estudios de primaria completa.  Vive en el Jr. Collado.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de golosinas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de harina para elaboración de pan.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de abarrotes al por mayor.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos y losa ahorros
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Santiago Apostol Communal Bank which is located in the Paucarcolla district, San Roman Province, Puno Department. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She completed elementary school. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 6 years; her initial 300 new soles loan being used to purchase snacks. At this time, she needs a 1000 new soles loan to purchase flour to bake bread. As a parallel activity she raises young livestock. Her goal is to open a wholesale grocery store. She likes the ease of loans and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria incompleta  (4to grado) y vive en la Parcialidad de Cosipiri.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor como ovinos para engorde.

Su deseo es comprarse una casa en Ilave.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Manuela de Hoy Communal Bank which is located in the Llave district, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She completed 4th grade of elementary school and lives in the Cosipiri neighborhood. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 3 years her initial 300 new soles loan being used to raise livestock. Her goal is to buy her own house in Llave. She enjoys the savings and the meetings between the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase young livestock.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 24 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband. She owns and operates a beauty saloon in her neighborhood. She is very skillful, innovative, creative and is a talented hairdresser. She always adds new style to her clients hair and, because of that, many like to have their hair done in her salon.

Yaa has been offering her service for four years now. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons (hair extensions), pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to serve her customers. With the loan she believes she will be better resourced to save more for the future as she does not currently have a child.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor.  También comprará cereales para luego ponerlos a la venta.

Su deseo es continuar con us negocio y poder vender por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros los encuentros y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Verónica belongs to the Manuela de Hoy Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 25, married, and she has two children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Parcialidad de Camicachi. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought small livestock. She now needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy small livestock. She will also buy grains to sell later. Her wish is to continue with her business and to be able to sell wholesale. She likes the savings, the meetings, and the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small livestock (sheep), and buy grains

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos. Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (4to grado), vive en el Centro poblado de Rosa CANI Sector Huancuni.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor, los cuales luego de mejorarlos (engordarlos) los venderá en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para cubrir los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Señora Maruja belongs to the “Manuela de Hoy” Community Bank which is located in Ilave district, in the Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She didn’t finish high school (got to 4th grade) and lives in the neighbourhood of Rosa CANI in Huancuni. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan of S/.300 soles was used to buy young animals. She now requires a loan of S/.700 soles to buy more young sheep which she will fatten and then sell at local markets. Her wish is to continue working so that she can meet her family’s expenses. She really enjoys the organisation’s meetings and training sessions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young sheep

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elizabeth O. G. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria.
Maria Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como talco, cremas, perfumes, labiales, etc, los cuales vende a sus amistades y familiares.
Con su primer crédito compró productos de belleza para tener en stock y vender con mayor facilidad.
Este crédito de S/. 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de conejos, los que criara para posteriormente venderlos.
Maria Elizabeth tiene como sueño tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elizabeth O. G. is 30 years old and lives in Moche district, Trujillo province, in the departament of La Libertad, Perú. She has studied up to fifth grade of high school. Maria Elizabeth sells beauty products such as talc, lotions, perfumes, and lipsticks to friends and relatives. She used her first loan to buy these products so she would have them in stock ready for sale. This new loan of S/.800 soles will be used to buy rabbits which she will then sell. Her dream is to open her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young rabbits

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La señora  Luz., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y es madre de 5 hijos  (dos a su cargo).  Tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu kilómetro 8 ½.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi medio año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la elaboración de artesanías en totora. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material totora y chillihua (plantas), para la fabricación de quesanas (tejas,calaminas), para vender el las ferias regionales.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y poder educar a sus hijos y verlos profesionales.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Señora Luz belongs to the “Las Totoritas” Community Bank which is located in Chimu, in the district of Puno, in Puno province, in the department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are dependent on her. Luz completed primary school and lives at kilometre 8½ in the community of Chimu. She has been with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for almost 6 months; her first loan of S/.500 soles was used in the making of crafts from totora, a locally grown reed. She is now asking for a loan of S/.1000 soles to buy more reeds and chillihua (a local plant) which she will use to make mats, tiles, and roofing to sell in the local markets. Her wish is to continue working so that she can provide an education for her children and see them obtain good jobs. Luz likes the simplicity of the loan process.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy reeds and chillhua (local plant)

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a businesswoman. She trades in kente clothes, linen and lace materials. Kente is a traditional-design cloth; it is purchased by the rich because of its value. Georgina has rented a store from which she trades.

Georgina is 48 years old and a married mother with six children. Three are schooling and three are working. She is very supportive to her family through her trading business.

Georgina has been selling for the past seven months but progress has persistently been slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive her business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase kente clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase kente clothes in bulk to increase her inventory

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora  Tomasa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil viuda y es madre de 9 hijos.  No tiene estudios, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Es socia nueva, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pinesa utilizar en la compra de totoa y chillihuas, material que se utiliza para la elaboración de artesanías y quesanas (tejas,calaminas).

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Tomasa belongs to the Las Totoritas Community Bank, which is located in the Chimu community, Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is a 56 year old widow, and she has nine children. She does not have an education. She lives in the Chimu Central community. She is a new member. She needs a loan of 500 PEN to buy totora (a regional plant) and chillihua wood. This is the material she will use to make her handicrafts and “quesanas” (a type of rush mat). Her wish is to keep working to pay the family expenses. She likes the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy totora and chillihua (plants)

loans.name: Odo Ne Ye Group

texts.en:
Serwaa is forty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children. She is a trader and trades in mineral water (soft drinks). She sells in a store in her community.

Serwaa is the leader of a trust bank group called “Odo ne ye” which literally means “It is good to love”. She is in the middle of the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She mostly sells through hawking - it is a personal selling method which she says makes her goods move very fast. She is 29 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are in school. She is supporting her family well with the proceeds she makes from her business. She has been selling for the past five years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and make more profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. She dreams of buying her own house from the savings she makes every day and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes to increase inventory

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (4to grado).  Vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara, Prolongación Av. El Niño.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de ropa americana.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de fardos (bultos) de ropa americana, para luego venderlos en los mercados de la zona.

Su deseo es seguir con el negocio y en un futuro cercano poner una tienda de ropa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad, además de los deportes que se dán en los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the 3 de Mayo Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 37, married, and she has three children. She has a fourth grade education. She lives in the Santa Bárbara neighborhood, Prolongación Av. El Niño. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought American clothes. She now needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy bundles of American clothes to later sell in the regional markets. Her wish is to keep on in her business. In the near future, she would like to set up a clothing store. (About her community bank) She likes the savings and the punctuality. She also likes the sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Senovia Antonia

texts.es: La señora Senovia Antonia R. R., tiene la edad de 37 años, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, desde hace nueve años doña Senovia trabaja para la D.G.I, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a construir su casa. Este es su segundo ciclo de préstamos y da las gracias por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Senovia Antonia R. R. is 37. She lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. She lives with her husband, and he helps with the household expenses. The family plan is to be able to finish construction on their house. Senovia has worked for the D.G. I. [General Directorate of Revenue] for nine years. Her biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. With this loan she will buy construction materials to begin construction on her house. This is her second loan cycle, and she is thankful for the benefits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve her house

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 4 hijos.  Gregoria tiene estudios de primaria completa y vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de cereales. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ropa americana, la misma que será vendida en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es comprarse un terreno en Ilave y luego con el tiempo construir, para poder vivir con sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la puntualidad y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the 3 de Mayo Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a 38 year old single mother of four children. Gregoria has an elementary school education. She lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy cereals. She now needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy American clothes. She will sell them at the regional fairs. Her wish is to buy a piece of land in Ilave and, in time, be able to live there with her children. (About her community bank) She likes the punctuality and the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 59 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija mayor, quien también es madre soltera, con su hijo que trabaja para apoyarla y una hija pequeña. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro que compró hace 2 años, el cual es manejado por su hijo quien se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años. Él vela por el mantenimiento del motocarro y todas las ganancias del día se las entrega a su madre para que ella las administre. Antonia se dedica a las labores domésticas y al cuidado de su hija menor quien tiene síndrome de dawn agresivo y necesita de permanente atención. Ella considera que lo bueno de su negocio es que su hijo es muy responsable y las ganancias son buenas. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes trabajan bien y son comprometidos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará llantas, repuestos y otras herramientas necesarias para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Antonia, 59, is a single mother. She lives with her oldest daughter, also a single mother, and her son. He works to support her and a small daughter. Antonia has a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart) that she bought two years ago. Her son drives it. He has been offering passenger transportation services for six years. He takes care of the maintenance of the motocarro. He gives her all of his daily earnings for her to manage. Antonia does all of the domestic chores. She also takes care of her youngest daughter who has severe Down’s Syndrome and needs constant attention. The good thing about her business is that her son is very responsible and the earnings are good. This is her third loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of the members work well and are committed. She will use the money she is asking for to buy tires, replacement parts, and the necessary tools to repair her motocarro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart)

loans.name: God Is Wonderful Group

texts.en:
Doris is a hairdresser by profession. Her salon is in her community. She is 24 years old, married and has a son. Doris is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God is wonderful’. In the group photograph, Doris is first on the right wearing a cap.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are asking for this loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 52 años, es casada y vive con sus 2 hijos quienes estudian carreras profesionales en una universidad de su región. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de chupetes y helados desde su casa, pero no es el único negocio que tiene, ya que también cuenta con un taller de carpintería en otra localidad a dos horas de su casa, donde su esposo es el carpintero y el encargado de fabricar los muebles, mientras ella los comercializa. En taller ya tiene un periodo de 30 años y les ha ido muy bien. Lo que le gusta a Bertha de sus actividades es que se mantiene ocupada, ya que por las mañanas está en su taller de carpintería y por las tardes en su casa vendiendo los chupetes, además ambos negocios le generan el dinero suficiente para solventar sus gastos. Para más adelante les gustaría tener un aserradero. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los miembros se conocen y hay bastante comunicación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más helados y chupetes en un monto de 100 soles, con lo restante adquirirá madera para fabricar más muebles.
texts.en:
Bertha is 52 and married. She lives with her two children who are studying for professional careers in the regional university. For two years she has been selling lollipops and ice cream from her house. But, that is not the only business she has. She also has a carpentry shop in another location, which is two hours from her house. Her husband is the carpenter, and he is in charge of making the furniture. She sells it. She has had the shop for 30 years, and it has gone very well for them. What Bertha likes about her activities is that they keep her busy. In the mornings she is in her carpentry shop, and in the afternoon she is in her house selling the lollipops. Also, both businesses generate enough income to pay their expenses. Later on she would like to have a sawmill. This is her seventh loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of the members know each other and there is good communication. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more ice cream and lollipops for 100 PEN. With the rest of the money she will buy wood to make furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda tiene 45 años, vive con su pareja quien es profesor y sus 3 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos aún estudiantes y el mayor soltero y trabaja. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a confeccionar ropa sólo para niños y niñas, labor que realiza en su propia casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes regulares tienen mucha confianza hacia su buena labor y la recomiendan con otras personas, por lo que le es rentable. Adicionalmente y aprovechando que su vivienda se encuentra en una zona bastante transitada, por las noches vende comida en la parte de afuera de su casa, negocio con el cual también obtiene buenas ganancias. Posteriormente, Gilda quiere alquilar un local para implementar una tienda de ropa. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus cuotas y muy solidarios. Con el dinero que solicita comprará telas, hilos, cierres y demás material textil que le servirá para confeccionar ropa y llevarla a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona.
texts.en:
Gilda is 45. She lives with her significant other, a professor, and their three children. Two of them are students, and the oldest is single and works. She has been making clothes for boys and girls for eighteen years. She works in her own house. What she likes about her work is that her regular customers have a lot of confidence in her good work, and they recommend her to other people. That is very profitable. Also, she takes advantage of the fact that her house is in a well traveled area, and in the evenings she sells food in front of her house. She also gets good income from this business. Later, Gilda wants to rent a location to set up a clothing store. This is her eighth loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of her colleagues make their payments, and they are very unified. She will use the money she is asking for to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other textile materials to make clothes. She will take them to sell at different places in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Gladis
