texts.es: Gladis tiene 50 años, es madre de 3 hijos; 2 de ellos mayores de edad, trabajan y la apoyan en lo posible, y el menor que es estudiante. Su esposo es agricultor y todos habitan en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a brindar servicios de costura de ropa, y está al pendiente de quedar bien con sus clientes para que se sientan satisfechos de su buena labor. Gladis considera que su negocio es rentable porque cuenta con una gama de clientes regulares que aprecian su trabajo y la recomiendan con otras personas; además, por encontrarse cerca de una institución educativa aprovecha de vender jugos de fruta en la parte de afuera de su casa y le va muy bien. Para más adelante, Gladis quisiera tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y existe mucho compañerismo entre ellos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales textiles para confeccionar diferentes prendas, calcula que gastará 500 soles, con la diferencia adquirirá materiales de construcción para mandar a reparar algunas estructuras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gladis is 50, and she has three children. Two of her children are grown, and they work and support her as much as possible. Her younger child goes to school. Her husband is a farmer and they all live together in their own house. For ten years she has been working as a seamstress. She makes sure to take good care of her customers so that they are satisfied with her good work. Gladis considers the business to be profitable because she has a good range of regular customers who appreciate her work and recommend her to other people. Also, she takes advantage of being close to an educational institution by selling fruit juice in front of her house. This is going very well. In the future Gladis would like to have a business selling groceries. This is her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of the members are responsible and there is much camaraderie among them. With the money she is asking for she will buy textile materials to make different articles of clothing, which she calculates will cost 500 PEN. With the rest of the money she will buy construction materials to make some repairs on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textile materials and fix her house

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en:
Angelina is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. She is a trader and runs a provision store. She has her store on the street in her community. Angelina is the leader of a trust bank group called “Jesus is Lord”. She is first from the left in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the hearts’ desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 58 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 07 hijos y no tiene estudios,  vive en la Comunidad de Sales Grande Sector Caballo Silla Condoriri Ilave.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor para engorde, los cuales los adquiere en las comunidades de la zona, luego los vende en la feria de Ilave

Su deseo es seguir con el negocio y comprar más ganado para cría.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the 3 de Mayo Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 58, married, and she has seven children. She does not have an education. She lives in the Sales Grande community, Sector Caballo, Silla Condoriri Ilave. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought regional products. She now needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy small livestock to fatten. She gets them from the communities in her area, and she later sells them in the Ilave fair. Her wish is to continue with the business and to buy more livestock to raise. (About her community bank) She likes the savings and the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock to fatten

loans.name: Adepa Wo Fie Group

texts.en:
Felicia is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. She is a trader and runs a provision store. She has her store on the street in her community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called “Adepa wo fie” which literally means “One’s household has something good to boast about”. She is fair in complexion and fourth from the left in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the hearts’ desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente de la municipalidad de su localidad, y ambos tienen 2 hijos que cursan estudios primarios. Desde hace 5 años posee 4 motocarros, para los que contrata chóferes particulares para que se dediquen al transporte de pasajeros. Lo bueno es que estas personas mantienen sus vehículos en buen estado y son confiables. Además, el negocio es muy rentable porque dentro de la zona donde trabajan la gente prefiere movilizarse en un motocarro que en otro vehículo. Pero, la dificultad que tiene es que no cuenta con un lugar apropiado para guardar sus motocarros para que estén seguros durante la noche. Adicionalmente, Hilda es vendedora de productos de belleza desde hace 6 meses, negocio con el que está obteniendo ganancias extras para su familia; y para más adelante, le gustaría tener una tienda de comestibles, ya que no hay una cercana por donde vive. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está contenta en su banco comunal porque todos son personas responsables y pagan sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para reparar y hacer mantenimiento a sus motocarros para que laboren sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Hilda is 34 years old and lives with her husband, an employee of the local municipality, and their 2 children in primary school. For 5 years she has owned 4 motorcars, with which she contracts particular drivers to transport passengers. The good thing is that these people maintain their vehicles in good condition and are reliable. In addition, the business is very profitable because within the zone where they work people prefer to move in motorcars than in another vehicle. But, the difficulty that she has is that she does not have an appropriate place to keep her vehicles so that they are safe during the night. Additionally, Hilda has been a seller of beauty products for 6 months, a business with which she is obtaining extra income for her family; and moving forward, she would like to have a grocery store, since there is no store nearby. This is her second loan with MFP and she is happy with her community bank because each person is responsible and pays their quotas on time. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy spare parts to repair and maintain her motorcars so that they function without difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle Repairs

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Don Sergio M. de 42 años de edad, es casado, con 3 hijos, el mayor de 22 años, la segunda de 20 y un niño de 9 años, unicamente tiene a su cargo al mas pequeño puesto que los 2 mayores son casados.  Se desempeña como operario de limpieza en la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa desde hace 17 años; actualmente esta solicitando su primer credito para terminar con la construccion de un cuarto para que su hija pueda habitar con su esposo y gozar de mayor privacidad y comodidad en el patio de su casa, ya tiene levantadas las paredes, pero le falta poner el techo, embaldozar y poner las puertas.  El mayor sueño de don Sergio es poder apoyar a sus hijos en lo que mas pueda, pues es la unica herencia que puede dejarles.
texts.en:
42-year old Sergio M. is married and has three children; the eldest is 22, the second is 20, and the youngest is 9. Only his son, the 9-year old, is still dependent on him as the two older children are married. Sergio has worked as a cleaner in Juigalpa’s town hall for seventeen years. He is asking for his first loan to finish the construction of a bedroom in the yard of his house so that his daughter and her husband can enjoy more privacy and comfort. He has already built the walls, but the room lacks a roof, which will need tiling, and also doors. Sergio’s greatest dream is to be able to support his children in whatever way he can as that is the only gift he can bequeath them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a tiled roof

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo, su hija menor (17 años), su hija mayor y su pareja, y su nieto; todos viven es su casa, que es propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de chupetes, helados, jugos, néctar y gaseosas, negocio que atiende en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas. Lo que le gusta es se mantiene activa, por lo que se esmera en dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Además considera que le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada cerca de una institución educativa y sus principales clientes son los estudiantes. Para un futuro cercano a Isabel le gustaría tener una heladería para incrementar sus ganancias y progresar con su negocio. Con MFP ya tiene 5 créditos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes demuestran mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será usado para la compra de más chupetes, helados, jugos, néctar, etc. y de esa manera seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
49-year old Isabel lives with her husband, a younger daughter aged 17, an older daughter and her husband, and her grandson. They live together in Isabel’s house which she owns. For two years she has sold popsicles, ice cream, fruit drinks and juices, and soft drinks from a business located in her home. Her daughters help her with this work. Isabel loves to be active and she goes to a lot of trouble to ensure that her customers are well looked after. She believes her business is a good one as it is located near an educational institution and her main customers are students. In the short term, Isabel would like to open an ice-cream store to increase her profits and expand her business. She has previously had five loans with Kiva partner, MFP, and the part she enjoys about being with the community bank is that all the members show a lot of responsibility and repay their loans on time. The loan will be used to buy more popsicles, ice cream, fruit drinks and juices etc. so that she can continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Jamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jamileth, de 33 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, trabaja como secretaria de actuaciones en el poder judicial de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años, esta solicitando su primer credito a esta institucion para poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda, como es ponerle el cielo razo, ya que en el invierno aparecen muchos insectos que pueden ser perjudiciales para su pequeña hija, ademas desea comprar e instalar una puerta de mejor calidad que le brinda seguridad a su casa, ya que la que actualmente tiene se esta deteriorando. Sueña con darle a su hija las mejores condiciones que esten a su alcance pues es lo unico que puede dejarle para el futuro.
texts.en:
Jamileth, 33, is single, and she has a three year old daughter. For nine years she has worked as a secretary for judicial proceedings in Juigalpa. She is asking for her first loan to be able to make improvements to her home. She will put in a ceiling because in the winter there are a lot of insects that could be harmful to her small daughter. She also wants to buy and install a better quality door to make her house safer. The door she currently has is deteriorating. She dreams of giving her daughter the best living conditions that are within her reach to give her. It is the only thing that she can leave her for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a ceiling and a door

loans.name: Marly

texts.es: Marly tiene 37 años, tiene 5 hijos: 2 estudiantes y 3 que trabajan. También vive junto a su esposo quien ejerce diversos oficios, es agricultor, constructor y carpintero. La casa donde habitan es propia. Desde hace 14 años ella se dedica a la venta de plátanos y otras frutas regionales, negocio que atiende en la parte de afuera de su casa. Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es el contacto directo con las personas, a quienes les brinda un buen trato cuando se acercan a comprarle alguno de sus productos. Además, Marly considera que su negocio es rentable porque la producción de las frutas que vende es abundante y son consumidas diariamente las personas. Para más adelante quiere tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes, ya que sus clientes están empezando a pedirle que venda otros productos comestibles. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP, menciona que lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes se apoyan mutuamente y son responsables en sus cuotas de pago. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas y plátanos, además mandará a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Marly is 37, and she has five children. Two are students, and three work. She also lives with her husband who works at different trades. He is a farmer, construction worker, and a carpenter. The house they live in is their own. For 14 years she has been selling bananas and other regional fruit. She tends this business in the front of her house. She likes this work because of the direct contact with people. She treats them well when they come to buy her products. Also, Marly considers her business to be profitable because fruit production is abundant where she lives, and people eat fruit every day. Later, she wants to have a business selling groceries. Her customers are starting to ask her to sell other food products. This is her sixth loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of the members support each other, and they are responsible about their payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more fruit and bananas. She will also build a kiosk to sell more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nereyda Isabel

texts.es: Nereyda Isabel es soltera, de 31 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, trabaja como responsable de recursos humanos en el Ministerio de Educacion desde hace 14 años, esta solicitando su 1er credito a AFODENIC para poder mejorar su casa, con el cambio de techo que esta en mal estado y en esta epoca de invierno se le mojan sus cosas, ademas si le ajusta desea poner la ceramica a la sala.  El mayor sueño es poder seguir mejorando su casa,para brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, pues la vivienda es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Nereyda Isabel is 31 and single. She has two children. She has worked for 14 years as head of Human Resources in the Ministry of Education. She is asking for her first loan with AFODENIC to be able to improve her house. She will change the ceiling, which is in bad shape. During the winter season things get wet. If she can, she would also like to put tile in the living room. Her biggest dream is to be able to keep improving her house to give her children better living conditions. The house is the inheritance she will leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the ceiling and put down tile

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: Brenda  de 38 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, 1 en edad pre-escolar y el otro que estudia primaria, se desempeña como asesor pedagogico en el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 9 años, esta solicitando su 1er credito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como es compra de 2 puertas para las habitaciones y tener mayor privacidad, ademas desea terminar de poner la ceramica a la sala de su casa.  Brenda es muy querida por sus compañeras de trabajo, sueña con poder tener una vivienda con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente alegre.
texts.en:
38-year old Brenda is single and has two children, a pre-schooler aged one and another child who goes to primary school. She has been working as an educational advisor in the Ministry of Education of Santo Tomas for nine years. This will be her first loan, and she plans to use the money to make improvements to her house such as buying two doors for the bedrooms so there is more privacy. She also wants to finish putting in ceramic tile on the floor of the living room. Brenda is much liked by her work colleagues. Her dream is to have a home with all the basic necessities so that her children can grow up in a nice environment.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to tile her living room floor and buy doors

loans.name: Aura Yesenia

texts.es: Aura Yesenia, es soltera, a pesar que no tiene hijos apoya a su mama con los gastos del hogar, trabaja como maestra de educacion primaria en Santo Tomas desde hace 7 años, esta solicitando su 1er credito a la institucion de AFODENIC para cambiarle el techo a su casa que esta dañado y con el invierno se le moja su casa, ademas desea poner la puerta de su dormitorio y si el dinero ajusta cambiar el piso de la sala que esta dañado.  Sueña con poder ir mejorando su casa y asi poder tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Aura Yesenia is single with no children and helps her mother with the household expenses. She has been a elementary school teacher in Santo Tomas for seven years. She is requesting her first loan with AFODENIC to replace her roof, which is damaged and leaks during the winter. In addition, she would like to put up a door for her bedroom and if there is money left, replace the floor in the room that had damage from the roof. She dreams of being able to improver her house to have better living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace roof and floor and install bedroom door

loans.name: Orlando Jesus

texts.es: El señor Orlando Jesús Galán F. , tiene la edad de 36 años , habita en el barrio La Francia , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto as u esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos , actualmente estudiantes de secundaria , en su tiempos libres le apoyan en la agricultura , desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes hacia su cultivo es poder tener una producción . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos el cual aplicara al cultivo para ver buenos resultados con la producción.
texts.en:
Orlando Jesús Galán F. is 36 years old and lives in the La Francia neighborhood, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with his wife that works and helps with the household expenses. They have three children, which are currently studying in secondary school. In their free time the work in agriculture and have been doing this for 13 years. The biggest difficultly that they face is the lack of financing. He started out with the support of his parents and his plans are to start having a harvest for production. With the loan they will buy fertilizers and other materials which they will apply to the crops to improve their harvest's yield.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and other materials for their crops to improve the harvest

loans.name: Kenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Kenia de 29 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos, esta solicitando su 1er credito para mejora de vivienda, para construir los servicios higienicos ya que actualmente le falta, desea ademas construir su cocina ya que no cuenta con ella.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar, a pesar que es un matrimonio joven y sin hijos, desean tener las mejores condiciones cuando vengan los hijos estos se crien en un ambiente de comodidades.
texts.en:
Kenia is 29 years old, married with no children. She is requesting her first loan to improve her house, putting in bathroom plumbing since she currently doesn't have it. In addition, she wants to build a kitchen since she doesn't have one. She has the support of her husband that assumes responsibility for the household expenses. Despite the fact that they are recently married and don't have children, they want to have better conditions so that when they have children they will grow up in a comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of bathroom plumbing and kitchen

loans.name: Darlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Darlene es casada, de 52 años de edad, se desempeña como maestra de educacion primaria en el Centro Escolar Simon Bolivar de Acoyapa con 30 años de servicio, su esposo tiene un negocio de venta de carne y asume con los gastos del hogar.  Darlene tiene 4 hijos, 2 son casados, solo tiene a su cargo los 2 menores, uno de 15 años que estudia la secundaria y una de 18 años que estudia la universidad.  Esta solicitando su primer credito para construir una acera en su casa, pues con el invierno se hace un charco, ademas quiere construir un sumidero y terminar una tapia que ya tiene levantada una parte de la pared para brindarle mayor seguridad a su propiedad.   Sueña con poder seguir mejorando su casa pues es el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Darlene is 52 years old and married. She works as an elementary school teacher in the Simon Bolivar de Acoyapa school center with 30 years of service. Her husband has a business selling meat and takes care of the household expenses. Darlene has 4 children, 2 of whom are married, and thus she only has 2 in the house, a 15 year-old son that is in secondary school and a 19 year-old daughter that is in college. She is requesting her first loan to build a sidewalk for her house, since in winter the area becomes a puddle. In addition, she wants to build a drain and finish a fence so that her property is more secure. She dreams of improving her house since it's ultimately for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of sidewalk, drain and fence for her house

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 8vo credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda y construir  los servicios Higienicos y poder tener mejores condiciones, labora como docente de la Escuela Mauricio Cajina vive  en la zona # 2  de Nueva Guinea, tiene dos hijos el mayor de 11 años estudia su 5to grado de educación primaria y la niña menor de 7 añitos estudia su 2do grado en el mismo colegio que Daysi trabaja, es una mujer  emprededora que se ha destacada por ser la mejor docente de educación primaria en el municipio de Nueva Guinea, ella se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer  optimista desde pequeña, ha luchado desde muy joven en el campo laboral, es reconocida por ser una mujer responsable, honesta,  trabajadora  con principios cristianos, su mayor sueño es tener un hogar digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Daysi is requesting her 8th loan to invest in home improvements and to construct bathrooms in her home, so she may have better living conditions. She currently works as a teacher in the Mauricio Cajina school. She lives in zone #2 of the town of New Guinea. She has 2 children, the oldest is 11 years old and is in 5th grade, and the youngest is 7 years old and is in 2nd grade at the school where Daysi works. Daysi is an enterprising woman and has stood out as one of the best teachers of primary school in the town of New Guinea. Daysi has been an optimist since she was young. She has always worked hard and is known for being very responsible, honest and hard working, with strong christian principles. Her dream is to have a dignified home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de servicios higienicos

loans.name: Progreso Hacia Adelante, Group 5

texts.en:
Progreso Hacia Adelante is a brand new Esperanza Bank of Hope from Consuelo, a town just outside of San Pedro de Macorís in the Dominican Republic. The group lives in a 'batey' community, a rural sugarcane plantation with very harsh living and working conditions. Fighting to overcome such challenges, these new entrepreneurs are seeking to take out their first microloan to develop their exciting business ideas and improve their lives and their families' lives.

Miguelina B. is the coordinator of one group within Progreso Hacia Adelante. She is 21 years old and is a single mother with three kids, ages six, five, and five months. She lives in a small house with her mother and her children. Until now she has had unsteady work substituting at the local school that two of her children attend.

Despite her difficult circumstances, she is enthusiastic and optimistic about the future. With the money from her loan she will start a new business selling food supplies. The first items she plans to carry include rice, beans, cooking oil, and snack items like crackers and candy. More than anything, she wants to provide for her children so they can continue their education and fulfill their dreams. She also wishes to finish her own education, and talks excitedly about someday learning to use a computer, opening her own bank account, and using an ATM.

Please support Miguelina and the rest of her group as they work to support their families and better their lives!

loans.use: buying rice, cooking oils, beans, snack items for resale

loans.name: Desnic Maria

texts.es: La clienta Desnic está solicitando su 3er  crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejoras de su casa de habitación, como es repellar la casa y hecharle el piso, labora como docente de la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce de  Nueva Guinea desde hace 6 años, es una joven que todavia no ha tenido la oportunidad de tener un hijo pero su sueño es terminar de constriur su casa para que cuando llegue su primer hijo brindarle condiciones, es una mujer con alto espitud de superación, siendo una joven que aspira terminar su carrera,  se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable, honesta,  esta clienta ha realizado poco a poco las mejora de su vivienda, con los crédito que ha recibido por la institución,  su sueño es  tener estabilidad laboral salud  y una vivienda  digna en su comunidad ,  para ser feliz en su  su nucleo familiar, ella espera ser beneficiada nuevamente por la institución de AFODENIC.
texts.en:
Desnic is requesting her third loan from AFODENIC to make improvements in her house, including plastering a wall and making a floor. She has worked as a teacher in the Francisco Aaron Joce School in Nueva Guinea for 6 years. She is young and hasn’t had the opportunity to have a child, but her dream is to finish building her house, so that when she has her first child, she can offer him good conditions. She is a woman with the drive to improve and aspires to finish her career. She is characterized as a responsible and honest woman. She has been able to improve her house little by little with the loans that she has received from AFODENIC. Her dreams are to have job security, good health, a dignified house in her community, and to be happy in her family life. She hopes to benefit in the future from AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster her house and install a floor

loans.name: Dolores Aurora

texts.es: Doña Dolores Aurora esta solicitando su 5to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una habiatción, labora como docente de la Escuela  San José en la colonia San Francisco desde hace 9 años , esta clienta tiene una niña de 11 añitos de edad, la cual la tiene estudiando  su 6to grado de educación primaria, a pesar que es madre soltera ha luchado para que a su hija no le falte nada, es un docente que asume con la responsabilidad su deberes crediticios, ama su trabajo y posee  alto espitud de superación personal , Dolores se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral para poder ayudarle a sus ancianitos padres,  es una cliente que esta satisfecho por los beneficios que ha recibido por la institución ya que por medios de estos creditos a logrado comprar sus electrodomésticos  y ha mejorado su vivienda, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral salud y una vivienda  digna con buenas condiciones humana en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores Aurora is requesting her fifth loan from AFODENIC to build a room. She has worked as a teacher in the San José School in the area of San Francisco for 9 years. She has an 11-year-old daughter, who has finished her sixth year of primary school. Despite being a single mother, she has fought so that her daughter doesn’t lack anything. She is a teacher, who accepts her loan obligations responsibly. She loves her work and has the desire for personal improvement. Dolores has taken on fieldwork so that she can help her elderly parents. She is client who is satisfied with the benefits that she has received from AFODENIC, since through these loans she succeeded in buying electrical appliances and in improving her house. Her dream is to have job security, good health, and a dignified house with good conditions in her community. .

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La profesora María Magdalena está solicitando su 8vo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, ella requiere hacer un repello de la pared de su casa, es habitante de la colonia Naciones pero  labora en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea como docente los fines de semana y como bibliotecaria los dias de la semana, es  una mujer profesional con alto espitud de superación, ella tiene dos hijas mayores de edad las cuales estudian y trabajan las que se pagan sus gastos y sus estudios solas, su esposo trabaja en la finca que ellos poseen los cuales aporta con los gastos familiares,  es una mujer responsable en su labores y muy querida en su comunidad, su sueño  es de mejorar sus condiciones del hogar, para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida al nucleo familiar  y obtener mejor desarrollo en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is applying for a loan that she will use to improve her house. She needs to repair cracks in the walls of the house. She is a resident of the Naciones suburb, but she works as a teacher in the urban neighborhood of Nueva Guinea at weekends and as a librarian during the week. She is a professional woman with a strong drive to get ahead. She has two grown daughters who are in school and work to pay their own expenses and school fees. Her husband works on the farm that they own and that covers household expenses. Maria Magdalena is a responsible worker and much loved in her community. Her dream is to improve her home to provide a better place to live for her family and contribute to the development of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cracks in walls of house.

loans.name: Nelvis Tomas

texts.es: Nelvis Tomás está solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su habitación, como es el repello de las paredes de la casa,  trabaja en la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce, trabaja como docente desde hace 9 años, es un hombre trabajador, honesto de buenas costumbres, su esposa trabaja como docente en la misma colonia, ambos se apoyan en los gastos del  hogar, a pesar que son una pareja jovenes han  luchado para tener su propia vivienda, el se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya que por medio de los creditos obtenidos lograron obtener su propia vivienda ubicada en la colonia Naciones, es un joven que tiene espitud de superación, actualmente estudia su tercer año de la universidad, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral salud  y una vivienda  bonita para cuando llegue su primer hijo.
texts.en:
Nelvis Tomas is applying for his third loan from AFODENIC so that he can make home improvements such as repairing cracks in the walls of his house. He has worked as a teacher at the Francisco Aaron Joce school for 9 years. He's a hard-working man, modest and polite. His wife works as a teacher in the same neighborhood and they share household expenses. Despite being a young couple, they have fought to get their own house. Nelvis Tomas is grateful to AFODENIC because he has managed to get the house in the Naciones neighborhood with the loans he's received. He is a young man with the drive to get ahead and he is now in his third year at the university. His dream is to have a stable job, health and a beautiful home for whenever his first child comes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair walls of house.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Doña Silvia Elena está solicitando su 6to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su casa de habitación repellar la casa y cambiarle el zinc a la cocina, labora como docente en la colonia la Unión desde hace 24 años, tiene 5  hijos, la mayor de 15 años estudia su tercer año de educación secundaria, el otro hijo tiene 13 años estudia 6to grado, el otro niño tiene 11 años y la niña menor de 10 meses, su esposo trabaja como agricultor el cual ayuda con los gastos familiares y bestimenta de sus hijos, Silvia  es un docente que asume su trabajo con gran responsabilidad, se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral  desde muy joven para poder ayudarle a sus padres desde pequeña, es una mujer muy reconocida por ser una persona  honesta en sus actividades que se desarrolla, es una clienta que esta satisfecha por los beneficios que ha recibido por la institución, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral salud  y una vivienda  digna con buenas condiciones humana en su comunidad, que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Dona Silvia Elena is applying for her 6th loan from AFODENIC to make home improvements such as repairing the walls of her house and installing a new roof over the kitchen. She has worked as a teacher in the La Union area for 24 years. She has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 15 years old and in his (or her) third year of high school. She also has a 13-year old son in the 6th grade, an 11-year old son and a 10-month old daughter. Her husband is a farmer and helps pay for the family's expenses and clothing for the children. Silvia is a teacher and very conscientious in her approach to her work. She grew up in the country, working hard even as a young girl to help her parents. She is a woman widely recognized for being scrupulous about everything she does. She is very happy with the returns that she's received from her loans from the institution. Her dream is to have a steady job, health and a decent house so that her children can continue to study and become happy and productive adults.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair walls and roof.

loans.name: Milagros De Jesus

texts.es: La joven Milagros de Jesús tiene la edad de 28 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, soltera y no tiene hijos, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y prendas que desde hace nueve años vende, inicio con dinero propio y ayuda de su mama también en costura .con esta solicitud va invertir en la compra cosmético y prenda de platas para seguir ofertando a sus clientes y poder captar clientes nuevos. Sus planes es poder hacer crecer su negocio y lograr a poner su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Young Milagros de Jesus, 28, lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. She is single and has no children. She has operated a business selling cosmetics and jewelry for nine years. She started the business with her own money and help from her mother who is also a dressmaker. Milagro de Jesus will use the loan to buy cosmetics and silver jewelry pieces so that she can continue to have stock for her customers and be able to attract new customers. Her plan is to grow her business and set up her own store one day.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es: Doña Digna está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (repara su cocina), labora como docente de la escuela Mauricio Cajina desde hace 16 años, tiene un niño de 11 añitos que estudia su 6to grado de educación primaria, su esposo trabaja como albañil y ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, se caracteriza por ser una mujer  responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy humilde, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, donde la población cada dia crece mas, ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que ha obtenidos grandes beneficios, pues ha mejorado su vivienda y comprado electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar.  Actualmente doña Digna está estudiando su 4to año en la universidad URACCAN de Nueva Guinea,  su sueño es seguir estudiando, y que su hijo se desarrolle en  mejores condiciones,  también espera tener estabilidad laboral para continuar ayudandoles a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Dona Digna wants to refinance her 7th loan so that she can make improvements to her house (kitchen repairs). She has worked as a teacher at the Mauricio Cajina school for 16 yeas. She has a young son, 11 years old, who is in the 6th grade. Her husband is a construction worker and they share household expenses and rent. Dona Digna can be described as responsible, scrupulous, hard-working and modest. She lives in the #2 area of the Nueva Guineau neighborhood where the population grows larger by the day. She is grateful to AFODENIC for past loans that have allowed her to improve her house and buy appliances, things that have made the lives of her family better. Dona Digna is now in her 4th year at the URACCAN de Nueva Guinea university. Her dream is to continue her studies and to see her son grow up in better conditions. She also wants steady work since her family has few economic resources and she wants to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen repairs.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
La señora Enriqueta S. es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.

La señora tiene 70 años y es casada con 10 hijos, todos ya grandes con sus propias familias. Ella no sabe leer ni escribir, y lleva casi toda su vida trabajando en agricultura y ganadería. Su papá murió cuando ella era muy joven, y su mamá le crió sola. Sra. Enriqueta tiene 4 vacas, de las cuales saca leche y hace quesillo para vender. Además tiene sus cultivos de maíz, el cual vende en la Feria Libre de la ciudad de Cuenca. Suele viajar a la ciudad una o dos veces cada semana para vender maíz y quesillo. 

Con este crédito, la señora comprará abono para su terreno para mejorar su producción de maíz. Lleva más de 5 años con su banco comunal (es socia fundadora), y anteriormente siempre invertía sus préstamos en su ganado. “Yo vivo de las vacas,” dice. “No soy peluquera, no soy sastre, no soy negociante,” se ríe.
texts.en:
Sra. Enriqueta S. is a member of the communal bank group “Nuevo Amanecer”, which consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, located about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. The main business activities in the area are agriculture and livestock.

This lady is 70 years old, married, and has 10 adult children, all of whom have their own families. She is unable to read or write, but has continued on in her life working in agriculture and livestock breeding. Her father died when she was very young, so her mother raised her alone. Sra. Enriqueta has 4 cows from which she which she gets milk to be used for making cheese for sale. She also grows corn which she sells at the open market in the city of Cuenca. Once or twice each week, she travels to the city to sell corn and cheese.

With this loan, Sra. Enriqueta will buy fertilizer to improve her corn production. She has been with her communal bank group over 5 years (and is one of the founding members). Her previous loans were invested in livestock. "I live for my cows," she says. "I'm not a hairdresser, I am not a tailor, I am not a businesswoman," she laughs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Xiomara Maritza

texts.es: Xiomara Maritza de 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 niños, es medico general, se desempeña como responsable docente en el Centro de Salud de Juigalpa con 16 años de servicio, su esposo tambien es medico y le apoya con los gastos familiares y en la presente solicitud. Xiomara esta solicitando su 5to credito para mejora de su vivienda, poniendole el cielo razo, ponerle ceramica ya que el piso que tiene esta dañado, ademas si el dinero lo permite desea pintar la casa para que se vea mejor.  Sueña con tener su casa bonita y con las condiciones adecuadas para que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente comodo y alegre.
texts.en:
Xiomara Maritza, 42, is married and has two children. She is a primary care doctor, and she works as the head teacher in the Health Center of Juigalpa. She has been doing this for 16 years. Her husband is also a doctor, and he helps with the family expenses. He also supports her in asking for the loan. Xiomara is asking for her fifth loan to improve her house. She wants to install a ceiling and put tile down on the damaged floor. She dreams of having a pretty house with adequate conditions so that her children can grow up in a comfortable and happy atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in a ceiling, tile, and paint

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Nicolaza Margarita M. E.. 
Mi familia y yo tuvimos que dejar el pueblo donD. vivíamos San Damián - Huarochirí a Lima, debido a L. propuesta laboral que le hacen a mi esposo. Lamentablemente sufrió un accidente D. tránsito que le impidió seguir laborando D. albañil por un año. A raíz D. esta situación me veo en L. necesidad D. trabajar por mi familia, lo cual tuve que recorrer las calles con mis dos pequeños hijos, tocando D. puerta en puerta ofreciendo comida y fruta; además lavaba ropa y ayudaba a cocinar en los comedores populares a fin D. subsistir y no dejar en el abandono a mi familia, aún así estos ingresos no cubría los gastos que teníamos. Pronto llego a enterarme por una sobrina que participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD los créditos que daban a personas como yo, microempresaria. Me di cuenta que era L. oportunidad que buscaba para progresar económicamente, es así que logro formar parte D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Luz D. San Antonio”, actualmente ocupo el cargo D. presidenta y somos trece personas que participamos, los cuales nos dedicamos al comercio. Con mi primer crédito que obtuve D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD puD. comprar mercadería D. flores, plantas medicinales y medicamentos naturales, lo que generó ganancias que ayudaron en los gastos D. mi familia. Hoy a mis 41 años he logrado hacer crecer más mi negocio, ya no vendo mis productos en forma ambulatoria, sino en un puesto que puD. alquilar con los recréditos que recibí. Para mí EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD fue L. ayuda que necesitaba para progresar y estoy segura que con los siguientes préstamos que obtenga mi negocio crecerá aun más.
texts.en:
Nicolaza Margarita M. E. My family and I had to leave the town where we lived, San Samián – Huarochirí. We had to go to Lima due to a work proposal my husband received. Unfortunately, he suffered an accident in transit. He could not keep working as a bricklayer for one year. At the root of this situation, I see myself in the necessity of working for my family. I had to go up and down the streets with my two small children knocking door to door selling food and fruit. I also washed clothes and helped cook in popular dining rooms to survive and not leave my family abandoned. Even so, these earnings did not cover the expenses that we had. I soon came to learn from a nephew who participates in EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD about the loans they give to people like me, entrepreneurs. I realized that this was the opportunity that I was looking for to progress economically. That is how I became part of the Luz D. San Antonio Community Bank. I am currently the president. Thirteen people participate. We work in businesses. With my first loan that I got from EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, I could buy merchandise like flowers, medicinal plants, and natural medicines. They generated earnings that helped with my family’s expenses. Now, at 41 years of age, I have maD. my business grow. I no longer sell my products door to door, but I have a space that I was able to rent with the loans that I received. For me, EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD was the help I needed to progress. I am sure that with the loans that follow my business will grow even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, un grupo que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, en el sur de Ecuador. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.

La señora viene de condiciones muy humildes y tiene pocos recursos. No sabe leer ni escribir, pero siempre ha sido muy cumplida y responsable con sus pagos en su banco comunal. Tiene 47 años, es divorciada, y tiene una hija, la cual le acompaña a sus reuniones de banco comunal. Su hija está casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de un año, pero su esposo está trabajando en el extranjero, entonces ella vive con su madre. Lucinda cría animales en su casa: tiene 20 cuyes, 25 pollos, y una vaca pequeña. Vende sus animales a negociantes para su carne. Toda su vida ha criado animales. 

Lucinda está pidiendo un préstamo para poder hacer su último pago de un terreno que se está comprando. Piensa usar el terreno para la siembra de papas y maíz.  Ella ya lleva más de 5 años trabajando con su banco comunal, y dice que le gusta porque es un apoyo que le ha ayudado a invertir en sus animales. Piensa seguir con su banco comunal en el futuro.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer Community Bank. The group consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, which is approximately 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca in the south of Ecuador. Farming and agriculture are the primary activities in the area. She comes from very humble conditions and has few resources. She does not know how to read or write. But, she has always been responsible about making her payments in her community bank. She is 47, divorced, and she has one daughter. Her daughter goes with her to her community bank’s meetings. Her daughter is married and has a small, one year old son. Her son-in-law is working in another country, so her daughter lives with her. Lucinda raises animals at her house. She has 20 guinea pigs, 25 chickens, and one small cow. She sells her animals for their meat to merchants. She has raised animals all of her life. Lucinda is asking for a loan to be able to make her last payment on a piece of land she is buying. She will use the land to plant potatoes and corn. She has been working with her community bank for five years. She likes it because it is a support that has helped her invest in her animals. She thinks she will continue with her community bank in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for land she is buying to be able to plant potatoes and corn

loans.name: Nancy Alexandra

texts.es:
Sra. Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería. 

Nancy tiene 22 años, es casada, y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 años. Ella vive en la casa de su mama, donde se dedica a cuidar a su familia y también a la crianza de pollos. Se metió en este negocio hace poco tiempo. Nos cuenta que criar pollos es un trabajo un poco complicado, porque a veces los animales mueren de frío, por eso hay que cuidarles bien y también vacunarles siempre. Ella cría los pollos desde pequeños, y después los vende a tiendas y carnicerías. Ella misma los mata, los pela, y los vende a 80 centavos la libra. 

Nancy está pidiendo un préstamo para poder comprar más pollos pequeños para criar. Compra los pollos para $3.50 el par. También comprará sacos de maíz y harina para poder alimentar a sus pollitos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the communal bank group “Nuevo Amanecer”, which consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, located about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. The main business activities in the area are agriculture and livestock.

Nancy is 22 years old, married, and has 2 children (ages 3 and 1). She lives in her mother's house, where she cares for her family and raises chickens at the same time. This is a new business venture that she recently started. She says raising chickens is somewhat complicated because the animals can die from the cold weather. For this reason, she must take good care of them and also have them vaccinated. She has raised chickens since she was a young girl, and later was responsible for selling them to grocery stores and butchers. She kills and plucks the birds, and then sells them for $0.80/pound.

Nancy is asking for a loan to buy more small chickens to raise. She can purchase chickens for $3.50/pair. She will also buy bags of corn and grain to feed to her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small chickens, animal feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Heriberto Antonio A., tiene la edad de 56 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua,  casado, su esposa tiene una pulpería y sus hijos son mayores de edad. Don Heriberto trabaja en una empresa privada ene. Área de Mantenimiento en una constructora desde hace cinco años. Su objetivo  es tener una buena pensión que le permita sastifcer sus necesidades, con este préstamo que esta haciendo es su once avo ciclo el cual ocupara para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer un aumento a un cuarto. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo y los beneficios alcanzados para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Heriberto Antonio A. is 56 years old, married, and the father of adult children. He resides in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. His wife operates her own grocery store. Don Heriberto has been working in the maintenance department of a private construction company for 5 years. His goal is to earn a good pension that will pay for basic necessities.

Don Heriberto is currently on his 11th loan cycle. He will buy building materials to expand a room in his house. He thanks the institution for the support and benefits provided to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to expand a room

loans.name: Maria Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería. 

Maria Rosa tiene 43 años, es casada, y tiene dos hijos. Uno es adolescente, y la otra tiene 22 años y ya tiene su propia familia. Ambos viven con ella en su casa. La señora se dedica a la educación inicial, trabajando con niños desde 0 a 5 años, tanto individualmente como en grupos. Inició con este trabajo hace 10 años a través de su parroquia, y le gustó bastante el trabajar con niños, así que decidió seguir con eso.  Actualmente trabaja en tres comunidades distintas, y trabaja una hora por semana en cada sector. Ella educa a través de juegos, movimiento y actividades. También cuenta historias y hace rompecabezas con los niños. 

Aparte de su trabajo como educadora, Maria Rosa cría animales como pollos, cuyes, y chanchos en su casa. Los manda a vender a los mercados de la zona, y también a veces los mata para el consumo doméstico de su familia. Ella está pidiendo este crédito para poder comprar 3 crías de chanchos más su alimentación. 

Su meta para el futuro es seguir con su trabajo actual, porque le gusta. También le gustaría estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria Rosa is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank, which is composed of 13 members who live in a community called Zhidmad, approximately 30 minutes from the city of Cuenca. The primary economic activities in the area are agriculture and cattle raising. Maria Rosa is 43 years old, married, and has two children. One is a teenager, and the other is 22 years old and has his own family. Both live with her in her house. She works in early education, working with children from 0 to 5 years of age, individually and in groups. She began this work more than 10 years ago through her parish. She really liked working with children, so she decided to continue with it. She currently works in three different communities and she works for an hour per week in each. She educates through games, movement, and activities. She also tells stories and does puzzles with the children. Aside from her job as an educator, Maria Rosa raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs in her house. She sends them to be sold in the local markets and sometimes she kills them for domestic consumption by her family. She is requesting this loan in order to buy 3 piglets and food for them. Her goal for the future is to continue with her current job because she likes it. She would also like to study.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 piglets and their food and vitamins

loans.name: Geoconda Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Geoconda tiene la edad de 43 años, reside en el barrio Reparto Schick en la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como mensajero y ella esta laborando como auxiliar en una tienda de un centro comercial. Sus planes es poder  apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de un cuarto y poder gozar de las mejoras con su familia, da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del préstamo para proyectarse
texts.en:
Doña Geoconda is 43 years old and lives in the Reparto Schick neighborhood of Managua with her husband and two children. Her husband works as a messenger and she is a store assistant in a shop in the mall. She would like to be able to help her children with their education. Doña Geoconda plans to buy building materials to improve the infrastructure of a room in her house for the benefit of her family. She is grateful to this institution for the opportunity to have a loan and to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy building materials to renovate a room.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Marlene Cristina E. P.
Tomé L. iniciativa D. trabajar a fin D. apoyar a mi esposo. Al principio esta idea no le gustó, pero con el tiempo me apoyó, es así que empecé como ayudante en un kiosco D. un colegio, durante este tiempo puD. cubrir los gastos del hogar y me sirvió para ahorrar un pequeño capital que lo utilicé para trabajar D. manera independiente en L. venta D. cosméticos.  Al comienzo los ingresos eran bajos, pero después empecé a ganar clienteL. y los pedidos eran cada vez más, en ese momento me di cuenta que necesitaba contar con un capital mayor al que tenía; para cumplir con mis clientes. Por ello es que decido hacerme un préstamo D. EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, así logro formar parte D. L. alcancía comunal “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto”, actualmente somos diez socias quienes participamos y nos dedicamos al comercio minorista. Definitivamente durante estos tres años y medio que he venido trabajando con EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, he podido incrementar mis ganancias, además ahora mis dos hijos estudian en colegio particular, tenemos una mejor calidad D. vida a lo que era antes, siento que no ha sido en vano el atrevimiento que tuve, sino me decidía hacerlo, no tendría el progreso que hoy tengo.
texts.en:
Marlene Cristina E. P. decided to work so she could help her husband. He did not like the idea at first, but in time began to support her. This is how she got started as an assistant in a high school kiosk. Doing this allowed her to cover the household bills and save a bit of money that she used to start selling cosmetics on her own. At first, she was not earning much but then she began to get some customers and the orders kept coming in. This is when she realized that she needed more capital than she had in order to serve her customers, which is why she decided to take out a loan with “EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD” and become a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto.” Right now, there are ten members working on their small-businesses. During the three and a half years she has been working with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, she has been able to increase her income. In additiojn, both of her children are studying in a private school and they have a better overall quality of life than they used to have. She feels that daring to start her own business has been worthwhile because she would not have maD. the progress she has maD. without it.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Lilliam Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lilliam del Socorro M. R., tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en el barrio la Borgoña, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cuatro hijos, ya todos independientes y casados, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Lilliam desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura, la dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan sus cultivos,  ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su esposo , los planes hacia un futuro en su cultivo es poder darle un buen mantenimiento  para poder mejorar las hortalizas. Con este crédito va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Mrs.Lilliam del Socorro M. R. is 50 years old and lives in the Borgoña neighborhood of Ticuantepe with her husband, whom she helps with the household expenses. They have four children who are all adults and married and they would like to help improve living conditions for their family. Mrs. Lilliam has worked in agriculture for twelve years. Her husband helped get started in this field. The most difficult part for her is insects affecting her crops. She would like to be able to take care of her crops and improve her vegetables. She plans to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops so she can obtain a good harvest with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to improve crops.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Maria Mercedes H. M., tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos no tienen hijos, pero apoyan a su mamá con los gastos personales de ella, los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar de construir su casa, ella desde hace 13 años trabaja para MARENA, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su sueldo no le da para terminar de construir su vivienda , lo cual opto por un financiamiento y esta contenta por el apoyo que le hemos brindado, este es sus segundo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de piso para poder estar en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Mercedes H. M. is 33 years old. She lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla division located in the town of Ticuantepe. Together with her husband, they both work to pay the household expenses. They do not have any children, but they help pay for her mother’s personal expenses. The plans of her family include finishing construction of their house.

For the past 13 years, she has worked for MARENA (the government agency responsible for the environment and natural resources). Her greatest challenge is earning a salary that is insufficient to pay for the construction of their house. She chose to pursue financing and has been happy with the support AFODENIC has provided. This is her second loan and will be used to install a floor that will improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to install a floor

loans.name: Jessica Jamileth

texts.es: La señora Jessica jamilet Álvarez , tiene la edad de 28 años , habita en el barrio las Borgoñas en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos de seis y siete años , los dos estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es construir su casa , ya que actualmente la casa de doña Jessica esta bien deteriorada , ella desde hace tres años trabaja como cocinera en un Restaurante , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, ella inicio parte de la construcción con el esfuerzo de su esposo y de ella misma . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y poder hacer las mejoras a su casa para ofrecer a sus hijos una casa digna.
texts.en:
Jessica Jamilet A. is 28 years old and lives in teh las Borgonas neighborhood in the Ticuantepe commuity, together with her husband who works as a laborer and supports her with the household expenses. They have two six and seen year old children, who are both in elementary school. Their plans for their family are to build their house, now that their house is actually deteriorated. For three years she has worked as a cook in a restaurant. Their biggest difficulty has been the lack of finances to start part of the construction with the work of her husband and herself. With the loan she is going to buy construction materials and be able to make the repairs to her house to offer them a dignified house.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.name: Hermenegildo German

texts.es: El señor Hermenegildo V., tiene 53 años de edad, reside en el bario Laureles Sur, soltero y con hijo que vive con el de 25 años, su negocio es la venta de rosquillas desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar para sobres salir adelante, inicio con fondos propios la venta de rosquilla en un semáforo de la Miguel Gutiérrez, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de rosquilla y comprar una mantenedora para vender fresco, helados y hielo para mejorar los ingresos y poder estar en mejores condiciones. Da las gracias  a la institución por el apoyo con el préstamo ya que se ha beneficiado para mantener sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermenegildo V. is 53 years old. He is single and lives with his 25 year old son in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He has been selling donuts from a very young age. He started working to get ahead, so he decided to use his own funds to begin selling donuts at the Miguel Gutiérrez traffic crossing.

With his loan, he will buy donuts and a refrigerated display case so that he can sell cold drinks, ice cream, and ice. This will increase his earnings and improve his living situation. He thanks the institution for supporting him with this loan. This will help him maintain his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase donuts and a refrigerated display case

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: La joven Afilia, reside en el barrio Raspan Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene 28 años de edad y una niña de 5 años, su esposo trabaja en una zona franca de operario., ella vende cosmético con el propósito de apoyar a  su esposo ya que los salarios son bajos, tiene cuatro años de estar en las ventas, comenzó con fondos propios, con este préstamo quiere comprar una paca de ropa usada para captar cliente nuevos con la variedad de producto. Sus planes es poder tener su propia casa y espera que su esposo cambie de trabajo para poder ahorrar y hacer la casa. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad con el préstamo ya que solo así ha podido mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Afilia lives in the Raspan Norte neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She is 28 years old and has a 5-year-old daughter; her husband works in a free trade zone. Afilia sells cosmetics in order to help her husband, since his salary is low. She started her business with her own money, and has been in business for four years. Afilia wants to use this loan to purchase a package of used clothing so that she can attract more customers by offering a variety of products. Her dream is to have her own house, and she hopes that her husband can change jobs so they can save money for a house. Afilia is grateful to the lending institution for the opportunity that this loan provides her, since up until now she has maintained her business by herself.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a package of used clothing

loans.name: Anielka Antonia

texts.es: La joven Anielka  Narváez tiene la edad de 24 año, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, con un hijo de 4 años de edad, es madre soltera, y trabaja en la asamblea Nacional  desempeñándose en el área de división de protocolo, lleva dos años laborando el cual da gracia Adios por haber encontrado ese trabajo el cual puede sastifacer sus necesidades y la de su hija. Su mayor anhelo es poder tener su propia casa ya que vive en casa de sus padres. Con esta solicitud quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un baño y comprar un inodoro y repara un cerco. Mientras este en casa de sus padres su meta es poder ayudarle a mejorar su vivienda. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzados en las mejoras para su familia.
texts.en:
Anielka Narváez is 24 years old, and lives in the “380” neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She is a single mother with a 4-year-old daughter. She works at the National Assembly, where she has a job in the Protocol Division. She has been working there for two years and is grateful to have found that job, since it allows her to meet her needs and those of her daughter. Anielka’s greatest wish is to have her own house, since she currently lives in her parents’ house. She wants to use this loan to purchase construction materials for building a bathroom, purchase a toilet, and repair a fence. As long as she is living with her parents she wants to help them make improvements to their home. Anielka is grateful to the lending institution for helping her with these improvements for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials for building a bathroom, and purchasing a toilet

loans.name: Pedro Reynaldo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, el señor Pedro T. se dedica a laborar arduamente porque requiere invertir en su vivienda por medio de la construcción del techo y la construcción de un pozo. El señor Pedro lleva a cabo esta labor con el objetivo de beneficiar a su familia brindándole mejores condiciones.

Es por este motivo que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así iniciar su labor en su localidad en el municipio de Telica.
texts.en:
In the Telica municipality of the city of León, Sr. Pedro T. works hard because he needs to pay for two home projects: finishing construction of a roof and digging a well. He needs this work performed in order to provide his family better living conditions.

He has come to CEPRODEL for a loan to pay for construction materials so that work can begin on his home in Telica.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda S. tiene ya mas de cinco años dedicándose a la como distribuidora de productos de belleza. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que su esposo le ayuda, pues por su problema de diabetes le afecta la vista y no le pueden dar trabajo en otras partes. 
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía para mostrarla a su clientas y así pueda vender mejor. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que extra que genere su negocio con está inversión.
texts.en:
Sra. Amanda S. has 5 years experience working as a distributor of beauty products. Her business is the primary source of family income because her husband is disabled. He suffers from diabetes, which affects his vision and makes it difficult for him to maintain a job.

Sra. Amanda is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to present to her clients and thereby increase her sales. She plans to repay the loan with the extra income generated as a result of this business investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Doña Juana Maria es una mujer esforzada que desde muy joven a ayudado a sus padres para sobresalir en la vida, se caso desde joven y procreo dos hijos de 9 y 11 años de edad, tiene 42 años y reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en la alcaldía, inicio a vende tortillas y frijoles cosidos, para poder a poyar a su esposo con los gastos. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un aumento del porche y poder estar en condiciones mejores. Da las gracias a la institución por los objetivos alcanzados.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Maria is a strong woman who, from a very young age, helped her parents get ahead in life. She married at a young age and now has 2 children, ages 9 and 11. She is 42 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a city employee.

She began selling tortillas and beans in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She plans to make some improvements to her house. With her loan, she will buy construction materials to enlarge her porch and make other repairs to improve her living conditions. She thanks the institution for helping her meet her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Fabiola Del Socorro

texts.es: Fabiola del Socorro tiene la edad de 36 años, casada y reside en el barrio la Esperanza en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos, los tres estudian,  su esposo  trabaja en la policía de jefe de sector. Su anhelo es poder terminar de construir su casa., su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, y la venta de cosméticos, inicio desde muy joven a vender, tiene veinte tres años de experiencia en las venta pues anteriormente vendía  con su mama. Con este crédito quiere comprar, ropa, zapatos en variedad para ofertar a sus clientes, con esto espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder sastifacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Fabiola del Socorro is 36 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of La Esperanza in the capital city of Managua. She has three children, all of whom are students. Her husband is the division police chief.

Her goal is to finish construction of her house. She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She began her business at a very young age -- she has 23 years of experience. Previously, she sold products for her mother’s business. With this loan, she will buy a variety of clothes and shoes to offer to her customers. She hopes to increase her earnings and satisfy her basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo Z. es padre de familia y quiere lo mejor para ellos.
Tiene poco que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta algunos arreglos y desean empezar en poner el vitropiso y poco a poco otros detalles.
 Pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material  y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de poner el vitropiso, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así su familia este más cómoda en su casa.
  Don Arturo trabaja en el aria de despachador en una compaña de transportes, este el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
  Cuando se realizo la visita a la vivienda del señor Arturo el se encontraba trabajando y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Carmela Francisco Clemente quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo Z. is a father and wants the best for his family. He recently rented his home through a government loan, but it needs some repairs and they want to put in a tile floor and little by little add other details. At the moment he doesn’t have the money necessary for the materials and labor to install the floor, so he is seeking a loan so his family may be more comfortable in their home. Arturo works as a dispatcher for a transportation company. This income is for his family and a part of it will be used to pay the loan. When a visit was made to Arturo’s home he was working and it was his wife, Mrs. Carmela Francisco Clemente, who greeted us and appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a tile floor

loans.name: Jazmina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Jazmina es una mujer que trabaja para sobresalir adelante con su negocio se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, y manualidades, tiene ocho años  de estar en las ventas, tiene 31 años de edad, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de nueve años que estudia, este negocio lo inicio con prestamos que Afodenic atorgo este es su sexto ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa, zapatos y materia prima para hacer las manualidades. Su meta es poder tener clientes nuevos, mejores ventas. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Jazmina is a woman who works to succeed with her business selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and handicrafts. She has been in sales for 8 years. She is 31 years old, lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She has a 9 year old son in school. She began this business with loans from Afodenic. This is her 6th loan which will be invested in clothing, shoes, and materials to make handicrafts. Her goals are to gain new customers and higher sales. She is grateful to her institution for the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, shoes, and materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Providing an additional loan for a home

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Don Francisco José L. tiene la edad de 36 años, reside en el barrio Pantasma entrada centro comercial en la capital de Managua, su esposa le ayuda a trabajar en la fabricación de elaborar zapatos, le tiene tres hijos que cursa la primaria, su negocio es la elaboración  de zapatos tiene quince años de calzar a miles de Nicaragüenses, el aprendió  desde joven hacer zapatos en el departamento de Camuapa chontales, con este crédito quiere comprar  inventario como: cuero, zuelas, nylon, pega, y otros productos para su elaboración. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para producir más y poder obtener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Francisco José L. is 36 years old, and lives in the Pantasma neighborhood near the commercial center of the capital, Managua. His wife helps him with his shoemaking business. They have three children, all of them in primary school. Francisco has been in the shoemaking business for 15 years, and in that time has provided thousands of Nicaraguans with shoes. He learned how to make shoes as a boy growing up in Camuapa, Nicaragua. He would like to use this loan to purchase inventory such as leather, shoe soles, nylon, glue, and other supplies for shoemaking. Francisco is grateful to the lending institution for helping him to produce more shoes so he can improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing leather, shoe soles, and nylon

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera con 2 hijos y tiene estudios, de segundaria completa,  vive en el centro poblado de Molino.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace  3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor ovino y chanchos, además Ofelia se dedica a la artesanía (bordados en bayeta).

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y sacar profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
