Sra. Ofelia belongs to the communal bank group “Molino-Juli” which is located in the central town of Molino, Juli District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 53 years old and a single mother of 2 children. Sra. Ofelia completed her high school education and lives in the town of Molino.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase young animals. She is now requesting a loan 500 soles to purchase lambs and piglets. Sra. Ofelia also engages in handicrafts (making embroidered cloth).

She hopes to continue working and desires professional careers for her children. She likes the work being done by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep & pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria completa,  vive en el centro poblado de Molino.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 5 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de redes de pesca. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la reparación de su bote, ella se dedica a la pesca.  Paralelamente se dedica a elaborar artesanías que luego las vende en las ferias.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la cuenta interna y las reuniones de su Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the “Molino-Juli” village bank that is in the village of Molino, in the Juli district, Chucuito province, and the Puno department. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She has completed a secondary school education and lives in the village of Molino. She has partnered with Manuela Ramos for almost 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to buy fishing nets. She currently needs a loan of 300 nuevos soles to repair her boat as her work is in fishing. In parallel with fishing, she makes crafts that she later sells at markets. Her desire is to continue working and be able to educate her children. She likes the internal account and the meetings at her village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her boat

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: José Andre, es casado, tienen una niña menor de edad, es pequeño negociante del Puerto Principe en Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando crédito para su Pequeño Negocio compra y venta de cerdo y de esta forma aumentar su inventario; semanalmente compra 15 cerdos obteniendo los ingreso mensuales que le permiten el sosten de su familia, es importante mencionar que este cliente tambien trabaja estableciendo cultivos de raíces y tubérculos y granos básicos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, la que labora como modista en la comunidad y ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Se caracteriza por tener principios cristianos, y por ser cumplido con sus obligaciones, trabajador y cuenta con el respeto de sus vencinos en la comunidad.
texts.en:
José Andre is married and has a young daughter. He is a small businessman at the principal port in Nueva Guinea. He is asking for a loan for his small business of buying and selling pigs as he wants to increase his inventory. He buys 15 pigs weekly to earn a monthly income to support his family. It is important to mention that he also works cultivating rice, tubers, and basic grains. He relies on the support of his wife, who works as a dressmaker in the community and helps with household expenses. He characterizes himself as having Christian principals and for being punctual with his obligations. He works for and counts on the respect of his neighbors in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling of pigs

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe C. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y juguetes. 
Es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para darle lo mejor a sus dos pequeños hijos que tiene ya que es madre soltera. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y quiere también vender ropa nueva, pero no tiene el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir el negocio y así tener más ingresos para su familia y un parte para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe C. has been working more than 5 years selling used clothes, shoes, and toys. It is the source of income she has to give the best she can to her two young children as she is a single mother. At her business she needs a greater variety of merchandise and she also wants to sell new clothes, but she doesn’t have the necessary capital for the investment and she doesn’t want to reduce the business’s net worth. Because of this she is asking for a loan to be able to supply the business and therefore have a greater income for her family and be able to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel V. y su esposo el señor Jesús Rodolfo Ávila, tiene una bonita familia de tres hijos los cuales están estudiando. 
En esté momento tiene un problema dos de sus hijos termina un ciclo escolar y tiene que liquidar las colegiaturas y pagar los gastos de la graduación, pero en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder liquidar estos pagos.
 Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y así sus hijos puedan terminar la escuela y tener su graduación.
Ella trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de producción y El señor Jesús es empleado de una  fábrica en la elaboración de artículos electrónicos, estos son los ingresos que tiene para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel V. and her husband Jesus Rodolfo Avila have a nice family of three sons who are studying, two of them finished the school year and they need to pay the graduation fee and tuition cost. They do not have the money to pay the fees, so they are requesting a loan that will help her children to finish school and have their graduation.

She works in a factory in the production area and Mr. Jesus is a factory worker in the electronics department, and their income is what helps them to provide and offer the best they can to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay graduation fee and tuition for their kids

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina F. is from the village of Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Lina is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lina works in a family member's business venture in the arts sector, operating a weaving business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling mats to build nipa huts. Lina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma T. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Wilma is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing and shoes in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Wilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos de 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 22 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, siembra principalmente papa y junto a su esposo comparte las tareas diarias que implica esta actividad y los fines de semana cuando hay cosecha los apoyan sus hijos mayores que vienen de otra ciudad. Todos estos largos años de experiencia le han servido para afrontar situaciones difíciles que ahora ve con gran logro. Aydee tiene clientes que siempre compran directamente en su casa o en sus tierras de cultivo mientras están realizando las tareas de la cosecha. Sus planes a futuro son de seguir dedicándose a la agricultura y a la ganadería hasta donde puedan con sus fuerzas porque es de gran satisfacción para ellos permanecer en su tierra natal. Esta es la 12ava oportunidad en que Aydee tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más antiguas de su banco comunal y considera que esta experiencia ha sido muy buena porque aprendió el valor del ahorro y de la amistad. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de un toro para su actividad como ganadera hasta que espera su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Aydee is 43 years old, and lives in a house she owns with her husband and the youngest of her children who is 14 years old. For 22 years, she has dedicated herself to farming and raising livestock. She plants mostly potatoes and shares the daily tasks of this endeavor with her husband. When there is a harvest on a weekend, she is also helped by her older children who travel from another city. All the long years of experience have taught her how to manage difficult situations that she now can handle well. Aydee has customers that always buy from her directly at her home, or on her farmlands while she works her crops. Her future plans include continuing to dedicate herself to farming and raising livestock, as it is a great satisfaction for her to be able to remain on the land of her birth. This is the 12th opportunity for Aydee to receive a loan with MFP. She is one of the oldest members of her cooperative bank, and she considers her involvement in this group to have been a great experience because she learned the value of saving and of friendship. The funds she is requesting will be invested into the purchase of a bull to add to her livestock activities, while she waits for her next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a bull.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es: Bethy tiene 34 años, vive con sus 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años produce papa y granos, también cría ganado vacuno, ella vende sus toros cuando están grandes y con buen peso y con luego compra pequeños para volver a criar. Por otro lado, las cosechas que tiene, las vende en el mercado principal de su ciudad los días miércoles y domingo, cuando es la feria comercial, y cada 2 meses aproximadamente vende sus animales en la feria ganadera. Durante estos años le han resultado beneficiosos sus negocios por lo que se anima a continuar con este esfuerzo en bienestar de la educación de sus hijos menores. Esta es la 12ava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia, ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión sigue renovando su compromiso y actitud positiva. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más abono orgánico (guano de animales) y fertilizantes para preparar sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Bethy is 34 years old, and lives in a house she owns with her 2 children who are 12 and 8 years old. For 5 years, she has dedicated herself to farming potatoes and grains as well as raising livestock. She sells her bulls when they are grown and heavy, using those proceeds to buy young ones to raise. On the other hand, she sells her harvests on Wednesdays and Sundays at the commercial market of her city. Additionally, every 2 months approximately she sells her animals at the cattle market. Her businesses have greatly helped her over these past years, which is why she is enthusiastic to continue in her efforts for the benefit of her children’s educations. This is the 12th time that she has credit with MFP, and she is admirable in her perseverance as she is one of the oldest members of the group. For this loan, she continues to renew her commitment and positive attitude. The funds she is requesting will be destined for the purchase of more organic fertilizers (animal guano) for her farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos (13 años) en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica intensamente a las labores agrícolas y ganaderas, sus cultivos principales son el trigo, la papa, la cebada, las arvejas y el maíz; también cría ganado vacuno, principalmente toros para venderlos en las ferias ganaderas. Una vez que es época de cosecha vienen a buscarla comerciantes mayoristas que compran por camionada sus productos, esta forma de trabajo es más práctica porque ya no gasta en el pago de transporte para llevar su carga al mercado, aunque admite que las ganancias son menores que comercializando ella misma. Durante estos años ella y su esposo han notado que es una buena opción de trabajo y aunque existieron dificultades supieron superarlas. Ahora, Carmen seguirá trabajando de esta forma en busca de aumentar su producción. Esta es la 8va oportunidad que tiene un préstamo en MFP, ella es una de socia solidaria con sus compañeros de banco comunal, por lo que es muy apreciada en su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de un toro pequeño que incrementará su capital de trabajo ganadero.
texts.en:
Carmen is 48, lives with her husband and youngest son (13 years old) in a house they own. For 20 years she has intensively worked in farming, her main crops are wheat, potato, barley, beans and corn; she also raises cattle, mainly bulls to sell them later in livestock fairs. Once harvest season arrives, wholesale buyers arrive with their trucks to fill them with her products, this way is very practical for her because she doesn't have to spend money in shipping, even though the makes less profit by selling at wholesale. During these years, Carmen and her husband have noticed that this is a good way to work and even though difficulties exist, they've been able to overcome them. Now, Carmen will continue to work this way looking to increase her production. This is the 8th opportunity that she gets for a loan with MFP, she is a supportive partner with her co-members of the community bank, for this she is very appreciated in her group. The money that she requests will be invested in buying a small bull that will increase her livestock inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a small bull

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es: Clelia tiene 52 años, vive con sus 2 hijas de 20 y 22 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, los principales productos que cultiva son la papa, el trigo, la cebada y las habas, las cuales lleva en cada cosecha a los principales mercados de su zona. Para cada época de siembra y de cosecha contrata a personas que la puedan ayudar en esta tarea y les paga a cada una según el jornal realizado. Y aunque esta tarea sea muy agotadora es la única fuente de sustento que le permite solventar todos sus gastos, en especial la educación de sus hijas. Por ello, para el futuro Clelia desea incrementar la extensión de sus terrenos para seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad. Esta es la octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de ver que tiene una considerable trayectoria de trabajo en su banco comunal y su deseo es de seguir en su grupo aunando esfuerzos para el bienestar común. El dinero que  viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de sacos de abono y al pago por la implementación de canales de riego en sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Clelia is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 daughters, ages 20 and 22. She has been farming for 20 years, growing primarily potatoes, wheat, barley and beans. She sells her harvested crops at the major markets in her area. During the planting and harvesting seasons, she hires workers to help with these tasks and each is paid according to the amount of work done. Although this line of work is very tiring, it is the only source of income she has to pay for her living expenses and her daughters’ education. For the future, Clelia wants to increase the size of her farm so that she can continue planting in greater numbers.

This will be her eighth loan with MFP. She is very happy with the work being done by her communal bank and hopes to continue to be part of a group that works for the common good. She will use her loan to purchase sacks of fertilizer and pay to have irrigation canals implemented on her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and implement irrigation canals

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 10 años en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica al transporte y a la ganadería. Tiene dos autos, uno lo maneja su esposo y para el otro ha contratado a un chofer, ambos cubren diariamente la ruta interprovincial de su zona y no tienen un día específico de descanso, salvo que se necesite hacer un mantenimiento técnico a los carros. Este trabajo le ha permitido solventar los gastos familiares y ahorrar para poder adquirir otro carro en un futuro cercano. Esta es la 8va oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta por su progreso, por lo que continuará trabajando en su banco comunal, ya que disfruta de cada momento que pasa con sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en el pago del mantenimiento técnico de sus 2 carros.
texts.en:
Edith is 34 years old. She and her husband live in their own house, along with their two children, ages 14 and 10. For the last year, she has worked in transportation. They have two cars. Her husband drives one of them, and for the other she has hired a driver. Each day, both cars cover the provincial route of their zone and there is no specific day off, unless they need to do maintenance on the vehicles. This business has enabled them to cover the household costs as well as save for another vehicle in the near future. This is the 8th loan Edith has had from MFP. She is very content with the progress she is making and will continue to work with the communal bank. She also enjoys every moment she spends with the other members of the group. She will use the requested loan to cover maintenance costs on the two vehicles.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for maintenance on the vehicles used in her transportation business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita Q. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Perlita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a food market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and spices in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Perlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Acela

texts.en: Acela C. is from the village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Acela owns and operates a business raising crabs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Acela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell Acela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase crab fingerlings to raise and sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase crab fingerlings to raise and sell

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: Merilyn M. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married, and has two adult children. Merilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Merilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie A. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 39 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has school-aged children. Annie works in the food sector, making and selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In July 2008, Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional capital. Annie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the food products she sells. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla B. makes a living primarily from raising pigs for sale. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 adult children. She is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Perla has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Perla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn E. owns and operates a variety retail store selling products in her community. Malyn is separated from her spouse and has school-aged children. She is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro City. Malyn is just starting her business.

In 2008, Malyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Malyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Malyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita D. makes a living primarily from selling crabs in her community. She is 37 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Merlita has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP.This previous loan was used to purchase crabs to sell. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a crab selling business

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona A. lives in the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and makes a living running a small retail store. This is a new business, and her main source of income comes from selling clothes and shoes. 

In 2008, Rona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC which she used to to buy additional products to sell. Hoeurng T. currently stays at home to weave baskets to earn a living. She can weave over five sets of baskets a day for her husband to sell in retail door-to-door around the community. He can sell them for the price of $0.70 per set. Besides their current work, this family has always had a farming business.

Hoeurng T. has used all the raw materials from her stock and that is why she has applied for a loan from Kiva in order to acquire materials to weave more baskets.

loans.name: Chev's Group

texts.en:
Shown in this picture are two low-income people who have decided to seek a loan and use their loan money for different purposes.

Mrs. Chev S., 57, is the leader of this group, and she earns a living as a local basket trader. She also buys baskets in bulk at the lowest price available and retails them at a profit. Her husband is a military policeman. In addition, they also cultivate a rice crop. They have three children: one is married and starting a new home, and the others are single and employed in the garment industry. To prepare for the coming rice season, Chev S. is looking for a loan as capital to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow a rice crop.

The other borrower is Mrs. Maorl S., 25, a basketmaker who is asking for a loan to purchase extra raw materials.

loans.name: Mercedes Elena

Tiene muchos clientes ya que prepara rellenos sabrosos. Vive en su propia casa, no tiene hijos pero se dedica  mucho a sus sobrinos y a su papá que es de la tercera edad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de viveres para los rellenos y comprará, también, cemento para la construcción de unas piezas en su casa para  alquiler. Es una cliente puntual.
texts.en:
Mercedes has a small snack shop in the zone of Pampahasi where she sells rellenos, a type of empenada made from potato, yuca or plantains, with a filling of meat, onions and condiments. She has a lot of customers who come for her delicious rellenos. She lives in her own house. She doesn't have children, but she dedicates a lot of time to her nieces and nephews, as well as her elderly father. The requested loan will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make her rellenos, as well as to purchase cement to construct another floor in her home so that she can rent out space. Mercedes is a punctual client of the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the snacks she makes and sells, as well as construction materials to add a floor to her home so that she can rent out the additional space.

loans.name: Hafizan Muhammad Akram Group

texts.en:
Hafizan baji is the wife of M. A.. They have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. Her husband has run a construction-supplies business for more than three years. He sells the supplies to building contractors and earns income. Hafizan baji is a very hardworking lady. She has a business of making electric wire rolls and selling them to the electric shops. She has been doing this work for more than two years. Her business gives her a good income, which allows her to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to advance her husband’s business. 

This group loan consists of four additional people: 

Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Nadra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy school bags to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Hafizan baji is wearing a red shawl in this photo.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La señora Elsa tiene su tienda muy surtida en la  zona  de Pampahasi, vive ahí mismo, ya que es casa propia, está haciendo construir un departamento, el crédito será invertido en la compra de vigas prefabricadas ya que está en la última fase de la construcción. Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar.Es una cliente puntual.
texts.en:

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in construction materials.

Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. Saima baji is a very hardworking lady. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighbors. She has been involved in this business for more than three years. Her works gives her confidence to lead an independent life. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle named Shahzore so that he is able to continue his work and earn income.

This group loan consists of three additional people: Sajida baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, tools) for a carpet-weaving business. Humaira baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Saima baji is seated in front of the sewing machine and sewing clothes.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy O. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Christy is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Christy owns a business venture operating transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing tricycle rentals to the local community. Christy has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (approximately $62) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Christy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Christy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Christy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly A., 35, is a married mother blessed with one teenage child who is studying in the local public school. She currently makes a living selling fish paste from her home. She usually goes to buy fresh fish in bulk at the busy place that is full of fish and then she turns these fish into fish paste for sale. She typically generates an income of $3 each day to help contribute to her insufficient family’s daily living. Ly A. will be using her loan to accrue her business capital to make fish paste.

loans.use: To accrue her business capital

loans.name: Naghma Muhammad Siddique Group

texts.en:
Naghma baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 18 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. She is an uneducated lady but her mother gave her the skill to sew clothes. She started a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband's name is M. S.. He is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. Naghma baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) because her husband is currently driving a rented one and pays half of his income to the owner.
 
This group loan consists of three additional people: 

Asmat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. 
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood and nails for her furniture making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: “Naghma baji is seated on the first left side in this photo”.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мавчуда – женщина которая кредитуется в организации несколько лет. Она берёт кредиты для расширения бизнеса продажи детской одежды. Привозит она из Истаравшана и Бишкека. Для завоза летних маек для мальчиков и шорт она подала заявку на повторный займ. Мавчуда на снимке на месте деятельности.
texts.en:
Mavchuda is a woman who has been borrowing through our organization for a number of years. She takes out loans so she can expand her children's clothing business. She gets her merchandise from Istaravshan and Bishkek. She is seeking an additional loan to buy shipments of boys' summer shirts and shorts. Mavchuda is pictured above at her workplace.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For children's footwear

loans.name: Rehana Kosar Ishtiq Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sumera baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to sell. 
Asma baji wants a loan to buy a snooker table for her game shop. 
Afshan baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches and switchboards) for her electric supplies selling business. 
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

Rehana kosar baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. Rehana baji is a very active lady. She is involved in a decorative embroidery business and prepares embroidered dresses on order. She earns a good income from this business. She uses her income as needed. She is also the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. Her members respect her a lot because of her good nature. Her husband is a welder by profession. Rehana baji is requesting a loan to buy a welding machine. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Rehana baji is seated in a blue dress and is showing her embroidery work”.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Отуной- женщина, которая кредитуется несколько лет.Она торгует на рынке Худжанда детской и женской обувью. Сейчас у неё ассортимент шлёпанцев и летних басаножек. 
На запрашиваемый кредит Отуной хочет съездить в Истаравшан и с оптового рынка закупить новые виды летних шлёпанцев и сланцев. Отуной благодарит KIVA за поддержку в финансировании и понимании.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Otunoy is a woman who has been our client for several years. She sells women's and children's shoes on the market of Khujand. Right now in her assortment are sandals and slippers. She wants to use the loan to travel to Istaravshan and buy new types of summer sandals and slippers at the wholesale market. Otunoy is thanking Kiva for the financial support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand children's shoe sales

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M., 39, has an occupation weaving cotton cradles to earn a living. She started her investment nine years ago and is currently earning $3 per day. In her business actions, she has three school-aged children who also assist her in making cradles when they are free from studying. Her husband helps be responsible for the family by selling ice cream. The family faces the fact that their house is often cracking during the heavy rains. Thus, Sen M. would like a loan of $300 to purchase a housing tool to paint her old house.

loans.use: To purchase tools to paint her old house

loans.name: Kart-E-Char Group

texts.en:
Mahtab is the group leader of Kart-e-char group. There are three members in this group. Each would like to grow their businesses. 

Mahtab is a tailor. She has been interested in tailoring since she was a child. When she was young, she decided to work as a tailor. Now she has a good number of clients, so she wants to add to the number of her clients by purchasing a new sewing machine and the other required materials of tailoring. 

Lialoma is also a tailor and she would like to have a loan for completion of her business requirements, and M. Afiz is a driver of a taxi. He has worked as a driver for more than 10 years. He needs to buy a new machine for his taxi to work in a better way and to increase his income. 

They have requested a group loan of 3,000 Afghani.

They all want to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow their businesses

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Сафаров Чамшед проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. По специальности Чамшед "технолог". Работает технологом более 21 года. Вот как 2 года начал заниматся сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает кукурузу. Ему в этом также помогают его дети. Кредит просит для покупки семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить кукурузу.
texts.en:
Chamshed S. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 41 years old, married and has 6 children. Chamshed is a technologist by profession. He has been working as a technologist for over 21 years. Just about 2 years ago, he began to be involved in agriculture. He mainly grows corn. His children help him with the business. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer in order to plant corn.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly H. is a woman of 44 years living in the capital of Phnom Penh. She is a good mother, caring for three teenage children. One of the children is on the sewing staff of a garment factory and the others are still living at home. She is married to Las Osman, age 44, who is a mobile cooked-goods seller. Ly H. hopes to encourage her husband to attain a new suitable job as a taxi driver, because she saw that this sector is a profitable one for the family, but she lacks the money to make that possible. Therefore, she H. decided to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to be used as capital to add to her personal savings to buy a used car for her husband to begin running a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used car for her husband to begin running a taxi

loans.name: Mirzokarim

texts.ru: Назаров Мирзокарим проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Мирзокарим более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает рис и продает его на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить рис. Кроме помощи детей, этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Mirzokarim N. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 49 years old, married and has 6 children. Mirzokarim has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He primarily grows rice and sells it at a market. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds in order to plant rice. Besides help from his children, this business is his sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mirzofarid

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мирзофариду 27 лет. Он женат имеет сына.  Жена домохозяйка,занимается пошивом женских платьев  на дому.Он имеет доход с услуги частного таксиста. Его машина марки Opel. На запрашиваемый кредит он хочет заменить чехлы сидений и провести ремонт мотора.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mirzofarid is 27 years old. He is married and has a son. His wife is a housewife, she sews women's dresses at home. He earns income from providing taxi services. He has a car which make is Opel. He wants to use the loan to change the covers of the seats and repair the engine.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Zulpiyahon

texts.ru: Мамасалиева Зулпияхон проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 53 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Зулпияхон по профессии 33 года проработала "учительницей". Муж занимается сельским хозяйством. Сама Зулпияхон имеет торговую точку, где торгует посудой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zulpiyahon M. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 53 years old, married and has 3 children. Zulpiyahon had worked as a teacher for 33 years. Her husband is involved in agriculture. Zulpiyahon has a retail store where she sells dishware. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Suraiya  Abdul Haq Group

texts.en:
Zuhran baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy embroidering materials (colored thread, beads and patterns) for preparing embroidered dresses. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food-selling business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy washing powders and bleach for her laundry business. 

Suraiya baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. She is a very hardworking and caring lady. She gets up early in the morning and performs her duties very effectively. Her husband's name is A. H. and he works as a fruit seller. He has been doing this work for more than three years. He is also a very hardworking person. He treks to different communities and sells his fruits by announcing in a loud voice. Suraiya baji appreciates his struggle and gives him more attention when he comes back home. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to advance her husband’s fruit-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Suraiya baji is seated first on the right side in this photo.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin D. is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Ocidental. He is 53 years old. Benjamin is single. To make a living, Benjamin raises pigs for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (about $125) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Benjamin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjamin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Benjamin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Tozagul

texts.ru: Калонова Тозагул проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Тозагул по специальности 10 лет проработала мед-сестрой. В данный момент она более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет прилавок, где торгует хот-догом, напитками морожным и т.д. Муж работает на стройке. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Tozagul K. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. Tozagul has worked in her profession as a nurse for ten years. At this time she has been in retail for more than six years. She has a vendor stall where she sells hot dogs, soft drinks and ice cream. Her husband works in construction. She is asking for a loan to increase turnaround.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Rubina Muhammad Zahid Mahmood Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji has lived in Lahore, Pakistan, since past 15 years. The city of Lahore is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. Rubina baji is uneducated because her parents had little financial resources and couldn’t send her to school. She is married to M. Z. M., who has a soft toys selling business. He has a strong client base as he offers a variety in toys. Rubina baji is a hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered clothes at home by taking orders from neighbors and relatives. She saves income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy soft toys to expand her husband’s business. 

There are four additional borrowers for this loan:

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy food ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business.
Abida baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.
Shumaila baji wants a loan to buy embroidered materials (beads, colored thread and patterns) for preparing embroidered dresses.
Khalida baji wants a loan to buy colored thread and tools for her carpet-weaving business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy soft toys to sell

loans.name: Asia Muhammad Imran Group

texts.en:
Asia baji is the wife of M. I.. The have resided in Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. Her husband is a carpenter and makes furniture to order. He learned this art from his father and started doing this work in his childhood. First he worked with his father, then he started his own business after marriage. 

Asia baji is a very active lady. She performs all her duties very effectively. She takes care of every person in her family and even her group members. She has an ability to build good relationships with people. She is applying for a loan to buy wood and nails for her husband’s furniture-making business.

This group loan consists of four additional people: Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for hauling. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy colored thread, beads and clothes for her embroidered-clothes business. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Asia baji is standing in the middle of the bajis and wears a black shawl in this photo.

loans.use: To buy materials for a furniture-making business

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Калонова Сарвиноз проживает в районе Шахринава. Возраст 25 лет. Незамужем. Сарвиноз более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет дилерский центр, где торгует сим-картами и поплняет счет на телефоне. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sarvinoz K. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 25 years old and single. Sarvinoz has been involved in sales for over 5 years. She has a dealer center, where she sells SIM cards and refills phone accounts. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Зарифова Мунира проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 29 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Мунира по специальности "учителем" проработала 2 года. В данный момент она занимается сельским хозяйством. Этим  видом деятельности занимается более 2 лет. Она в основном выращивает рис. Муж находится на заработках в России. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить рис.
texts.en:
Munira Z. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She is 29 years old, married and has four children. Munira has worked in her profession as a teacher for two years. At this time she does farming. She has been working in this field for more than two years. She mainly grows rice. Her husband is now working in Russia. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to sow rice.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow rice

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita L. is from the village of Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Nenita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing new clothing to local community members. Nenita has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (about $83) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shohib Group

texts.en:
Safiullah is the group leader of Shohib group. This group is made up of four members. All of them would like to expand their businesses and support their families as well. They have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. 

Safiullah is an electrician. With the loan, he wants to buy some required electric equipment for his small shop to grow more.

Shazia is a painter. She is a very hardworking woman who has great experience in painting. With the loan, she wants to buy colors, brushes and the other needed materials. 

Afghan Gul, who is another member of Shohib group, would like a loan for her tailoring business. She has been a tailor for more than 10 years. She can sew different designs of clothes and has a good monthly income. She has lots of problems with her old sewing machine. She wants to buy a new one. 

And Noria wants a loan for her brother’s bicycle shop to buy the necessities.

They would like to state that Kiva is an effective process that supports the entrepreneurs so they can improve their businesses.

loans.use: Purchasing equipment needed to grow their businesses

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Дилафруз 7 лет является клиентом нашей организации. Ее аптека находится около рынка Костакоз. Она продает лицензионные лекарства, на которые стабильно большой спрос. В период кредитования она расширила ассортимент товаров и теперь у нее стало больше покупателей. Дилафруз рада, что полученный кредит улучшил благосостояние семьи. Дилафруз решила брать следующий займ и распределить его следующим образом: 1500 сомони на средства от диареи и по 750 сомони на лекарства для будущих мам и для малышей.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Dilafruz has been a client of our organization for seven years. Her pharmacy is located near the Kostakoz market. She sells licensed medicine which are in high demand. During her credit history she has increased the assortment of her products and now she has more customers. Dilafruz is happy that her new loan will improve the wellbeing of her family. Dilafruz decided to get her next loan and disburse it in this way: 1500 somoni will go towards anti-diarrhea medicine and parts for 750 somoni on the prenatal medicines for new moms and their babies.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe J. is from the village of Sta Ana, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Fe is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a weaving business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling bamboo mats to local community members. Fe has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (about $50) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the first loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to manufacture additional products

Манзура Мавлонова торгует на рынке Костакоз детской одеждой. У нее всегда большой  ассортимент качественных товаров, поэтому и покупателей много. За приобретением товаров Манзура ездит в другие города. В период кредитования в ее семье произошло радостное событие – свадьба дочери. На средства следующего займ Манзура планирует приобрести летний ассортимент одежды.

Manzura M. sells children's clothing on the Kostakoz market. She always has a large assortment of quality merchandise and this is why she has many customers. Manzura travels to other towns for the merchandise. During her credit history there was a happy event in her family - her daughter's marriage. She plans to use the next loan to buy summer assortment of clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer assortment of clothing

В бизнесе ей помогает сын, поскольку Рано работает бухгалтером дома быта «Навбахор». Клиентов ее магазина привлекает широкий выбор товаров и доступные цены. Получив следующий займ, Рано хочет расширить ассортимент колесных дисков для автомобилей.

Rano K. has been taking out loans at our organization for more than six years. Her spare auto parts store is located near her house. Her son helps her with the business because Rano works as an accountant at a home depot Navbahor. A wide variety is what attracts her customers to the store and also affordable prices. After receiving her next loan Rano wants to expand the assortment of wheel rims for cars.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Саодат женщина - 45 лет. Замужем имеет  4-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Саодат занимается продажей ремни на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Ей помогает старший сын Толиб. Она закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Саодат хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получать больше прибыли для того чтобы обучать своих детей в Университете.Саодат  уже 2 года  кредитуется в нашей организации и является хорошим пунктуальным клиентом.

Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Saodat is a 45 year old woman. She is married and has four children. She has secondary education. Saodat sells belts on the Panschabe market in the town of Khujand. Her oldest son Tolib helps her. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. Saodat wants to expand the assortment of her merchandise because a good variety attracts more customers. She wants to expand her business and get more profit to give their children a university education. Saodat has been taking out loans for two years at our organization and is a good and punctual client.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy belts

loans.name: Junard

texts.en: Junard P. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Junard owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Junard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Junard is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Aida owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for corn production. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. loans.name: Abdul Razaq

texts.en:
This is Abdul Razaq, the son of M. A.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 45 and married with five children. He is a carpenter. He has been working as a carpenter since 2000. He is a hard-working man and is busy doing work in his shop seven days a week. 

He needs to buy more wood and tools for his carpentry shop, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani. 
He would like to state that this effective process can support entrepreneurs a lot to start a business and sustain it as well.

loans.use: Purchasing tools and wood

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita C. is from the town of Balite in Sagay Camiguin. Jovita is married and has  adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail and food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as ginisa mix, soap & shampoo, cooked vian, and other items. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia Loko M. is a 31year old mother of 2 boys, aged 10 and 7 years. She is a single mother and lives with her sons in Mkoroshoni, in the Kilifi district. Patricia is a business lady who sells a variety of clothes and shoes for both men and women. She has been in that business for 4 years. She also supplements her income through charcoal which she sells in the same area.

This will be Patricia's second loan from KADET and with this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings, she plans to increase her clothes and shoes stock in her shop. 

In the future she hopes to diversify her business further by opening a retail shop, selling different household items. She also hopes to own her own house and to stop paying rent.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes supplies for her shop

texts.en:
Math M. has been a local vendor for thirty years and lives with other family members in a medium-sized wooden house located in Phnom Penh, the capital. Presently, she owns a motorcycle which she uses to pick up metal cooking tools to sell door-to-door around her community. Her husband is a local construction foreman.

This couple, pictured above, is blessed with four children who are studying in the local secondary school. Because of the lack of capital to grow her business, Math M. has decided to seek a $500 loan in order to buy pots, pans, and other kitchen equipment to sell.
