loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math A. is a widowed mother of fifty-two years who is blessed with four children: two are single and two are married and live separately.

Math A. is currently buying and selling used-goods to earn a living. One of her single children is assisting her in the business operation. At the moment, Math A. uses her wheelbarrow to serve as her business transportation. She proposes to use her loan money to buy a motorbike to connect to her existing cart. This new system will allow her to transport more used-goods more quickly. She and her daughter are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to connect to her existing cart

loans.name: Abdul Saboor

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is A. Saboor, the son of A. G.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old. He is married with six children. He is the only one at home that is responsible for paying the house expenses. 

He is a farmer and has been involved in this business more than 15 years. He is much experienced in the field of farming. He has requested an individual loan of 40,000 Afghani to buy more seeds and the required tools for farming. 

He really wants to progress and have an advanced business. He is confident that with the loan he will be able to work in a better way and will support all his family members

Finally, he would like to extend his gratitude to the Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and tools

Nesabinda owns and operates a fish-vending stall in the market. She sells fish from her stall and sometimes peddles the fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nesabinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nesabinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. Genedina owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling generally manufactured products to local businesses and community members. Genedina has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Genedina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Genedina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph W. is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He has been a charcoal wholesaler for the last ten years. He serves both wholesale and retail traders and his customers are mainly from within Kiambaa Shopping Center. Besides that, he is also involved with dairy and poultry farming.

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend. This is his 3rd loan from KADET. He intends to buy a motorcycle to run a taxi business. In addition to that, he hopes to open a big charcoal store.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to run a taxi business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine Y. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 18 years old, married, and has an infant child. Catherine owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In June 2009, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. To make a living, Georgie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and a variety of other items in the local community. Georgie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month ffrom these activities.

In 2009, Georgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Georgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

loans.name: Joseph Ngang'a

texts.en:
Joseph K. is a 43-year-old dairy farmer and photographer. He is married with three children and has been in the farming business for 22 years.

Joseph makes a monthly profit of about 20,000 Kenyan shillings (about $250 U.S.). He keeps his cows at his house at Mwimutu and sells milk at the local kiosk.  His photography business is based in Nairobi city where he serves a wide range of customers.

He learned about KADET from his neighbor. He plans to use this loan to upgrade his cows to the highest grade in order to better serve his customers. He also intends to open a good photography shop in Nairobi city equipped with modern technology.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more dairy feed and digital camera equipment.

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en:
Loeb M. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She stays at home to care for three school-aged children and cooks for her family. Besides her housework, she also works as a requirement worker for a profit.

The family income is contributed to by her husband who works selling a few cooking tools and cradles. For a year, Loeb M. has been planning to expand her husband’s business because she thinks that it is a profitable one for her family. That is why she requested a loan that will enable her husband to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase addition items to sell

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne A. is a 32-year-old married mother of three. She operates a salon in Kondele, a populous shopping centre about 10 kilometers from Kisumu City. She learned her trade from a salon at which she was previously employed. She draws most of her clients from the nearby settlement and market.

Everlyne learned of Kiva partner, KADET, through a friend who was already an existing client. This is her sixth loan from KADET. She hopes to use the money to purchase more hair and beauty products for use in the salon and for sale to customers. She also intends to diversify by setting up a barber shop to utilize some of the idle space in her premises, while serving some of her customers who may require both services.

Everlyne aspires to open other salon outlets, with employees manning each outlet while she assumes an overall management role.

About KADET The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase hair and beauty products and diversify her business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Mai 07.


T. is married and has two young children.  To make a living, T. works in someone else's business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time.    She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Q. is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


3.  Ngô Thị L. is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị V. is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành V..  Mặc dù mỗi thành V. trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành V. trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Mai 07.


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Q. là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Ngô Thị L. là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  Nguyễn Thị V. là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Хуршеда женшина- 31 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей,занимается бизнесом более 10лет,имеет собственный магазин в Афганбазаре. Товарооборот у неё большой.Ей помогают в бизнесе брат и мать.она регулярно ездит за товаром  в Китай и следующий займ берёт для расширения товарооборота. Хуршеда всегда целенаправленно использует займ и вовремя погашает без нарушений.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Hursheda is a 31 year old woman. She is married and has three children. She has been in business for more than ten years and has own store on Afganbazar. She has a small inventory. Her mother and brother help her with the business. She regularly travels to China for the merchandise and her next loan she will use for expansion of inventory. Hursheda always uses her loans purposefully and pays them off on time without violations.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila L. is from the village of Cento Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 41 years old and has school-aged children. She is separated from her husband. To make a living, Mila runs a family member's business venture in the retail sector operating a general retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling high demand products in the local community. Mila has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mila joined as Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be to purchase additional goods for sale in her store.  A portion of her loan will also be used to repair her house. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI.

texts.ru:

Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Джураева Сабоат-48 летняя женщина занимается продажей  дорогих женских тканей. Торгует два раза в неделю в Чумъабазаре и на Кайраккумском базаре,в нашей организации кредитуется с 2007 года,никогда не подводила. В данный момент она организовала группу учениц по оформлению материала глазками и бисером. Теперь у них работа кипит из-за того что сейчас сезон по пошиву национальных  платьев и все покупают данный материал на следующий займ она планирует закупить рулон материала,  бисеров и глазков.
texts.en:
D. Saboat is a 48-year-old woman who earns her living selling high-end women's fabrics. Twice a week she trades at the Chuma and Kairakum markets. She's been a loan customer with our organization since 2007 and has never let us down. Now she has put together a group of apprentices who decorate fabrics with eyelets and beads. Business is in full swing, because it's the time of year when people are making traditional dresses, so everyone is buying D.'s fabrics. She plans to use her next loan to buy bolts of fabric, beads and eyelets.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Gulzhan's Group

texts.en: Married and the mother of five children, Gulzhan is the leader of the group. She has five children: four daughters and one son. Even though one of her daughters is married and her son has gone to Moscow to work, after having reached the age of forty-seven, she still has to look after her other three daughters, the smallest of whom is just four years old. For the sake of that she is engaged in stock-raising. Mainly, Gulzhan purchases calves and feeds and resells them. Her husband helps her after work. She started this business twenty-five years ago with just eight dollars. Now her monthly income is 150 dollars! “Cattle-breeding is not the most profitable business. It is not sitting in a clean office gazing into a monitor, doing accounts. Anyway by raising cattle, we’ve been able to buy a house, furniture, home equipment and even pay for the marriage of our eldest daughter,” says Gulzhan proudly. Currently, Gulzhan needs a loan to increase her livestock population, fatten it up and resell it. In the near future she is going to have a new shed built and a hay-loft, as well as finishing the building of her house, buy her son a car and pay for another daughter’s wedding. Gulzhan has four partners: Nurzada, Baktijar, Dilbar and Dzhanatkul. Dzhanatkul works as a cook at a school lunch room. The rest are occupied with cattle-breeding. All the members need loans mainly to purchase more livestock, so that they can resell it later. Nurzada inherited four sheep and one cow. Now she has ten sheep and two cows. She wants a shed to store fodder, after buying a car to get married. Baktijar started with buying sheep. Then he bought horned cattle. For the moment he has sheep, oxen and a horse. Dilbar and her husband used to save money to buy cattle. Now theу have a cow, a calf and sheep. She wants to buy a car and pay for her son’s marriage. Years ago Dzhanatkul bought a cow which provided seven liters of milk a day. Now she has three cows and gets twenty liters a day. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara cultivates vegetables on her farm and then sells them to people within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more vegetable seedlings and fertilizer. She is 43 years old and married with two children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites D. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Marites owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In June 2009, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Toàn Trương Thị is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Toàn is the group leader of a seven-member group through SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 02.


Toàn is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Toàn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Toàn has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


Toàn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Toàn is requesting  a L. from SEDA for the first time.  She is requesting a L. of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  Toàn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Cao Thị Cừ is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business making and selling food.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Ngũ is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her service-based business.


3.  Trương Thị Thọ is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị L. is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her service-based business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị Hoà is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.


6.  Phạm Thị Quế is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Toàn Trương Thị  là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Toàn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Toàn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Toàn kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Toàn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Toàn đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Cao Thị Cừ  là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Ngũ là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Trương Thị Thọ là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị L.  là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


5.  Nguyễn Thị Hoà  là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Phạm Thị Quế  là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.name: Sales

texts.en:
Sales M. is a hardworking woman who tries to earn money to provide what her family lacks. For over eight years, she has been selling clothes in the market to earn a living.

Sales M., 44, is married to Math You, 45, and they have one child who is married and has started a new family home. Her husband is working driving a motorcycle-trailer taxi. Recently, he complains that his service is not running well due to the fact that the trailer is broken. Therefore, Sales M. is taking out a loan to purchase a new trailer to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her husband to replace a broken one

loans.name: 030 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hằng N. Thị (12) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Hằng is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030 Quảng Hưng (18.05.030).

Hằng is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Hằng owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling Ban Cuon (Vietnamese breakfast rolls made of rice noodles) in the local community. Hằng has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200,000 Vietnamese dong (about $68 US) a month from these activities.

In 2004, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 dong from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 dong which will be used to invest in renovating the business. The loan will be the 9th loan she has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. N. Thị Xuyến (71) is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. M. Thị Toan (51) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3. D. Thị Xinh (41) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. N. Thị Tấn (66) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hằng N. Thị (12) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Hằng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030 Quảng Hưng (18.05.030).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán Bánh Cuốn trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hằng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hằng kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2004, Hằng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hằng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. N. Thị Xuyến (71) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. M. Thị Toan (51) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3. D. Thị Xinh (41) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. N. Thị Tấn (66) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Jypar's Group

texts.en:
Jypar is the group’s leader. Jypar has one son and one daughter. Both of her children go to college and don’t work. At the age of 49, she works as a commander of the guard. She used to run a little farm. About a year ago she sold one calf and started selling summer hats. To spend $350 at once was a large sum for her, but she overcame her doubts and invested in hats. As a result, she earned around $200 and this allows her to pay for her children’s education.

Jypar has a desire to expand her business and to do that she needs a loan. With half of the loan she wants to buy men’s and women’s hats, and with the other half she wants to purchase children’s Panama hats. She plans to get a container and achieve $1,200 turnover. As her children grow, so do her expenses for their education. Owning and running her own container would let her meet her growing needs. 

The other members of the group are Guljamal, Jailobai and Tojihon. Guljamal is 42. She has been selling women’s clothes and has raised six children. Her spouse works as an unskilled laborer. Guljamal needs a loan to make a repair at her house, since summer is the best time to do this.

Jailobai, 38, is married. He is occupied with selling cosmetics, household goods, detergents and women’s hygienic cleansers. Four years ago he obtained a loan and started his business. So far he has bought a house and livestock. Now he needs another loan to buy different brands of detergents.

Tojihon is 29. Together with her husband, she sells men’s clothing, pants and jogging trousers. After nine years of hard work, they were able to buy a house. They want to purchase more items of clothing to attract more customers and eventually increase family income, since they intend to save funds for their sole daughter’s education.  But to do that they need to obtain a loan.


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept:  People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase men's, women's and kids' hats for the store

loans.name: Mukimsheikh

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Эргашев Мукимшейх – мужчина 29 лет, женат, имеет одну дочку. Работает водителем маршрутного такси.  «Газель» на котором он работает его собственный автомобиль. Жена занимается домашней выпечкой  на заказ. У Мукимшейха однакомнатная  квартира, которая требует ремонта. Узнав от друзей, что можно получить потребительский кредит на осуществление своих нужд , он решил, обратится в «Арванд».Ознакомившись с условиями организации он решил стать клиентом МДО. На снимке Мукимшейх в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Mukimsheikh E. is a 29-year-old man, and is married with one daughter. He works as a minibus taxi driver and drives his own "Gazelle" for his work. He wife makes home-baked goods to order. Mukimsheikh has a one-bedroom apartment, which needs to be renovated. After his friends told him that he could get a consumer loan to do what he needs to, he decided to come to "Arvand". Having familiarized himself with the organization's requirements, he has decided to become an MDO client. Mukimsheikh is pictured above on loan-disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate his apartment

loans.name: Nadira's Group

texts.en: This group is led by Nadira, a married woman and mother of two daughters. She works in a factory, in the city of Kara Balta. Apart from the fact that she keeps cows and sells milk, she purchases cattle, fattens them up and resells them at the cattle market. Eight years ago her relatives gave her a calf as a present on her wedding anniversary. Then she invested 120 dollars in raising it. Now she makes around 150 dollars every month. “I like what I do now, because it makes me independent and self-sufficient. Besides, I get great support and help from my husband and both of my daughters,” says Nadira. Now she needs a loan to purchase a cow to increase the amount of milk she has for sale. In future, she hopes to increase her livestock population and have five cows for milking. Nadira’s partners are Izzatillo, Ajzada and Nazgul. Izzatillo is a teacher at a boarding school in Kara Balta city. A year ago he started selling consumer goods and some fruit like apples and lemons wholesale and retail. He has already bought a car for goods transportation. He needs a loan to purchase more fruit to wholesale and to start reselling new kinds of fruit: bananas, oranges and dried fruits. Ajzada is thirty-six and works at a construction site as a general worker. As well, she sells milk, raises sheep and resells them at the Kara Balta cattle market. She wants to sell more milk; therefore she needs a loan to purchase a cow. Her dream is to buy a car and own a flat in the capital and she is determined to reach these goals. Nazgul is just twenty-two. Nevertheless, she is married and has two kids. She works in “Bakai” factory doing odd jobs. Some months ago she drew up a contract with a mobile company and opened a shop for a cellphone recharging. She wants to buy a heifer for raising and obtaining milk, so she is in need of a loan. She intends to save money, buy a house and raise cattle. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to increase the amount of milk she has for sale

loans.name: Sheriffatu

texts.en: Sheriffatu is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Lưu's Group

texts.en:
T. Lưu Thị is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a nine-member group through SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 01.


T. is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture selling agricultural equipment.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling plant seedlings and young crops to local farmers.  T. has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time.    She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị Nụ is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị  is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Lê Thị T. is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Trương Thị V. is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop.


5.  Cao Thị Y. is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


6.  Nguyễn Thị T. is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a bakery.


7.  Nguyễn Thị D.  is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


8.  Truơng Thị H. is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa B. is from the village of Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 62 years old, married, and has four adult children.

Josefa operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling home products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business not less than 6 months and earns approximately Php 5,600 a month.

In 2009, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial to help to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php 10,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Josefa is requesting a new loan of Php 10,000 which will be use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To expand her sari-sari store

loans.name: 18 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Nguyệt N. Thị (9) is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Nguyệt is the leader of a 3-member group loan organized by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 028 - Quảng Hưng (18.05.028).

Nguyệt is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Nguyệt raises and sells pigs. Nguyệt has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nguyệt has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be Nguyệt's 8th loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

  • T. Thị Na (13) is a 37 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.
  • Vũ Thị Kiên (59) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
