Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 028 - Quảng Hưng (18.05.028). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Nguyệt thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyệt kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND. Vào 2004, Nguyệt đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nguyệt đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. T. Thị Na (13) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. 2. Vũ Thị Kiên (59) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola has a business center where she provides computer services. Bola hopes for a loan of N140, 000 to purchase a computer and a printer. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and a printer

loans.name: Choang

texts.en: Mrs. T. was born in 1979. She is a married woman and is the mother two school-aged children. She works in a handicrafts place making meatballs, for which she gets a daily income of $2 a day. Her husband owns a workshop where he repairs generators. He works very hard at his business, but he can’t sustain his business growth due to the lack of capital. T. has decided to seek a loan for her husband to purchase extra repair tools and to buy essentials spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase tools and to buy essentials spare parts

loans.name: Parwan Group

texts.en:
Parwan is the group leader of Parwan group. There are five members in this group and they all live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total amount that the group members want to take is about 50,000 Afghani and each member wants to take a loan for the improvement of his/her business. 

Shar Roz wants a loan for the purpose of purchasing materials for her husband’s general store. 

Leyda wants a loan for her business sewing clothes, and she wants to buy a new machine for her business.

Parwan wants a loan for her husband’s business of fixing cars, and Azar Bibi wants a loan for her son’s leather business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. 

Marzya wants a loan for her carpet weaving business. She wants to expand her shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials.

loans.name: Memunot

texts.en: Memunot is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells bread and eggs. She is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more loaves of bread and eggs to sell. She says "thank you" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand stock and sell more goods

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 22 years old and owns a taxi and pick-up transportation business. He has requested a Ksh. 20,000 loan to improve the condition of his pick-up truck, which he uses to transport goods and materials. 

In the past, Victor worked as a security guard in a supermarket, because he did not have enough capital to start his own business. With this loan, Victor hopes to expand his business and, in the future, own a full transport company with several vehicles. Victor describes himself as ambitious and ready to face challenges. He aspires to support his family and help other upcoming entrepreneurs.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Improvements to pick-up truck

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo I. is a married 53-year-old man. Alfredo lives in Pooc, a village in Silang, Cavite. The municipality is known for the quality of its agriculture produce. Alfredo and his wife have six children ranging in age from infants to adults.

Alfredo works in a family member’s business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell in the local area. The family business has been operating for 30 years and earns profits of 31,500 PHP per month.

Alfredo joined CCT just last month and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for his crops. Alfredo hopes to use the profits from the business to pay for his children's school tuition.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand stock

loans.name: Lưu's Group

texts.en:
H. Lưu Thị is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a six-member group through SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu 06.


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns and operates a general store.  While not the onL. means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primariL. from selling daiL. use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximateL. 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfulL. repaid a previous loan of 3,186,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her famiL.'s income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T.nh is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  Trần Thị T. is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


5.  Nguyễn Thị D. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costL., Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Lưu Thị là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 06 (6).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T.nh là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Trần Thị T. là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


5.  Nguyễn Thị D. là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca is the leader of Akutwala Ekiro group in Mpigi. She is a hard-working single mother of a six-year-old child. She also cares for two dependents.

Rebecca has a boutique business in Kawempe. She has been running her business for one year. This is Rebecca’s second loan with the group and, so far, she was able to buy more fancy clothes for her customers, which won her more income. Rebecca is now able to make weekly profits of 20,000/= and she hopes for this to increase in the future. She is seeking this loan to help her buy more clothes and jewelry for her boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and jewelry for her boutique.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas O. is a 27-year-old small restaurant owner who lives and operates his business in the Mukuru slum in Nairobi, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to buy chairs, tables and sufurias (pots) for his business. Having faced the challenge of unemployment, Julius began his small food business, which he is currently operating and desires to expand.

In addition to supporting his family, Nicholas also supports his parents and educates his sister. Nicholas hopes to expand his business into a big hotel one day. He describes himself as friendly, interactive and hardworking.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy new chairs, tables and pots

loans.name: Zulmat

texts.en:
A. Zulmat is 51 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. In order to help the husband to support the large family, Zulmat started her own business. So for the last 13 years Zulmat has been selling curtains. She has her own trading place in one of the local markets. A very friendly and polite person by nature, Zulmat obtained her clientele very quickly. The business is stable and generates the main income for the family.

Today, Zulmat is planning to increase her working capital in order to expand her business. She needs additional funds to purchase new curtains to sell. Thus, Zulmat is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. Zulmat had taken loans from IMON several times before and has proved herself to be a reliable client. She thanks all for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payments.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her working capital and expand her business by purchasing new goods to sell.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
 
Ислом  работает водителем маршрутного такси.  Ему необходимо переоборудовать машину на газовую систему. Он делает рейсы с города в районы. С бензином ему обходилось дорого , так как бензин дорожал а доходов меньше , он повышал ставку цены, но клиенты предпочитают ехать дешевле.  
Получив кредит третий раз,  планирует получить на ремонт машины в будущем.
texts.en:
Islom works as a shuttle bus driver. He has to covert his vehicle to a gas system. He drives routes from the city to the districts. It has been expensive for him to buy fuel because fuel prices rose, and, thus, income decreased. He raised his prices, but customers prefer to ride at cheaper prices. He is requesting his third loan and plans to repair his vehicle in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle conversion

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. C., age 30, and her husband, Vivencio, are business partners. Gina buys scrap materials from used home appliances (electric fans and washing machines). Vivencio, a trained technician, salvages these appliances, re-assembles them, and sells them back to neighboring barangays (villages). Their house, which is located on the rolling hills of San Vicente, Caloocan City, has been turned into a workshop. They have four children, ages 13, 12, 11 and 7. Only the youngest attends school.

Their business has already provided employment to their relatives. Vivencio trained six relatives to repair and assemble appliances. They now walk the streets from one barangay to another, carrying on their shoulders the reassembled and "ready-to-use" appliances that they are selling.

Gina and Vivencio are now closely monitoring their business cash flow. They are looking forward to purchasing a second-hand motorized tricycle to be used for their deliveries.

loans.use: Additional spare parts, peripherals, and used household appliances

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius Njeru I. is a 34-year-old father of two school-going children aged 9 and 8 years. He is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to expand his shoe vending and repair business in the Mukuru Slum in Nairobi, Kenya. Having faced challenges of insufficient capital and lack of education, Julius is determined to expand his small business. He sells shoes and shoe laces and repairs shoes. With this loan, Julius plans to buy additional stock for his business and expand it.

In the future, Julius hopes to own a shoe manufacturing company, employ people, buy and develop rental houses, manage his own businesses and give his children education to the highest level and the best care one can give. Julius describes himself as hardworking, diligent and social.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy additional stock

loans.name: John Thuo

texts.en:
John M. is married and has four children. With this loan, he intends to improve the restaurant business he runs next to his butcher shop by buying more furniture to accommodate more customers.

This is John’s first loan from KADET. Before KADET, he was not able to borrow a loan from any other source. He was introduced to KADET through a friend who is already a KADET client. He hopes to be so successful that he can own a chain of butchery and restaurant shops in the near future.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for his restaurant so he can seat more customers

loans.name: Mislima

texts.en:
A. Mislima is 45 year old. She is married and has two chidlren. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Dushanbe town. Mislima works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high, because the national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. She is one of the leading fabric vendors in the market where she works. She is very tenacious and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 11 years. Mislima is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Mislima has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue seeing her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni to increase her assorted inventory. With your help, Mislima will be able to make her business succeed and support her children with education.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the new fabrics for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
P. Nguyễn Thị is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. P. is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, P. operates a family member's business primarily making and selling fried foods in the local community. P. has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

P. is the leader of a five member group seeking a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội 05 (5).

P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. P. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time. She is requesting a loan of 4,256,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. No. 20211020026.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị Y. is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. No.20211020027.

2. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. No. 20211020028.

3. Ngô Thị T. is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. No. 20211020029.

4. Nguyễn Thị O. is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. No. 20211020030.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

P. Nguyễn Thị (20211020026) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. P. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội 05 (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm chiên trong cộng đồng địa P.. P. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, P. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. P. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. P. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.256.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị Y. (20211020027) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là kinh dO. cửa hàng bách hóa.

2. Nguyễn Thị L. (20211020028) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Ngô Thị T. (20211020029) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. chế tạo hàng nội thất.

4. Nguyễn Thị O. (20211020030) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là kinh dO. cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for selling fried foods

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic O., 41, is a mother of three children and wife to Flaviano, 49, a maintenance worker. Marivic and Flaviano live in Camia St., Malaria St., Caloocan City.  

Marivic has been creative since she was a child and now has a business making bags and baskets out of folded newspapers and magazines.  She buys old newspapers from neighbors in her community. Through this recycling crafts production, she earns a daily income of 200 Philippine pesos (approximately $4).

She joined CCT in 2006 and is currently on her third loan cycle. She will use this loan to purchase raw materials for her crafts such as glue, strings and varnish. She looks forward to sharing her acquired talent with other women entrepreneurs in her community.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials (old newspapers, adhesives, urethane paint)

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Мухаббат – женщина 39 лет, замужем и мать 2-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Мухаббат помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Мухаббат просит новый займ для закупки 2-х бычков.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a 39-year-old woman, who is married and is a mother of 2 children. Her husband is involved in buying and selling livestock at the livestock market. And she feeds cattle at home. Muhabbat helps her husband with developing his business because she wants to have bigger profits in order to expand their family. It is customary to have more than 3 children in rural areas. They want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make bigger profits. Muhabbat is requesting a new loan to purchase 2 bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick O. is a 29-year-old carpenter who lives and operates his small business in the Mukuru slums in Nairobi, Kenya. He is a married father of one child. He is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to add to his stock of timber and expand his business. Erick worked as a driver and later opened a small grocery business. In the future, Erick hopes to open a hardware shop in Nairobi and build rental houses.

In addition to his family, Erick also supports his aged parents. Erick would like to raise his daughter and have a happy family. He describes himself as hardworking and friendly.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to his stock of timber

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
D. Muhabat is married with two grown children. Eighteen years ago, Muhabat used some of her savings to start a small business selling fabrics for sewing the national dresses. She was able to rent a small place located in one of the local markets in the busy downtown. Her polite manner and rich experience have helped her operate her business successfully. Over time she has gotten to know the preferences and tastes of her customers, making her place a popular stop when they visit the market. 

To meet growing demand from her customers, Muhabat is requesting a loan for 5000 Somoni, which will allow her to purchase more fabrics at wholesale prices. Increased selling capacity will not only meet the needs of her clients, but the additional profits generated will meet another of Muhabat’s goals: to help pay for her son’s college tuition. This loan will allow her to increase her income and provide the necessary funds to pay for her son’s education, which she considers her most valuable investment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Oimkhol

texts.en:
Oimkhol is married and has two grown children. She owns one vending place, where she sells fabrics for sewing national dresses in one of the local markets. Oimkhol has been in business for more than 10 years, gaining a wealth of experience in the retail trade. Her reasonable business approach, good managerial skills and ability to handle problems without stress and anxiety have contributed to her success. Her flexibility and customer-friendly approach have enabled her to consistently attract new clients. Now Oimkhol needs to restock her merchandise and that is the reason she applied to IMON International for a loan of $800.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L., 32, and Lito, 37, are a young couple blessed with a three-year old child. Gemma and Lito live in a government housing project for the poor in Caloocan City. Lito is a bus driver.

Gina buys cosmetic items from different reputable brands and re-sells them to customers on short installment terms. Most of her clients are working professionals and wives of her husband's co-workers. She's been in this business for six years.  Gina earns Php 3,000.00 every week and saves a large portion of her income for the renovation of their house.  She will use her new loan to build up her inventory.

She dreams of owning a small stall to serve as a showroom for her items.  She's also dreaming of purchasing a taxi for her husband.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
I. Anvar is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has operated his own car repair business for the past three years. Anvar has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. Car ownership is increasing rapidly in Tajikistan, which means more business for repair technicians like Anvar. Anvar works hard to earn a good income and support his family. He and his wife have two children. Anvar has requested a short-term loan of 2000 Somoni to buy some tools that he needs for his business. The income from this loan will help him pay for the schooling expenses for his children.

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare parts used to repair cars

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh Thị N. was born in 1974. She lives with her mother-in-law, her husband and her two school-age children. She has a bazaar at home selling cake, Coca Cola, beer and fresh goods. Her husband helps her to sell goods. She has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 VND. She is limber and handy. Everyone in her group elected her as the group leader. She has participated in microfinance for three years. This time, she needs to borrow 6,322,000 VND (~ $355 US) to invest in her store. No: 010117080017.

There are 5 other fund participants in her group:

Thu Thị N. was born in 1958. She grows rice and vegetables. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or ~ $330 US) to buy vegetabL. fertilizer. No: 010117080016

Hằng Thị Hoàng was born in 1979. She is a mechanic and has a souvenir shop. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND (or ~ $355 US) to invest in her shop. No: 010117080020

Nga Thị N. was born in 1971. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or ~ $330 US) to invest in her shop selling rice and noodL. soup. No: 010117080019

Lan Anh T. H. was born in 1979. She has a motorcycL. repair shop. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or ~ $330 US) to buy spare parts for motorcycles and bicycL. accessories. No: 010117080015

Hòa Thị N. was born in 1962. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND (or ~ $355 US) to buy Quat trees. No: 010117080018

loans.use: To invest in a general store

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
I. Alisher is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his children and parents (who are living with him) by selling national fabrics for national dresses. Alisher has a trading place in the center local market of Dushanbe city. All the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring town of Istaravshan. Alisher is trying to have a wide range of goods to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of the clients with different levels of income. Alisher, being a devoted father, is doing all the best in order for his children to be well educated and to make them happy. Today Alisher feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to jumpstart the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of fabric

loans.name: Ziyodabu

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Зиёдабу женщина - 41 лет. Замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем и сыновьями. Зиёдабу откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Зиёдабу продают их на скотном рынке. Зиёдабу кредитуется в нашей организации впервые. Она хочет взять займ для приобретения скота. Зиёдабу планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Зиёдабу очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Ziyodabu is a 41 year old woman. She is married and has four children. She feeds and sells cattle together with her husband and sons. Ziyodabo feeds the cattle at home and when it is ready her sons sells it on the cattle market. Ziyodabu is receiving a loan from our organization for the first time. She wants to take a loan to buy cattle. Ziyodabu plans to increase the number of cattle and this way increase the income for her family. Ziyodabu likes the loan terms very much and she is happy that organization such as this one exist and support the society.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A., 38, lives in Phase 4, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. Her husband died seven years ago. She has three children. The eldest has just finished college and is now helping her send the two younger kids to school.

Dionesia, like many Filipina women entrepreneurs, sells cosmetics, shoes, and bags consigned from prominent brands to clients on installment terms. She earns P2,500.00 every week from this business, augmenting her regular salary as a storekeeper at a nearby water refilling station. Working at the water refilling station also provides an opportunity to market her products (see picture of Dionesia inside the water station with her products).

While most of the loan she has applied for will be used for inventory for her business, Dionesia will use part of the P14,000 loan to construct a perimeter fence around a parcel of land she purchased with her savings.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics, shoes and bags and build a perimeter fence

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
K. Nusrat is 48 years old. He is married with four children. Nusrat cooks national meals like plov, lagman, and oriental dumplings. Nusrat is a very experienced cook. The income from the business is used by Nusrat to improve the living conditions of his family. Now he is planning to make a major repair of the café to attract more new clients and keep the old ones. For this, he requests 2000 Somoni. Nusrat thanks all for their support and promises to be precise in the loan payment.

loans.use: Repair his cafe

loans.name: Nelylyn

texts.en:
Nelylyn is a petite mother of three kids. She lives in the small agricultural town of Balubad in Silang, Cavite together with her husband and children. She is 25 years old. Nelylyn is a multi-micro-entrepreneur with a farming business on their small parcel of land as well as a small junk shop. She has been successfully juggling the operation of both businesses while raising her three children. She is a natural businessperson, with the nose for potential transactions and a heart for clients. She is also a loving mother with a big dream for her family's future.

Her farming business grows vegetables such as lettuce and mustard, and fruits such as bananas and coffee. She changes produce according to the season so the business always has income. Her husband helps her with the farming, but Nelylyn operates the junk shop on her own. She travels around the town in her tribike buying scraps and bottles, and almost anything that can be resold to recycling factories. From the junk shop, she earns a monthly income of P2,000, a small amount for so much effort.

This loan will be used to buy organic fertilizer for her vegetable farm. She will also be using some of the loan to buy more scrap for her junk shop.

Nelylyn is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.  www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: Organic fertilizer and scraps

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
M. Hafiza is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children. Hafiza’s husband is retired on a pension and currently unemployed. That is why her business is the main source of income of her family.

 Hafiza has been running her own business for 8 years already. She has a place in the local market selling foodstuffs such as flour, macaroni, rice, sweets, tea and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her son help her in the store, registering the stock and serving the customers. 

Hafiza and her son are very friendly and polite which allows them to have a large clientele. Now she requests 7000 Somoni for purchasing more goods to sell thus increasing the range of her goods. Hafiza promises to repay her loan on time and thanks everyone who decided to support her.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing goods for sale to expand her inventory

loans.name: Quyen's Group

texts.en:
Quyên Thị Nguyễn was born in 1965. (no: 010117020004). She lives in Kinh No village, Uy No commune with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Her main job is farming. She raises geese and chickens. Her husband is a construction worker. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She has engaged in financial microfinance for three years. She needs 7.194.000 VND to buy food for the chickens. There are four other Fund participants in her group:
 Tình Thị Bùi was born in 1980. (no: 010117020003). She has two children. She has a store at home. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to buy goods to resell.
 Hiệu Thị Ngô was born in 1961. (no: 010117020001). She has two children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
 Sơn Thị Tạ was born in 1974. (no: 010117020005). She has four children. Every day she buys dross to resell. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy more dross.
 Hiền Thị Lê was born in 1969. (no: 010117020006).She has two children. She sells fruit in the market. She needs 4.578.000 VND to buy many other fruits.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
N. Firuza is married and has 4 children. She is a hard-working woman who, in order to help her husband cover the household expenses and pay for her children's education, decided to start her own business 2 years ago.

Firuza started selling blankets and quilts, and later she started selling fabrics for sewing traditional dresses. The response from her customers has been very positive and business has increased. She is currently handling many orders placed by her customers. In order to fill these orders, Firuza is seeking a loan of US$ 500 to buy merchandise. Become an important part of the growth of this business and the lives of Firuza and her family. They will be forever grateful.

loans.use: Purchasing  new fabrics  to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer and his wife Violet have been married for around 20 years and have one daughter. Their laundry is the only source of income for the family; Sameer and his wife manage this business. 

Sameer was supposed to get a loan from FATEN few months ago but his wife's illness made him postpone the loan in order to take care of her. Now she is much better and they plan to expand their business and improve their income. 

Sameer and his wife appear in the photo at their place of business.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer  for their laundry

loans.name: Jesibel

texts.en:
Jesibel P., 36, is a variety store owner and a small piggery operator in Silang, Cavite. She is also a mother of three kids: 8, 3, and a 1 year old. Her eldest now goes to a public school in the agricultural town of Balubad. Jesibel's husband, Richard, is an irregular construction worker.

The store earns a net of P 3,000 a month. The family's daily expenses are barely being covered by the income from Jesibel's small store. Despite the difficulties, Jesibel remains optimistic: "The store's income is growing, that's why I am very keen on getting a loan." She believes that the store has plenty of customers from the community but doesn't have enough products on the racks.

She is going to use this 9,000 PHP loan to buy more goods, such as beverages, canned goods, and chips, for the store. She also plans to improve a part of her store to attract more customers. Jesibel's family is thankful for the chance to improve their livelihood. Part of the store's initial income will be used to buy school supplies and a new pair of shoes for their schooling kid.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions. www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: purchasing canned goods and beverages for her store

loans.name: Imonali

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Имонали – мужчина средних лет (37 лет), женат и отец 2-х детей. У Имонали есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 35 овец и 15 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Имонали каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Имонали пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Имонали за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Имонали очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, он надеется что кредит ему поможет.
texts.en:
Imonali is a middle-aged man (37 years old), married and a father of 2 children. Imonali has a herd of small livestock, consisting of approximately 35 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a homemaker, but processes yarn in her free time. Imonali takes his herd to the mountains every morning, grazes it and takes it back in the evening. Imonali does not have many heads of cattle, but he wants to use this loan to purchase two average-sized bulls. If he feeds them for 3-4 months, he would be able to sell them at a very good price. Imonali is very happy to be working with us and hopes that the loan will help him.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Kumush

texts.en:
P. Kumush is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children. Kumush sells fabrics for sewing traditional dresses. She has been in this business for almost 8 years.

Kumush has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Moreover, Kumush’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has the wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. The income that she derives allows her to educate her dearest children to a higher level. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

Now Kumush needs 4000 Somoni to purchase new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods for selling. She promises to repay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Saibi

texts.en:
S. Saibi is a widowed mother of two children. Out of necessity, 18 years ago, Saibi started selling fabrics for sewing traditional dresses, and little by little she has increased her supplies and her sales. Now she has stalls in two local markets.

In order to keep her business growing, Saibi is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni, which she will use to buy more fabrics for resale. This will allow her to offer a wider selection to her customers. You can be an important part in improving the quality of life for Saibi and her children. They are grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Savrigul

texts.en:
S. Savrigul is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children of school age. Savrigul sells fabrics used for sewing traditional dresses. She has been in this business almost for 12 years. Savrigul has a very good taste and she is ready to advise her customers which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Moreover Savrigul’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Janglish

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Жанглиш женщина 1951 года рождения. Вдова и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с сыновьями. Жанглиш откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Жанглиш продают их на скотном рынке. Жанглиш кредитуется в нашей организации более 1 года. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Жанглиш планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Жанглиш очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Janglish was born in 1951. She is a widow and has 5 children. Together with her sons, she is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Janglish feeds the livestock at home, and when the livestock is ready, Janglish’s sons sell it at the livestock market. Janglish has been a client of our organization for over 1 year. She successfully repaid two of her previous loans and now wants to obtain her next one. Janglish plans to increase her livestock quantity and, thus, increase her family’s profits. Janglish likes our financing terms very much and is glad that there are such organizations that support the public.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Gulshodkhon

texts.en:
U. Gulshodkhon is a married mother of 3 children. She decided to start her own business to be able to support her children, to provide them with education, food, and a house. She began her business 5 years ago, selling products by catalog, and then she began helping a friend sell curtains and later continued to do so independently

Her business allows her to cover her family's expenses. She wants to continue growing her business to improve her quality of life and guarantee the success of her children. For this reason Gulshodkhon today is requesting a loan of 800 USD loan which she will use to buy merchandise and offer products more rapidly as well as filling her pending orders. Gulshodkhon and her children thank you very much for helping them succeed.

loans.use: Purchasing modern curtains to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo G., 30, is married to Sherell G., an overseas contract worker. They have two children, one in elementary school and one in preparatory school. They live in a congested community in Parola. Tondo, Manila.

Rodolfo runs a videoke (karaoke) rental and video game business which earns P 12,000 each month. He also sells gasoline in small amounts for tricycle use and distributes e-load (prepaid credit) for cellular phones. These side businesses provide additional income of P 1,200 a month.

He is going to use his loan to buy another videoke machine.

loans.use: buying an additional videoke (karaoke) machine

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход успешный бизнесмен , очередной кредит получает на покупки муки.  Для производства макарон необходимо  большого количества муки. В его  работников специалисты и, каждому он платит достойную заработную плату. В дальнейшем планирует купить модернизированную технологию, что позволит ему сократить расходы , у уменьшить количество работников. С каждым производством он старается увеличить производительность макаронных изделий что бы оплатить свои долги и оправдать все расходы.  Фарход благодарен за поддержку от КИВА и планирует получить еще повторный кредит.
texts.en:
Farhod is a successful businessman. He is requesting his next loan to purchase flour. A large quantity of flour is needed to manufacture pasta. Farhod’s staff is specialists, and he pays each one of them a decent salary. He plans to purchase modern technology in the future, which will allow him to cut expenses by decreasing his staff. He tries to improve pasta manufacturing all the time in order to repay his debts and justify all the expenses. Farhod is grateful to Kiva for the support and plans to obtain another loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita R., 59, and her husband live in on the hillsides of Malaria, Caloocan City. They have one child, a son, in high school.

Teresita has been into the piggery business for the past 10 years. Wanting her to do something for herself, her husband Carlos encouraged her to venture into pig farming to do away with boredom while he is away working. Having her husband's support has greatly motivated Teresita to excel.

Teresita joined CCT in 2005 along with other small-business women in her community. Teresita plans to use this loan of P 14,000 from CCT to buy materials for the expansion of her piggery. She also plans to buy more piglets. She is very happy because she has another five pigs that are due for sale to slaughter houses by next month. She plans to continue expanding the business and greatly appreciates the opportunity to help her family.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions. www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: Expansion of pig pen and buying more piglets

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy is an engaging and hard-working married woman with 4 children. She found herself needing to start her own business to support her family and provide them with the basic necessities. Tursunoy sells fabrics used for sewing traditional dresses. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. Now she is thinking about expanding the inventory of the fabrics and in that way, increasing her income. She requires a loan of 775 USD. 

Tursunoy hopes that this will help her increase her sales and allow her to expand her business. She is grateful for your help and your generosity.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Y. Tursunoy has been renting a place in the local market for more than 14 years and is engaged in the business of selling fabrics used for sewing traditonal dresses. She is 49 years old and has 4 children. She has been a client of IMON International since 2005. Currently, she is active in selling different kinds and sorts of fabrics. She has found a good market for them, which allows her to have steady and sufficient income for all her needs.

The loan she seeks now is to buy more merchandise in larger quantities. Her payment history with IMON International qualifies her as a “preferred client” as all her previous loans have been paid off in total in installed payments stipulated in each contract. IMON International suggests giving Tursunoy this new loan.

loans.use: Purchasing  new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita D., 66, is one of the pioneering members of the CCT Credit Cooperative in Caloocan-5. She owns a glass and aluminum fabrication workshop along the national highway of Malaria, Caloocan City. She has been a widow for years and lives with her youngest son and a granddaughter. She is shown in the picture above with her son and an employee.

She has been in this business since 1975 and started with just a small space in Tondo, Manila. When her family moved to Malaria, Caloocan in 1981, her customers continued to work with her because of the good quality of her work. Her clients know Lucita as a loyal and friendly business person. She gets good contracts with large construction companies for setting up aluminum and glass windows for commercial buildings. She recently hired three glass setters to meet the growing demands of her clients.

She has applied for a loan of P 30,000 to purchase additional aluminum railings, glass panels, rubber sidings and a stockpile of adhesives for her growing number of projects. She looks forward to employing more people in her aluminum and glass supply store, which is a strong provider of jobs in the community. Lucita believes in giving back her blessings to the community.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions. www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: Additional supplies of glass, aluminum, rubber and adhesives

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Кумри – 48 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей галантереи, бижутерии. Она торгует на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, на втором этаже магазин № 172. Кумри закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 3-4 раза в месяц. Её муж нигде не работает. Он приехал из Росийской Федерации, потому что из за финансового кризиса работодатели ему не оплатили за работу.  Когда она начинала бизнес, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Кумри расширилась. Кумри просит кредит для закупки новых видов модных женских заколок и бижутерии. Тогда у Кумри увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
Kumri is 48 years old. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. She sells notions and costume jewelry. She sells at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand, on the second floor, store #172. Kumri buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes there 3-4 times per month. Her husband is not employed. He returned from the Russian Federation because his employers did not pay him for work due to the financial crisis. When Kumri started her business, she had a small quantity of goods. Now Kumri expanded. Kumri is requesting a loan in order to purchase new types of stylish women’s hair accessories and costume jewelry. Then Kumri’s merchandise assortment will increase.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's hair accessories and jewelry

loans.name: Marion's Group

texts.en:
K. Marion is the leader of Akutwala Ekiro group in Mpigi. She is a determined and hard-working lady with a general store as her business for the past 3 years, located in Nateete. Her previous loans have helped to increase the stock in her store, hence winning her more customers. At the moment, she is able to make monthly profits of 400,000/=. Her dream is to improve her business by making it big as well as improving her lifestyle.

Marion is a single mother of 2 children in primary school and she helps pay their school fees singlehandedly. She needs a loan to help buy more stock for her store.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her store

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef has small shop at Al-duhaisha refugee camp where he stores his products and at the same time he sells his products through wandering about the streets of Al-duhaisha refugee camp, Bethlehem city, and nearby towns. Yousef's business is the only source of income for the family that consists of four: himself, his wife, and two young sons less than 18 years old. 

Yousef is planning to quit smoking; that's why he appears in the picture at his store with an unlighted cigarette.

Yousef sells blankets, curtains, cover-ups and pillow cases. He needs the loan to buy products for the coming season.

loans.use: To purchase new products for the store

loans.name: Ahrorhodja

texts.ru: Ахрорходжа Юупов 1984 года рождения, женат имеет одного ребенка. Имеет среднее образование. Ахроходжа  является успешным предпринимателем. С нашей организацией начал сотрудничать  2008 года.  Он торгует строительными материалами. Его бизнесу помогает отец , когда Ахрорходжа ездит за товаром, отец присматривает за бизнесом. Пять лет назад он ремонтировал дома и ему пришла идея также и торговать строительными материалами. Теперь  по настоящее время развивает свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Ahrorhodja Y. was born in 1984. He is married and has one child. He has a secondary education. Ahrorhodja is a successful entrepreneur. He started working with our organization in 2008. He sells building materials. His father helps him with the business and looks after the store, when Ahrorhodja leaves to get his merchandise. He was repairing homes five years ago and came up with the idea of selling building materials. Today he is developing his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Розия - женщина средних лет 1958 года рождения. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Она с мужем занимаются производством лепешки. Муж печет лепешки, а Розия продает их на рынке "Панчшанбе". Муж Розии закупает муку у оптовиков в запас, чтобы застраховать себя, если завоз муки на время приостановится. У Розии есть свои постоянные клиенты, которые берут лепешки под реализацию и рассчитываются сразу после реализации. Розия всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Она очень благодарна нашей организации за поддержку малого бизнеса населения.
texts.en:
Roziya is a middle-aged woman, born in 1958. She is married and is a mother of 5 children. Roziya and her husband make flatbread. Her husband bakes the flatbread, and Roziya sells it at the Panchshanbe market. Roziya’s husband buys flour from wholesalers in advance to insure himself against potential flour shortages. Roziya has loyal customers who buy flatbread to resell and pay her right after the sales. Roziya always uses her loans purposefully. She is very grateful to our organization for supporting small businesses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Karimchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Каримчон – молодой мужчина 25 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Жена домохозяйка, нянчит своих маленьких детишек. Каримчон как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд – Паллас. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего такси.
texts.en:
Karimchon is a young 25-year-old man. He is married and is a father of 3 children. His wife is a homemaker, who takes care of their small children. As the head of household, Karimchon works and earns money. He drives a shuttle bus on the Khujand-Pallas route. He works according to this schedule: 2 days on and 1 day off. He tries to maximize his earnings during workdays and works from early morning to late night. He repairs his vehicle on his days off. He wants to use this loan to repair his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мазуна  являться нашим активным клиентом. Ей необходимо заполнить полки своего ларька, где торгует зубной пастой, мылом, пакетами и многим различными товарами.  Почти 2 месяца  ее бизнес простаивал из-за кризиса. Когда начинала бизнес на ее прилавками были только спички и сигареты. Теперь ее бизнес благодаря нашему кредиту расширился , она может позволить запасаться блоками мыла и зубной пастой. За это на благодарна КИВА.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is our active client. She needs to fill the shelves of her store, where she sells toothpaste, soap, packets and many other goods. Due to the crisis, her business has stalled for almost 2 months. When she first started her business, her shelves contained only matches and cigarettes. Since then, thanks to our loans, she expanded her store, and she can now buy large stocks of soap and toothpaste. For this, she is grateful to Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refilling stock

loans.name: Fahritdin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Фахритдину 43 года. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Занимается перевозкой людей, в качестве маршрутного такси. Жена домохозяйка. Фахритдин водит по маршруту № 38 Худжанд - Водник. Он работает каждый день, поэтому ему не выгодно ездить на бензине. Фахритдин хочет установить газовое оборудование. Для этого он просит займ.
texts.en:
Fahritdin is 43 years old. He is married and is a father of 3 children. He is involved in transporting people as a shuttle driver. His wife is a homemaker. Fahritdin drives on the route #38, Khujand-Vodnik. He works every day; thus, it is not profitable to use fuel. Fahritdin wants to install gas equipment. He is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing gas equipment

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 30 years old and married with three children. She owns a business center where she makes calls, sells rechargeable phone cards, and rents out VCDs. Fatima hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Azamchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Азамчону – 33 года. Он женат и имеет 3-х детей. Он водит маршрутное такси № 43, который ездит в направлении Панчшанбе – Сомгор. Он работает через день. В свои выходные дни он ремонтирует свою машину, делает заправку, и ездит по своим личным делам. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе, зарабатывает мало. Азамчон хочет взять займ для покупки некоторых запасных частей и ремонта ходовой части машины.
texts.en:
Azamchon is 33 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He drives a shuttle bus #43 that operates on the Panchshanbe-Somgor route. He works every other day. He repairs his vehicle on his days off, fuels it up and drives to do his own errands. His wife works as a teacher at a secondary school and earns very little. Azamchon wants to obtain a loan to buy several auto parts and repair vehicle drive train.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shuttle bus repairs

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр 1983 года рождения, неженат. Имеет высшее образование. Он готовит шашлыки и продает. Семь лет назад работал в одном из баров официантом.  Со временем научился как готовить и решил открыть свое дело.  В настоящее время у него много клиентов особенно в обед. Он готовит разные шашлыки из мясо  баранины, говяжий, шашлыки из печени и шашлык  фаршем. Таким образом ему удается продать 100 палочек шашлыка. Особенно по воскресеньям и праздничные дни. Кредит получает  с 2007 года, что позволило ему улучшить свое  рабочее место .
texts.en:
