Bahtiyor was born in 1983. He is single. He has a higher education. He cooks kebabs and sells them. Bahtiyor worked as a waiter at one of the bars seven years ago. With time, he learned how to cook and decided to open his own business. Currently, he has many customers, especially during lunch. He makes various kebabs from lamb, beef, liver and ground kebab. Thus, he is able to sell 100 sticks of kebab, especially on Sundays and holidays. Bahtiyor has been obtaining financing since 2007, which allowed him to improve his workplace.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Aina

texts.en: Aina is a trained nurse but when she is not on duty, she sells sarongs. Aina hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Aina is 35 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Неъмат – мужчина 47 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Жена домохозяйка, нянчит своих маленьких детишек. Неъмат как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд – Паллос. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего такси.
texts.en:
Nemat is a 47-year-old man. He is married and is a father of 3 children. His wife is a homemaker; she takes care of their small children. As head of the household, Nemat works and earns money. He drives a shuttle bus on the Khujand-Pallos route. He works according to this schedule: 2 days on and 1 day off. He tries to maximize his earnings on his workdays and works from early morning to late night. He repairs his vehicle on his day off. Nemat wanted to use this loan to repair his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is one of FATEN's oldest clients; she has received more than 8 loans from FATEN. She raises goats and sheep in addition to raising bees. Since she joined FATEN, her business has expanded from 3 hives to more than 25 and from 2 sheep to 13. 

Her business is the only source of income for the family; she works together with her husband on it.

She appears in the picture at her farm with her sheep.

loans.use: Purchase sheep and bee hives

location.town: Taqou' Village, Bethlehem City, West Bank

loans.name: Naimchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Наимчону 37 лет. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и закатывает разные овощи и фрукты в банки по сезону. Сейчас она консервирует помидоры и огурцы. Разные консервы Наимчон продает на рынке Панчшанбе, на первом этаже. Наимчон также продает пустые банки. Наимчон берет кредит на закупку стеклянных банок и овощей для закрутки.
texts.en:
Naimchon is 37 years old, married and a father of 2 children. His wife is not employed. She stays home and cans vegetables and fruits according to season. Now, she is canning tomatoes and cucumbers. Naimchon sells various canned products at the Panchshanbe market, on the first floor. Naimchon also sells empty jars. Naimchon is obtaining this loan for the purchase of glass jars and vegetables for canning.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of glass jars and vegetables for canning

loans.name: Ganiya

texts.en: Ganiya is 29 years old and married with a child. She sells frozen foods. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Yawel Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupe de 05 hommes habitant dans  l'écovillage de Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) et nous sommes venus solliciter un prêt à Kiva pour nous adonner à l'activité de commerce et d'élevage. Nous cherchons des financements qui pourront nous aider à créer des activités génératrices de revenu étant donné que notre âge ne nous permet plus de nous adonner à des activités fougueuses. Nous voulons rester sur place et développer notre écovillage. Avec le prêt, nous voudrions acheter des caprins pour faire un peu d’embouche mais aussi y allier les activités de commerce de fourrages et de denrées alimentaires (huile de palme, tamarin, pâte d’arachide).
texts.en:
We are a group of five men who live in the ecological center of Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php). We have come to request a loan through Kiva to enable us to move ahead with our business activities and the raising of animals. We are looking for financing to assist us in creating business revenue that would not be overly demanding due to our advanced age. We would like to remain in Palmarin and develop our ecological center. With this loan we would like to buy goats to raise for food along with the business of selling farm products and staple food items such as palm oil, tamarin and peanut butter.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used for raising farm animals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a very active women in Biet Sahour. Her husbend passed away a few years ago, so she has a big burden to raise her two sons. Nawal decided to open her own clothing shop and not to depend on anyone. Now she has a clothing shop in downtown Beit Sahour; her business is going very well and she depends on herself to raise her children, not requesting assistance from anyone. She approached FATEN to take a 3000 USD loan to expand her business and to have more product variety at her shop, specially since during the summer there are a lot of happy occasions for families: weddings, graduation, etc.

Nawal appears at her shop in the picture.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for the shop

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en: Monica is 55 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children. She is a trader. Monica fires and sells popcorn. She sells on a school compound in her community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God’s time’. Monica is in the middle of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the hearts desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo is 43 years old and married with four children. Funmilayo styles hair and she also sells hair cream and hair extensions. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Awurade Ne Me Hwefo Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 59 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children.
She is a trader. She trades in slippers. She hawks to sell. Comfort is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade ne me hwefo’ which literally means the Lord is my shepherd. She is second from left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the hearts desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Calista

texts.en: Calista is 41 years old and married to O. who is a pastor. They have two children. She sells provisions and cosmetics. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and provisions to sell

loans.name: Moang

texts.en: Moang L. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a shop near her house. Moang is 39 years old and is widowed. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop near her house

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a young man who is married with three children. He owns a small Fiat Panda car from which he has removed the back seat and organized it to put his products in its place. He appears with his car in the attached photo. He sells kitchenware, peanuts, cleaning materials. approximately everything. He sells his products throughout the Gaza Strip.

Wael started his business on a motorcycle and four years ago he bought this car. He asks FATEN for a loan of 1,000 USD to expand his business so as to have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: To purchase new products for his business

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin tailors clothes and also sells tailoring materials. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase tailoring materials and a sewing machine. She is 30 years old and married with four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Kroye Ne Odo Group

texts.en:
Esther is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She is a trader in textile materials, which she hawks and treks to sell. Esther is the leader of a trust bank group called "Kroye ne odo," which literally means "unity and love." She is the woman wearing glasses in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors, or farmers. They work to support their spouses and to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares, or goods from other towns and nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them also go to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience. They are therefore asking for a loan to help them procure more goods to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Deep

texts.en:
Deep is married with a family consisting of eight members, their ages varying from 20 to 4 years old. His business, which he established five years ago, is the only source of income for the family.

Deep sells electrical equipment and watches. He requested a 2,000 USD loan to expand his business. He appear in the photo at his business place.

loans.use: To purchase new goods for his shop

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke sells sachet water and drinks at retail and wholesale. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell. Ronke is 45 years old and married with five children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada R. is currently in the business of selling various types of items at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell. She is 22 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has one child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama G. est une dame de 53 ans, mariée avec à sa charge 5 enfants dont des petits fils. Elle achète des légumes et autres produits qu’elle revend au marché et souvent avec l’aide de ses enfants. Elle souhaite assurer la nourriture, la scolarité, les soins de santé et l’habillement à ses enfants
texts.en:
Mariama G. is a 53 year old woman married with 5 little children at her care. She buys vegetables and other items which she retails in the market usually with the help of her children. She hopes to provide for the feeding, schooling, health care and clothing of her children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and retail of vegetables and other miscelleneous items.

loans.name: Ogundipe

texts.en: Ogundipe is 47 years old and married with six children. She sells drinks and provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Hassen

texts.en:
Hassen J. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts (peanuts) and is requesting a loan to purchase simsim (sesame seeds) to sell.

Hassen is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a project manager in UNDP (United Nations Development Program) Sudan. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase simsim to sell

loans.name: Lumet

texts.en:
Lumet R. makes a living selling charcoal, and has applied for this loan to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.  She is 39 years old and has four children, all of whom are in school. Her husband works as a teacher. With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aishe

texts.en: Aishe makes a living selling cosmetics and hair extensions. She has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Aishe is 20 years old, single, and has no children. She says thank you to all the Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica al cultivo de la papa, la quinua y el trigo. Referente a la papa, Edith la procesa para secarla y venderla a un mayor precio. Su esposo es parte primordial en sus labores y ella lo ayuda en todo lo que es necesario, pero durante las épocas de siembra y/o cosecha es cuando necesitan a más personas, por lo que contratan los servicios de peones y deben hacer una fuerte inversión para los pagos, pero con la venta de la papa seca en los principales mercados de su ciudad recuperan lo invertido. Esto anima a Edith a seguir planificando su futuro con el aumento de su producción y la búsqueda de nuevos puntos de venta. Esta es la octava vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona que siempre impulsa  la unidad de su banco comunal y este nuevo ciclo no será la excepción. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de leña para la cocción de la papa que posteriormente se seca al sol.
texts.en:
Edith is 33 and lives with her three children and her husband in their own home. She has produced potatoes, quinoa, and wheat for 15 years. She processes the potatoes to dry them and to sell them at a better price. Her husband is a fundamental part of her work, and she helps him in everything that is necessary. But during planting and/or harvest season is when they need more people, so they hire workers, and they have to make a big investment to pay them. But selling the dried potatoes in the city markets lets them recover their investment. This motivates Edith to keep planning her future by increasing her prodcution and searching for new selling points. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She drives unity in her communal bank, and her ninth loan won't be the exception. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of firewood to cook potatoes that she later dries in the sun.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood to process potatoes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 34 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living running a grocery store where she sells milk, candies, cream and other items. She has applied for this loan to buy more groceries to sell to her customers. Grace says thank you to all Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años. Desde hace 32 años se dedica a la agricultura, todos los días sale a cuidar de sus tierras de cultivo y su esposa es su principal apoyo. Los principales productos que produce son la papa, el trigo, la cebada y la quinua. Sus mayores ingresos son gracias a la siembra de los granos, por lo que cada vez, intensifica más el cultivo de estos productos. Este trabajo es una labor agotadora, pero se ve recompensada con las ganancias que le permiten cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Además siempre tiene disponible alimentos para su propio consumo y eso es una gran ventaja de ser agricultor, por lo que seguirá trabajando en esta actividad y mejorando la calidad de sus tierras a base de abono. Esta es la octava vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene grandes deseos de continuar con su banco comunal porque disfruta de cada reunión donde prima el bienestar común. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de abono y al pago del arrendamiento de un terreno que utilizó para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 55 and lives with his wife and two children, who are 12 and 8. For 32 years, he has practiced agriculture. Every day he goes out to his fields, and his wife is his main source of support. The main products that he produces are potatoes, wheat, barley, and quinoa. His biggest investments, thanks to his harvests, are in grains, and he intensifies his growing of these crops more and more with each planting. This work is hard but he is rewarded with his profits that let him cover his home's expenses. He also has food available for his own consumption, and this is a big advantage of being a farmer. He will keep working in this activity and improve the quality of his land through fertilizer. This is his eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He has big hopes of continuing to work with his communal bank because he enjoys each reunion where their common well-being is the top priority. The money that he is requesting will go towards the purchase of fertilizer and towards paying for renting land that he used to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay for land he rented

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 17 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años que cultiva la tierra, siembra trigo, cebada, habas y papa. Todos los días se encarga de hacer un recorrido por sus plantas para asegurarse de su correcto crecimiento. Como  acaba de cosechar recientemente, está en la tarea de encostalar sus productos para llevarlos todos los fines de semana a vender en el mercado de su localidad y así obtener las ganancias que se hicieron esperar por 6 meses. Durante la época de cosecha necesita de mucha ayuda, es por eso que todos los integrantes de su familia trabajan y también contrata a peones para que  ayuden en esta labor. Gladys está muy contenta de realizar esta actividad porque le permite disfrutar del paisaje, y aunque el trabajo sea muy fatigoso es su forma de vida, nos dice. Para los próximos años su deseo es sembrar mayor cantidad de extensiones de tierra para obtener mayores ganancias. Esta es la octava vez que Gladys tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy perseverante y en su banco comunal siempre promueve el trabajo responsable. En esta ocasión renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará sacos de abono y fertilizantes para la próxima campaña de siembra que será el próximo mes.
texts.en:
Gladys is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her two children who are 16 and 17 years old. For 15 years she has been farming, sowing wheat, barley, beans and potatoes. Every day she looks after her crops to make sure they are growing correctly. As it was recently the harvest, she is now working on the task of putting her products in sacks in order to bring them each weekend to sell at the market in her town and therefore obtain the earnings for which they have waited for 6 months. During the harvest she needs a lot of help, and because of that all of the members of her family work and she also hires laborers to help her with this work. Gladys is very content with doing this activity because it allows her to enjoy the scenery, and although the work is very tiring, it is her way of life, she tells us. For the coming years her desire is to sow a larger quantity of farmland in order to increase her earnings. This is the eighth time that Gladys has had a loan with MFP. She is a very persevering person and her community bank always supports responsible work. In this occasion she is renewing her promise to be punctual in her payments. With the money that she is asking for she will buy sacks of manure and fertilizers for the next sowing season that will happen next month.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 26, 17 y 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 26 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, teniendo como productos principales a la papa, el trigo, la cebada, las habas y la linaza, las cuales vende directamente en los principales mercados de su ciudad. De esta manera logra ver los resultados de su arduo trabajo y el de toda su familia. Maria siempre almacena parte de su cosecha para el consumo familiar y la crianza de sus animales menores, como los cuyes que le sirven de alimento. Por eso le es indispensable  administrar bien sus ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos que tienen, tanto en la educación de sus hijos, como en el pago de sus cuentas. Con esta actividad como fuente primordial de ingresos, se proyectan hacia el futuro para la extensión de sus terrenos agrícolas. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, ella es una socias muy activas en su banco comunal y siempre se compromete en las tareas necesarias para que su grupo salga adelante. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado al pago los sacos de abono que solicitó en crédito para su última siembra.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children (ages 26, 17 and 14). She has been farming for 26 years, growing primarily potatoes, wheat, barley, beans and flax. She sells her harvested products in the major markets in her area. Each season, she can see the results of her hard work and that of her entire family. Maria saves a portion of her harvest for family consumption, and she also raises small animals (such as guinea pigs) for food. It is essential that she manages her income well so that she can cover her living expenses and pay for her children’s education. Since this is her primary source of revenue, she hopes to acquire more land to expand her farm.

This is Maria’s eighth loan with MFP. She is a very active member of her communal bank and always undertakes the tasks necessary for her group to succeed. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for the sacks of fertilizers she acquired on credit from the previous harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the sacks of fertilizer she bought on credit

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 35 años, vive con sus 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años decidió dedicarse a las actividades ganaderas, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos cuando tienen tiempos libres de sus estudios. Marlene tiene en su establo vacas, toros y ovejas, y para alimentarlos siembra alfalfa y forraje en sus tierras de cultivo, los que diariamente extrae por las mañanas, los hace secar y luego se los da a sus animales. De esa manera los mantiene gordos y saludables para venderlos en la feria ganadera de su zona. Cuanto más saludables estén, mejor precio puede ofrecer por ellos, por eso es muy detallista en el cuidado que les da. Por los resultados exitosos que ha tenido en ocasiones anteriores, Marlene se atreve a pensar en el futuro con más confianza y va adquirir mayor cantidad de animales para seguir con esta actividad. Esta es la octava vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, porque es un grupo estable y honesto en la administración de sus ingresos, esto la anima a seguir trabajando con esta metodología. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de un torete para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Marlene is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her three sons, ages 12, 10, and 8. Two years ago, Marlene decided to begin raising livestock, relying on help from her sons when they have time away from their studies.

Marlene has cows, bulls and ewes in her stable, and to feed them, she grows alfalfa and forage in her fields, which she gathers every morning to dry and then give to her animals. In this way she keeps her animals fat and healthy in order to sell them at her local livestock market. The healthier the animals the better the price she can be offered for them by buyers from the city.

Because of the success she has had previously, Marlene looks to the future with confidence and is going to acquire more animals in order to pursue her business. This is the eighth time she has sought a loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of this community bank because it is a stable and honest in the way it administers its revenues. This is the spirit to use working in this business. The money she is applying for will be used for the purchase of a young bull which will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a young bull

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años en su casa propia.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa, trigo y cebada. Su esposo es su principal apoyo en esta labor y la razón por la que se hace menos pesado su trabajo cuando siembra y cosecha. Ellos venden sus productos directamente a los comerciantes del mercado central de su ciudad, de esta forma tienen mayores ganancias, sin intermediarios, que por lo general  pagan un precio que no compensa el gran esfuerzo y la inversión. Maruja y su esposo desean seguir con estas tareas, por lo que aumentarán su producción sembrando en más terrenos. Esta es la séptima oportunidad que cuenta con MFP para un crédito, ha notado durante todo este tiempo que es muy beneficioso trabajar en equipo, por lo que se anima a continuar en su banco comunal. El dinero que vienen solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono para la próxima siembra que está a punto de realizar.
texts.en:
Maruja is 33 years old. She lives with her husband, and her 2 children who are 14 and 11, in their own house. She has been a farmer for 13 years. She plants potatoes, wheat, and barley. Her husband supports her in this work and helps her a lot at planting and harvesting time. They sell their products directly to the buyers in the central market of their city; they get a better price without intermediaries. Intermediaries usually pay a price that doesn’t compensate the hard work and investment of the farmer. Maruja and her husband want to continue in their work, which is why they will increase their production by planting on more land. This is the seventh time she has had a loan with MFP. She has noticed during this time that it is very beneficial to work in a team, which is why she wants to continue with the communal bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer for the next planting, which she is about to begin.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 54 años, vive con sus 2 nietos, es casada, pero su esposo viaja continuamente por motivos laborales, él vende madera. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales en un lugar que acondiciona fuera de su casa cada día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la venta directa, pues le agrada conversar con sus clientes y darles un trato amable. Considera que este negocio le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitado, y las personas con tan sólo ver sus variados platillos no dejan de comprar para degustar su sazón. Para más adelante, Mary quiere tener un restaurante muy bien implementado, donde pueda vender sus comidas con mayor comodidad y donde pueda atender a más personas. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que juntamente con todos sus compañeros, trabajan responsablemente y son bien coordinados. El dinero que solicita será usado para la construcción de un kiosco adecuado para atender a sus clientes, pues ahora lo hace a la intemperie.
texts.en:
Mary is 54 and lives with her two grandchildren. She is married, but her husband is always traveling for his job. He sells wood. For three years, she has sold regional food every day in a place she has fixed up outside of her house. What she likes about her job is making sales because she likes conversing with her customers, and she tries to give them friendly service. She thinks her business is profitable because it is located in a busy area. Once people see her variety of dishes, they don't stop buying from her because of her good cooking. In the future, Mary wants to have a restaurant where she can sell her food in greater comfort and where she can serve more people. This is the first loan she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma. What she likes about her communal bank is being with her fellow members, who work responsibly and who are well-coordinated. The money she is requesting will go towards building a kiosk so she can attend to her customers. Now she makes her sales out in the open.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 22 años, vive con su pareja, quien es afilador en una empresa maderera, ambos tienen una hijita de 2 añitos de edad y por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, pan, y otros productos de consumo básico), negocio que ha implementado en un espacio que le brindaron sus suegros, quienes la apoyan mucho. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es atender al público, por eso les da una buena atención, además esta actividad la mantiene activa. Ella considera que su negocio es rentable porque por su zona es la única persona que tiene este tipo de negocio y sus clientes se sienten satisfechos de contar con su negocio. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros comparten ideas y se apoyan entre sí. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su negocio y ambientarlo adecuadamente para dar una mejor vista a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rocio is 22 years old and lives with her partner who is a knife grinder at a lumber business. Together they have a 2-year-old daughter and they currently live at their in-law’s house. For two years she has been selling groceries and basic necessities (rice, milk, bread, and other basic consumption products). She started this business in a space provided to her by her in-laws, who greatly support her. What she likes about her work is attending to the public, and because of that she gives them good attention; additionally, this work keeps her active. She considers her business to be profitable because in her neighborhood she is the only person that has this type of business and her customers feel satisfied in counting on her business. This is her fourth loan with MFP and what she likes about her village bank is that all of her companions share ideas with each other and support each other. With the money she’s asking for she will increase the size of her business and adequately liven up the environment to give her customers a better atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the environment of her store

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 33 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living as a seamstress, and is the leader of a trust bank group known as ‘Esther’. She is at center in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers, and they all work hard to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from nearby communities and sell them in the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members of this group have been in business for a long time and have amassed a great deal of experience. They are seeking a loan to procure more goods and expand their businesses. Their overriding goal is to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to their customers

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa y uno de sus 4 hijos, quien lo apoya en su negocio. Tiene un taller de carpintería en su propia casa, donde fabrica muebles en todas sus variedades y estilos, y al gusto del cliente; también repara muebles que se encuentren en mal estado dejándolos como recién salidos de la tienda, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y de su hijo quienes le son de gran utilidad. En esta labor de la carpintería y ebanistería ya lleva un periodo de 15 años y lo que le gusta es que le permite llevar una vida tranquila y demostrar su arte y creatividad. Por otro lado, lo considera muy rentable, ya tiene muchos clientes regulares quienes confían en su buen trabajo. Posteriormente, a Roger le gustaría poder exportar los muebles que fabrica a otros lugares. Este es tu 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que se gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos son puntuales en sus reuniones y pago de cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más madera para mantenerse activo en la actividad que tanto le gusta.
texts.en:
Roger is 60 years old. He lives with his wife and one of his four children who helps him in his business. He has a carpentry shop in his house where he makes furniture in all varieties and styles, however the client likes. He also repairs furniture items that he finds in poor condition, making them look like they just came from the store. His wife and his son assist him in this and they are a great help to him. He has been working in carpentry and cabinetmaking for 15 years. He likes this profession because it allows him to have a tranquil life and to demonstrate his artistry and creativity. On the other hand, he also finds it to be good business; he has many regular clients who trust in his good work. Eventually, Roger would like to be able to export the furniture he makes to other places. This is his 4th loan with MFP and what he likes about working with his communal bank is that everyone is punctual at the meetings and in their payments. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy more wood to continue with the work that he likes so much.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.es: Sabrina tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos, vive con su pareja, su abuelito y su hermana. La casa que habitan es de su madre. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de discos para aserrar madera, negocio que realiza junto a su pareja, ambos salen a vender esta herramienta a todos los talleres donde trabajan con madera. Lo que le gusta a Sabrina de su trabajo es conocer muchos lugares y aprender cada día más sobre su negocio, además le es rentable porque vende a un precio accesible y va directamente a las personas que utilizan estos discos. Para más adelante, Sabrina quiere tener una tienda donde venda mayor cantidad y variedad de herramientas e instrumentos para el trabajo con madera. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros y compañeras son responsables y solidarios. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más de estos discos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sabrina is 30 and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband, her grandfather, and her sister. They live in her mother's house. She has sold saw blades for two years, a business that she has with her husband. Both of them go out to sell this product in the shops where people work with wood. What Sabrina likes about her job is getting to know many places and to learn more every day about her business. It is profitable for her because she sells at an accessible price, and she goes directly to the people that use these saw blades. In the future, Sabrina wants to have a store where she can sell a larger quantity and variety of tools and instruments for woodwork. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and what she likes about her communal bank is that all of her fellow members are responsible and united. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more saw blades to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Nyame Beko Agye Yen Group

texts.en: Martha is 42 years old, married and has one daughter. She makes a living selling cereals, and leads a trust bank group called "Nyame beko agye yen," which means "God will fight to vindicate us." She is in the center of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers, and work hard to support their  families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members of this group have been in business for a long time, and have amassed a great deal of experience. They are seeking a loan to help them buy more goods to sell and expand their businesses. It is the overriding desire of members of this group to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to their customers

loans.name: Omolayo

texts.en: Omolayo sells kerosene and provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more kerosene to sell. Toyin is 37 years old and married with six children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Julius Mbola

texts.en:
Julius O. is a 36-year-old man whose wife Pamela is a fish monger. Together they have four children who go to school. Julius has been in the shoe making business since 2007.

This is Julius’s first loan from KADET, and he has never borrowed from any micro finance institution before. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client.

Julius will use this loan to buy materials and tools for making new shoes for sale. Currently he works from a sidewalk stall, but his future aspiration is to own a raw material shop for making new shoes.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools for making new shoes for sale.

loans.name: Member Good Group

texts.en:
Here are Aminata S., Kadiatu M., and Abbie T.. They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Member Good – a Krio phrase meaning 'think good'. This will be the very first loan these women are accessing from SMT/Kiva. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs due to the lack of sufficient capital. They thus applied to SMT for loans of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to develop their businesses.

Aminata S. (middle) is the leader of the group. Aminata was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-five years of age, married to a prison officer, and they have three children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School One (JSS I), the other in class six and the third in class one. Aminata sells clothes for babies and has been in this business for nineteen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola sells textbooks. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more textbooks to sell. Ola is 41 years old and married with a child. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Awurade Ne Yen Boafo Group

texts.en:
Livingston is fifty-five years old. He is married and has six children. He sells mineral water in a store by the roadside. Livingston is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade ne yen boafo’. This means 'the Lord is our helper'. He is in the middle in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Chelsea Group

texts.en:
These gentlemen are small-scale businessmen in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group after their favorite football team, Chelsea. This will be the first loan they are accessing from SMT/Kiva. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs, but with the help of a loan, their businesses will develop at a faster rate and make better profit, so that their living standards will improve.

Gibo Akim K. (right) is the leader of the group. Gibo was born in Makeni city thirty-two years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. One of their children is in class six and the other is in class two. Gibo owns a shop in which he sells a variety of items including drinks, biscuits, sugar, batteries, onions, etc. He has been in this business for more than ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 42 years old and married with four children. She sells palm oil by the gallon to market women within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, un grupo que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, en el sur de Ecuador. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.

La señora tiene 57 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos ya mayores. También tiene 13 nietos. Tiene dos vacas lecheras. Ella ordeña a sus vacas, después hace cuajar a la leche y hace quesos, los cuales vende a negociantes. Hace más o menos 10 libras de queso por semana. Ella también tiene cultivos de maíz, pero es para el consumo de su familia y no para vender. 

Rosa Elena está pidiendo este préstamo para poner criaderos de pollos. Su meta para el futuro es poner un negocio de huevos y también comprar chanchos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Elena is a member of the communal bank group “Nuevo Amanecer”, which consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, located about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. The main business activities in the area are agriculture and livestock.

Sra. Rosa Elena is 57 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. She also has 13 grandchildren. She owns 2 dairy cows that produce the milk she uses to make cheese, which she sells to dealers. Each week, she produces 10 pounds of cheese. She also grows corn, but it is strictly for family consumption and not for sale.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase chickens for breeding. Her future goals include starting a business selling eggs and acquiring some pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens for breeding

loans.name: Anges Group

texts.en:
These are Kaday K. and Nasiratu K.. They named their Anges Group.  They are both local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans through SMT. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.  Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Kaday K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is sixty years of age. She was born in Fadugu, in northern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with six children. Four of her children are already grown-ups and two are still in secondary schools. Kaday has been a businesswoman for over twenty-one years now. Kaday sells cigarette, mints, matches, etc., and palm-wine. She will use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Violeta 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Tomasa D. L. (second to the right in the front row) is one of the coordinators for the Bank of Hope Violeta and a budding entrepreneur. She lives about an hour outside the capital, Santo Domingo, and makes a living selling clothes door-to-door. While Tomasa has had this business for six years, it’s grown since she took out her first loan in December 2007. Since then, Tomasa has paid back two loans and is now taking out her third (exactly twice the amount of her first one!)

One of the greatest benefits of a micro-loan is that it provides Tomasa with the capital she needs to expand her business. While many clothes vendors must travel to the capital two to four times each month to purchase new merchandise, Tomasa only has to make this trip once monthly. This indicates that she has a stable and steady source of income, which allows her to make larger merchandise investments. Since she does not have to make this trip as frequently, she reduces travel costs and also has more time sell the clothes. Since receiving her first loan, Tomasa has expanded her business to reach 12 rather than 6 communities within her city. While this growth is certainly impressive, Tomasa continues to dream and plan; she eventually hopes to own a store.

Tomasa’s aspirations also reach beyond her business as she has high aspirations for her eight-year-old son. While she wants him to study to become a lawyer, he is not yet convinced and would rather pursue a future as a policeman!

In her free time, Tomasa enjoys reading her Bible and learning about beautician practices and computers.

On behalf of Tomasa, the Bank of Hope Violeta, and the micro-finance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need it most!

loans.use: more clothes to sell

loans.name: A And J Group

texts.en:
Here are Jariatu J., M’mah B., Mariatu K., and Isatu S. of the A and J group. These women are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses.

Jariatu J. (right) is the leader of this group. Jariatu is thirty-two years of age. She was born in Sanda village, northeast of Makeni. She is married to a government health officer and they have four children. Two of their children are in secondary school, one in primary school and the last is still young. This will be the third loan Jariatu and members of her group are accessing from SMT. With previous loans, she has seen a vast improvement in her business. She sells provisions – milk, sugar, butter, margarine, mayonnaise, etc. She also sells rice. Mariatu has been in this business for six years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Nyame Behwe Yen Group

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to one daughter. She runs a cold store. Margaret is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame behwe yen ’. This means 'God will cater for us'. She is seated in front in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
These are Zainab J., Hawa S., Adama J., and Mohamed S.. They call their group 'Faithful'. They are entrepreneurs based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the first loan these people are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them develop their business.

Zainab J. (right) is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in Makeni; she is twenty years of age. She is married to a driver and they have two children. One is in class two and the other is still suckling. Zainab sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been in the business for over five years now. With this loan, she will be able at last to get forty gallons of palm oil from a Luma village called Foredugu.

loans.use: Invest In her business

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Henry is forty-three years old. He is married and has three children. He is a professional photographer. Henry is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God is Able’. He is the only man in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: to expand their businesses

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is married with 3 children. She sells clothing at the central market in Melitopol city. She has been in this business for 14 years. Large experience helps Svetlana to do her business well. Moreover, this kind of goods is in high demand at this market. Svetlana would like to develop her business further. She would like to receive a loan and use additional income to fix the entrance at her house.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is twenty-eight years old. He is single and has no children but cares for a younger sibling. He lives independently in a rented apartment in a farming and commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Joseph sells agrochemicals. He buys the chemicals from Kumasi and sells them in a store in his community. He supplies to farmers in his community. Joseph has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy agrochemicals and fertilizers in bulk to expand his business. Joseph desires to save for his future and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
These are Memunatu T., Ramatu Mamdo, Isatu M., Mamusu K. and Sallay B.. They named their group Unity Group. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni City. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT. With the help of the previous loans, these entrepreneurs were able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their standard of living improves, so that they can feed, clothe and send their children to school. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 1,000,000 to further strengthen their businesses

Memunatu T. (middle) is the leader of this group. Memunatu was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty years of age. She is married to a lorry driver who plies between Makeni and Freetown. They have four children – two in secondary schools, one in primary school and the last is not of school-going age. For over fifteen years now, Memunatu has been in the fire-wood business. She sells fire-wood to members of her neighborhood. Out of this business, she is able to solve most of her numerous problems. She helps in the feeding of the home, giving lunch to their children, and buying slippers or pants for them when they wear out.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Veronica Segundina

texts.es:
La señora Segundina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 04 hijos y  tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (1er grado).  Vive en el Centro poblado de Paucarcolla, Sector Pakcha.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para su negocio de compra-venta de pescado. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado.  Una parte del préstamo lo utilizará para apoyar a su esposo en su negocio de compra y venta de artefactos.  Ambos administran este negocio.

Su deseo es poder poner un criadero de truchas.

A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Sra. Segundina belongs to the communal bank group “Santiago Apóstol", which is located in the Paucarcolla District of San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 4 children. She did not complete her education beyond the first grade. She lives in the central town of Paucaracolla, Pakcha sector.

Sra. Segundina has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her initial loan of 300 soles was used to buy fish for resale. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to purchase more fish. Part of her loan will also be used to help her husband buy and sell appliances. They both manage that business. In the future, she hopes to open a trout hatchery.

She likes having the ability to save and enjoys her community bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and a few appliances

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Molino, del distrito D. Juli, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 47 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 05 hijos y no tiene estudios, vive en el centro poblado D. Molino Barrio Miraflores.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra D. lana para elaboración D. artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. lana vegetal para elaborar tejidos, como animalitos y prendas D. vestir, además comprará bayeta (tela) para realizar bordados.  Ella venD. sus productos en las ferias D. la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la forma D. trabajo D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Senora Rufina belongs to the “Molino-Juli” Community Bank, which is located in Molino, the central town in the district of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has no schooling. She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of Molino.

For almost two years she has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for 300 New Soles which she used to purchase wool for making handicrafts.

Now, she is asking for a loan of 500 New Soles in order to buy wool for making items such as small animals or articles of clothing. She will also buy material for embroidery. She sells her products at local markets.

Rufina’s wish is to continue working and to be able to educate her children.

She likes the work of Movimiento Manuelo Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wool and embroidery material

loans.name: Bokk Yéné Group

texts.fr: L’écovillage de pointe Sarrène se trouve sur la petite côte, à 15 km après Mbour, sur la route de Joal. Il se caractérise par sa situation géographique qui le situe au bord de la mer. Il est connu pour être un port de pêche qui est l’activité principale qui se mène dans la zone. C’est pourquoi nous sollicitons un financement pour pouvoir occuper nos jeunes femmes à lutter contre l'oisiveté. Notre objectif est de créer des activités génératrices de revenu pour permettre à nos jeunes filles de travailler dans le village en transformant et en commercialisant des produits halieutiques qui sont débarqués tous les jours au port de pêche de la localité.
texts.en:
The Pointe Sarrène eco-village is situated on the coast, 15 km past Mbour, on the road to Joal. It is characterized by its geographic situation, on the sea coast. It is known as a fishing port and that is the principal activity in that area. This is why we are asking for a loan so as to be able to occupy our young women and thus fight against joblessness.

Our objective is to create money-earning activities to allow our young women to work in the village, processing and commercializing seafood which is offloaded daily at the port right where we are.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: processing of seafoods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou M. est une femme mariée, avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle fait de la bouillie de mil qu’elle vend elle-même. Cette activité lui permet de mieux participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou M. is a married woman raising 6 children. She makes millet porridge which she sells herself. This business permits her to help support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of millet porridge

loans.name: Nialing

texts.fr: Nialing B. est âgée de 57 ans, veuve avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle vend du jus de fruit et de la bouillie locale qu’elle prépare elle-même. Son objectif est d’assurer une partie des charges familiales et de renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Nialing B., 57, is a widow with 6 children. She sells fruit juice and porridge made out of local ingredients which she prepares herself. Her goal is to cover a part of the family's expenses and bolster her businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: prepare and sell fruit juice and locally-produced porridge

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Martha Lorena P. se ha destacado en la venta de productos plásticos y de cristalería siendo productos personales los cuales son vendidos a diario en su localidad donde se esfuerza para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere invertir en la compra de los productos para ofrecerlos en su localidad y es por esto que espera que su crédito le sea entregado sin ningún problema para mejorar las circunstancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Sra. Martha Lorena P. has a distinguished business selling plastic goods and glassware. These types of personalized products sell on a daily basis from her store. Her strength is providing good service to her customers. She has come to CEPRODEL to request funding to purchase new products that she can offer in her store. Her loan is expected to be approved without any problems so that she can improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Néné Binta

texts.fr: Néné Binta M. est une femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’habits et de tissus pour participer aux charges familiales. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer cette activité et assurer une partie des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Néné Binta M., 29, is married and the mother of one child. She works selling garments and fabrics in order to help support the family. She wishes to use this loan to bolster her business so as to be certain that she can cover some of the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of garments and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: preparation and sale of food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up and sell palm nuts

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Née en 1975, Mme Akossiwa E. est mariée à un agriculteur avec qui elle a eu cinq (05) enfants. Elle fait le commerce de céréales tels que le mais, le mil et le sorgho. Elle a pour habitude d’aller dans les villages environnants de sa localité pour acheter les produits auprès des paysans et les stocker afin de les revendre en détail au moment où les prix flambent sur le marché. A l’approche des grandes récoltes, elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre de constituer les stocks de céréales. C’est un moyen par lequel elle va accroitre ses revenus commerciaux.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Ms. Akossiwa E. is married to a farmer, with whom she had five children. She does commerce in grains, such as corn, millet, and sorghum. She usually goes from village to village in the area to buy goods from rural producers. And she stores them in order to resell them retail when market prices skyrocket. At the approach of the major harvests, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to build up a stock of grains. This is how she is going to increase her commercial revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell grain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up and sell palm nuts

loans.name: Miramar Femenina Grupo 3, 4 Group

texts.en:
Meet Mrs. Rosa D., one of the most accomplished borrowers Esperanza has seen. She is requesting her eleventh loan. On each of the previous 10 loans, she has consistently invested in her business, and she has seen that business grow steadily.

She came to Esperanza as a local saleswoman selling perfumes and creams door-to-door throughout her neighborhood. However, she has moved on from that to sell natural medicines. Natural medicines are organic products used for all types of illnesses. They are very expensive products and she receives orders from all over the country.

Organic medicines are a very unique business to be in, but she reiterated she saw a market where there were not many sellers and seized on that vacancy. She has been very successful in this market and with the loan would like to grow the business even more. She has dreams one day of having a separate store and home, and hopefully shortly this dream will come true.

loans.use: natural medicines

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Mme Abra F. est mère de cinq (05) enfants. Issue d’une famille très pauvre, elle n’arrive à s’en sortir qu’en revendant des produits alimentaires en particuliers les petits poissons séchés ou fumés dans son village. Malgré son dévouement et sa détermination, elle n’arrive pas à percer dans son activité, parce que n’ayant pas de moyens. Elle sollicite donc un appui financier en vue d’entreprendre un véritable commerce susceptible de la faire sortir de la pauvreté.
texts.en:
Ms. Abra F. is the mother of five children. Born into a very poor family, she only manages to get by through the selling of food items, particularly small dried or smoked fish in her village. Despite her devotion and determination, she has not had a break-through in her business because of a lack of means. She is therefore requesting financial support with the aim of launching into actual commerce that is likely to lift her out of poverty.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a larger amount of used clothes to sell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Yala Yana Group

texts.fr: Au Sénégal, la pêche est une activité qui revêt une importance économique, sociale et culturelle. L’écovillage de pointe S.ène se trouve sur la petite côte, à 15 km après Mbour, sur la route de Joal. Il se caractérise par sa situation géographique qui le situe au bord de la mer. Cependant voulant créer des activités génératrices de revenu, nous les femmes du groupement « Yala yana » sollicitons un prêt à Kiva pour faire la  transformation (fumage, braisage, séchage au sel) de produits halieutiques. Le produit fini, nous le commercialisons dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les hôtels.
texts.en:
In Senegal, fishing is an activity that has taken on economic, social, and cultural importance. The eco-village of Pointe S.ène is found on La Petite Côte and 15 km past Mbour, on the road to Joal. It is characterized by its location on the coast. Wanting to create revenue-generating businesses, we the women of the group "Yala Yana" are requesting a loan from Kiva to process seafood (smoking, mixing, salt drying). We will market the finished products in the weekly markets and in hotels.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To process seafood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Superacion Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Miguelina A. is new to Esperanza, but has heard about the successes of the program from some of her neighbors. She earns a living by selling used clothes from her home, and she began to realize she was having a difficult time growing her business in any substantial way. At the same time, she saw her neighbors who were using Esperanza were able to invest a significant amount of money in their businesses and they were seeing them flourish.

Currently, Miguelina is only able to purchase a limited amount of clothing, which prevents her from taK. any large steps in successful development. It may come as a surprise to some, but the business of selling used clothes is a huge business. Thousands if not millions of Dominicans rely on used clothes for the clothes on their back. This is one of the reasons Miguelina believes she will be successful with a loan to grow her business.

Miguelina hopes that in the future she will succeed with this first loan, and she will be able to move on with no end in sight. Her dream is to someday own her own store, selling not used clothes but new, fashionable clothes. She sees Esperanza as the only way she can get on this path.

loans.use: the purchase of more used clothes to be sold throughout her neighborhood.

loans.name: Reina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
la sra. REINA DE LOS ANGELES I. se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maiz y leche, pero el negocio de la venta de tortillas lo esta sustituyendo por el de reposteria y su especialidad es la elaboración de tortas de pan, galletas, siempre tiene la venta de leche, doña reina saco un curso en reposteria y miro que era mejor hacer pasteles y tortas que hacer tortillas de maiz porque le genera mejores ingresos y fisicamente se maltrata menos.
Doña Reina tiene 4 hijos, es casada su esposo se dedica a la Admon. De una pequeña finca de ganado y con los ingresos que persibe el cubre la mayoria de los gastos en el hogar.
Con los ingresos que le genera el negocio a la Sra. I. ha podido lograr mas fuentes para su bienestar como ser una buena educacion para sus hijos , una sana alimentacion, y otros cuidados dentro del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Reina de los Angeles I. sells corn tortillas and milk. However, she wants to quit the tortilla business and open a bakery instead. She plans to make her specialties – bread and cookies. The milk business she will continue to keep. Doña Reina took a course in making confectioneries, so she thought it would be best to start producing pastries and cakes. It would be more profitable than making corn tortillas, and less physically demanding as well.

Doña Reina has 4 children. She is married to her devoted husband Admon. Living on a small farm, they manage to cover most of their living expenses. With her business earnings, Doña Reina has secured the wellbeing of her family by educating her children, providing wholesome meals and taking care of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lard, sugar, flour, eggs, milk and margarine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Domitilia

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA DOMITILIA M. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de harina, estas tortillas se usan para hacer baleadas. ella las hace y despues sale a venderlas a las pulperias y  tambien en su propia vivienda.
La Sra. M. tiene 1 hijo que esta cursando la secundaria.
Doña Maria con las ventas que ha realizado en estos ultimos meses ha tenido muy buenos ingresos que le han podido generar mas desarrollo para su vida y la de su hijo.- Doña Maria tiene 7 años de estar al frente de este tipo de negocio donde ha sabido sacar provecho para asi poder generar mas utilidades a su negocio como comprar mas mercaderia para mantener siempre una buena clientela que ha sabido poder ganar con el esfuerzo diario que hace elaborando las deliciosas tortillas de harina.
en estos momentos necesita comprar al por mayor los ingredientes para elaborar las tortillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Domitilia M. is dedicated to making and selling flour tortillas, which are used for making “baleadas” (the Honduran version of a burrito). She makes and sells her products to groceries stores and also from her own home. Sra. M. has a son who is finishing high school.

In recent months, Doña Maria has earned a good income from her sales which has helped improve the living situation for her and her son. She has been in this line of work for 7 years, so she knows what it takes to get ahead and generate more profits. She needs to buy more products in order to keep good customers who want delicious well-prepared flour tortillas each day.

At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ingredients at wholesale for making tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of flour, lard, soda and plastic bags for packaging

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sandra Del Rosario

texts.es:
la sra. SANDRA DEL ROSARIO E. O. se dedica a la venta de baleadas, ella elabora las tortillas. las baleadas que ella vende son de varios tipos como ser: con frijoles, queso y huevos, con frijoles y carne de res o carne de cerdo y las especiales que llevan de todo.
El negocio de la Sra. E. se encuentra ubicado en la colonia Apaguiz en el estacionamiento de la gasolinera "ESSO ROCA" salida a Jamastran. El negocio de ella opera bajo el nombre de Baleadas "La Amistad".
Doña Sandra es madre soltera con (3) hijos, y tiene 3 años de residir en el mismo lugar.
Gracias a los ingresos que le genera su negocio ha podido mantenerse por si sola y brindarles todo el apoyo a sus hijos y darle mayor solvencia a su negocio, tiene una buena clientela.
Su meta es poder ver a sus hijos graduados de secundaria y tener su propio techo dingno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Ms. Sandra Del Rosario E. O. has committed herself to selling baleadas (a wheat flour tortilla filled with seasoned beans). She sells various types of baleadas, such as: those with beans, those with egg and cheese, beef and beans or sausage and the specials of the day.

Ms. E.’s business is located in the Apaguiz colony at the “Esso Roca” gas station off the Jamastran exit. Her business operates under the name “La Amistad.”

Ms. Sandra is a single parent of (3) three boys and has resided in the same place for the last 3 years. She is thankful for the profits she has generated from the business which have helped her maintain it solely on her own. It has also given her the ability to help her children and retain good clients through fruitful business. Her goal is to ensure her children graduate middle school and have a proper roof where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for food preparation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yajaira Lizeth

texts.es:
la sra. YAJAIRA LIZETH P. QUIÑONES se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para caballeros, damas y niños, tambien ropa interior para ambos sexos.
su negocio esta ubicado en el Boulevard de esta ciudad de Danli frente al campo "Julio Verne" ella tiene (4) cuatro años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y se ve notablemente que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar muy bien, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio logro a graduarse en nivel secundadrio y cubre a un 100% los gastos personales.- El local donde esta ubicado su negocio es un lugar muy apto para este tipo de actividad ya que se encuentra instalado en una de las calles mas transitadas de esta ciuidad.
La Sra.Yajaira, es casada y su esposo se dedica al comercio, tiene una venta y reparción de celulares, y venta de accesorios de los mismos.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor
texts.en:
