Mrs. Yajaira Lizeth Palima Quinones has dedicated herself to selling new clothes for men, women and children as well as selling under garments for both sexes.

Her business is located on the Boulevard of the city of Danli, near the Julio Verne field. She has been operating this business for the last four years and things have markedly improved under her management. With the profits generated from the business she was able to graduate schooling and pay 100% of all her personal expenses.

The location for this business is located in a highly suitable location for this type of transaction as it is set up on one of the most trafficked streets in the city. Mrs. Yajaira is married and her husband is in the business of selling and repairing cellular phones and their accessories. Mrs. Yajaira needs the loan to be able to purchase more wholesale merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wholesale merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miriam Oneida

texts.es:
la sra. MIRIAM ONEIDA ORDOÑEZ E. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia y venta de frutas que se encuentra ubicada en la terminal de transporte de buses de esta ciudad. 
Su negocio es apto para este lugar ya que aqui transitan muchas personas que viajan todos los dias y con los ingresos que genera cubre los gastos de su hogar ya que su esposo emigro hace 3 años a los Estados Unidos para poder mejorar su condicion de vida, ya que en sus planes es tener su propia vivienda,  con las remesas que ha recibido y recibe de su esposo son para la construccion de su vivienda misma que se encuentra en construcion todavia teniendo terminadas todas las 
paredes y techado faltandole todos los arreglos internos a la misma. 
Doña Miriam se ha sabido ganar los clientes por su carácter personal.
texts.en:
Ms. Miriam Oneida Ordonez E. has dedicated herself to her business; she has a grocery store and sells fruits. This business is located at the bus terminal in the city.

Her business is in the right place as there are a lot of people travelling back and forth all day. With the profits generated from the business she has been able to cover all her household expenses as her husband emigrated to the United States 3-years ago to provide for better living conditions. They plan to have a proper dwelling with the funds they’ve saved and continue to receive from her husband. The construction of the dwelling is still going on to the walls, the roof and internal arrangements.

Mrs. Miriam has been able to win many clients with personality.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various items for her grocery store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paola Rosa

texts.es:
la sra. PAOLA ROSA L. A. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio  de venta de ropa, calzado, lociones, implementos para ocaiones especiales, etc. Este negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Abajo de esta ciudad, opera bajo el nombnre de "PAOLA DREAMS".
Paola tiene 10 años de estar al frente de este tipo de actividades que con el esfuerzo diario que hace, ha podido mantenerse y cubrir sus gastos condicionales.- es importante mencionar que Paola inicio con este tipo de comercio, venta de ropa de manera ambulante y gracias al esfuerzo pudo montar su negocio en un lugar fijo hace 3 años, donde ha podido tener una buena clientela que la han generado muy buenos ingresos para su vivienda, su familia y su propio negocio.
Es casada y tiene 43 años, se siente muy feliz porque gracias a su exfuerzo y empeño ella a logrado que sus hijos  se hicieran profesionales, actualmente  solo tiene un hijo que depende economicamente de ella.
Es Importante mensionar que todo lo que ahora ha logrado se debe a mucho esfuerzo, siempre soño con 
tener su propio Local y ahora ya lo tiene.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paola Rosa L. A. is dedicated to her business of selling clothing, footwear, lotions and items for special occasions and etc. This business is located in Barrio Abajo in the city and goes under the name of “Paola Dreams.”

Paola has been at the helm for 10 years at this type of activity which requires much daily effort. She has been able to manage and cover all her personal expenses, which is important to mention for Paola for this line of work. She sells casual clothing and is thankful to have started her business in a fixed location 3-years ago, where she has gained a good client base and has generado good profit for her home, her family and for the business.

Mrs. A. is 43-years old and is married. She feels very happy because of her efforts and she pledges to see her children become professionals and actually, she has one daughter that is already completely independent from her.

It is important to measure all the things now with much effort to always dream to have the right location and the right time for everything.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, casual shirts and blouses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francis Dalia

texts.es:
La microempresaria Francis Dalia B. Hernández tiene 47 años de edad, es casada tiene una hija la cual se encuentra estudiando en nivel secundario. La señora B. tiene un local en donde vende de todo un poco, tanto granos básicos como ropa de niños y adultos y otros productos más. Este negocio se encuentra  en el puerto El Bluff el cual esta ubicado a unos 5 kilómetros de Bluefields y cuenta con unos 3,000 habitantes.

Por esta razón la señora B. necesita un financiamiento ya que por el transporte los productos son más caros, por lo que requiere comprar en cantidades y poder vender un poco  mas barato que los demás negocios.

Cabe señalar que la señora B. ha sido cliente desde hace varios años de ADEPHCA y con el programa Kiva se ha beneficiado en una ocasión y esta solicitando un segundo crédito. Esta microempresaria ha demostrado en todos su créditos su capacidad de pagar sus compromisos.

Solicita se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos: 2 docenas de Ropa interior para hombres las que compra a US 48 dólares cada docena, 3 docenas de ropa interior para niños las que compra a US 34 dólares cada docena,  10 quintales de arroz americano, los que compra a US 40 dólares cada quintal, 6 quintales de azúcar los que compra a US 35 dólares cada quintal y 6 bidones de aceite los que compra a US 32 dólares cada bidón.
texts.en:
The small time entrepreneur Francis Dalia B. H. is 47-years old is married with one daughter who is studying in secondary school. Mrs. B. has a store where she sells all small grains, clothing for children and adults and other products. This business is located at the port of El Bluff which is situated about 5-kilometers from Bluefields and has about 3,000 inhabitants.

For this reason, Mrs. B. needs financing to transport the expensive products that are to be purchased in large quantities. Also she needs to sell needs to sell the smaller cheaper items that remain in the store. It should be noted that Mrs. B. has been a client with ADEPHCA for many years through the Kiva program and she has benefited the first time and is now seeking a second loan request. This small time entrepreneur has demonstrated to all that she has the capacity to repay her commitments.

The loan request is to purchase the following products: 2 dozen undergarments for men which cost $48 USD per dozen. 3 dozen undergarments for infants with cost $34 USD per dozen. 10 sacks of American rice which cost $40 USD for each sack, 6 sacks of sugar which cost $35 USD per sack and 6 drums of oil which costs $32 USD for each drum.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar Ropa interior para hombres, ropa interior para niños, arroz americano, azúcar y aceite.

loans.name: Las Peñitas De F.e. Group

texts.es:
Flavio C. C. y su familia son originarios de Oaxaca desde pequeño ayudaba a su mama a ordeñar  vacas ya que el negocio familiar era la elaboración de queso y crema.
Cuando terminaba el  horario de clases Flavio y sus hermanos le ayudaban a sus padres a vender los quesos en las rancherías cercanas. En el pueblo no había mas oportunidad de progreso así que Flavio decide empezar una nueva vida en la ciudad de México y emprender un negocio, ayudándose de su conocimiento y experiencia en la elaboración y venta de quesos. El se dedico a la distribución de sus productos en los tianguis de su comunidad. 
Flavio se levanta a las 4 de la mañana a elaborar su queso, crema y productos lácteos para su venta diaria, también una vez por semana hace entregas de su mercancia oaxaqueña (cecina, mole, chorizo, totopos, tlayudas, chocolate Etc.)
Para esto le solicita a su hermano que vive en Oaxaca que le envié los productos antes mencionado.
El señor hace dos años tuvo un accidente,  un trailer lo envistió y estuvo un año incapacitado y perdió todo. Ahora retoma su negocio nuevamente por eso decide formar un grupo con su esposa y su mama y  solicitar un crédito a Fundación Realidad A.C. para asi poder comprar materia prima (cuajo, sal, calcio, titanio  conservador, gas, tambos)  y mercancia oaxaqueña (cecina, mole, chorizo, totopos, tlayudas, chocolate etc.) Ya que sus ventas están incrementando 
El  y su familia tienen el anhelo de superarse y darle una mejor oportunidad en la vida a sus 4 hijos.

Nombre de grupo: Las Peñitas
Numero de integrantes 3
Monto solicitado: 15,000
Fecha  de desembolso: 07-de julio-2009
Nombres de las integrantes:
 Rosa María C. Castro: Venta de quesos y cosméticos  
 Patricia C. Núñez: Venta de queso y mercancia oaxaqueña 
 Flavio C. C.: Elaboración y venta de queso, crema y mercancia oaxaqueña

Comentarios de los integrantes del grupo      
 
"Gracias a las personas que nos apoyan y confían en nosotros para poder salir adelante"
texts.en:
Flavio C. C. and his family are originally from Oaxaca. Since childhood he has helped his mother milk cows for the family's business making cheese and cream. After school, Flavio and his brothers would help his parents sell the cheese at workers' quarters in nearby ranches. In their town there wasn't much opportunity to advance, so Flavio decided to start a new life in Mexico City and launch a business, helping him learn more and gain experience in making and selling cheeses. He dedicated himself to the distribution of his products in the community's street markets. Flavio gets up at 4:00 a.m. to make his cheese, cream and other dairy products to sell daily. Also, once a week he delivers his Oaxacan merchandise: cecina (cured, smoked meat), mole (chili sauce with chocolate and peanuts), chorizo (seasoned pork sausage), totopos (tortilla chips), tlayudas (large, crunchy tortilla topped with refried beans, meat, cheese, and salsa), chocolate, etc. For this he asks his brother who lives in Oaxaca to send him the above-mentioned products. Two years ago he had an accident; a trailer hit him and for a year he was disabled and lost everything because he couldn't work. Now he has re-started his business and thus decided to start a lending group with his wife and mother and request a loan from Fundación Realidad A.C. to be able to buy raw materials (rennet, salt, calcium, titanium preservative, propane, cans) and Oaxacan products. His sales are already growing. Flavio longs to advance himself and give his 4 children better opportunities. Group name: Las Peñitas Number of members: 3 Requested amount: 15,000 Disbursement date: July 7, 2009 Member names: Rosa María C. Castro: Sale of cheese and cosmetics Patricia C. Núñez: Sale of cheese and Oaxacan products Flavio C. C.: Production and sale of cheese, cream, and Oaxacan products Member comments: "Thank you to the people who support and trust us to be able to advance in life."

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cans to store milk, purchase rennet, salt, calcium, titanium, preservatives for cheese, cream, and cottage cheese. Purchase Oaxacan products such as cesina, mole, chorizo, tlayudas, totopo y chocolate etc.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca G. A. tiene 55 años. Vive con sus hijos. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de refrescos, posteriormente con el duro trabajo que realizaba, logro comprar cosméticos y ropa, por lo que así fue que se logro dar cuenta que este negocio le generaba ingresos, por lo que con esta actividad puede sostener la educación de sus hijos. Por lo que ha depositado todo su empeño con este trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de faldas, camisas, pantalones y chaquetas. Su mayor sueño es mantener este negocio para que a su familia no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca G. A. is 55 years old. She lives with her children. For the past seven years she has sold garments. She used to sell drinks, but with her hard work she managed to buy cosmetics and clothes to sell as well. She realized that this business earned her good income, allowing her to pay for her children's education. She has therefore put all of her effort into this work. The loan will be used as working capital to buy skirts, shirts, pants and jackets.

Juana's dream is to maintain her business so her family never has to go hungry.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es: La Señora Alba María García G. es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es una mujer casada tiene 50 años y es madre de 4 hijos, Todos ellos ya independientes. Ella emprende su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, el capital con el que dio inicio fue propio por lo que  no fue muy fácil, a pesar de su edad, Alba maneja un triciclo donde transporta su verdura, por lo que a su edad esta es una actividad muy cansada, todos los días ella se levanta muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante en las calles, pues ella tiene ciertos clientes que son estables. Con este financiamiento comprara tomates, cebollas, repollo y bananos. Su deseo es establecer su negocio en su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba María García G. works with Fundación Leon 2000. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. All of her children are now independent. She runs her own business of selling fruits and vegetables. Alba rides a tricycle to transport her vegetables. At her age, this is a very tiring activity. Every day she wakes up very early to sell her products, moving from street to street, as she has established relationships with certain customers. With this loan she will buy tomatoes, onions, cabbage and bananas. Her dream is to establish a business in her own humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Juana del Carmen P. es una cliente antigua, en su historial demuestra que es una cliente responsable y que ha sabido aprovechar sus financiamientos. Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella inicio vendiendo frutas en su vivienda, en donde ofrecía mangos, naranjas y bananos, pero Juana es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable con sus obligaciones de madre, por lo que además decide incursionar en la venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, y le ha gustado mucho pues disfruta su actividad. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que cuando llueve tiene problemas.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana del Carmen P. is a long-standing client who has demonstrated her responsibility and knowledge of how to handle her finances. She is a clothing vendor. Prior to this, she sold fruits and vegetables from her home where she offered mangos, oranges and bananas. Sra. Juana is a persistent woman and responsible with her obligations as a mother. She then decided to sell clothing. Having been in this line of business for 4 years now, she says she enjoys her work.

She will use her loan as working capital for her business. Her biggest dream is to set aside funds for home repairs so that she can avoid problems when it rains.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Cocos Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Los Cocos. Lo conforman 4 integrantes sus nombres son los siguientes Cristina de la Concepcion Gonzalez Herrera, Maria Isidora C., Eulalia Ines E. P. y Angela Agustina G. A.. Todas se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas. Cristina y Angela se dedican a brindar los servicios de costura, mientras que Maria se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y Eulalia a la venta y elaboracion de tortillas. Todas son mujer muy responsables y son madres responsables con sus hijos. Todas trabajn fuertemente para proporcionarles a sus familiaas las condiciones de vida necesarias. Es por eso el motivo de su financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Los Cocos Solidarity Group is comprised of 4 members: Cristina de la Concepcion Gonzalez Herrera Maria Isidora C. Eulalia Ines E. P. Angela Agustina G. A.

These women are involved in different business activities. Cristina and Angela offer tailoring services. Maria sells cosmetics. Eulalia makes and sells tortillas. All of these women are mothers who are responsible and dedicated to their children. They work extremely hard to provide for their families’ basic living necessities. For this reason, they have requested a loan to purchase materials for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Clemente Orlando

texts.es: Clemente Orlando T. E. tiene 53 años. Su actividad económica es un taller de soldadura. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios fueron muy duros ya que esta actividad, requiere de mucho trabajo, pero Clemente es un hombre que a pesar de su edad ha dedicado su vida, al trabajo desde muy joven. Por lo que sus padres eran muy pobres y no pudieron ofrecerle educación superior. Pero esto no fue impedimento para que Clemente saliera delante. Es destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de herramientas entre otros. Su mayor sueño es obtener más clientes para proporcionar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Clemente Orlando T. E. is 53 years old. He has been operating a welding shop for the past 20 years. It was difficult for him to get started, because this line of business requires a lot of effort. Despite his age, Clemente continues to dedicate himself to his work. His parents were very poor and could not afford to offer him a higher education. However, this did not stop Clemente from getting ahead.

His loan will be used to purchase tools and other supplies. His biggest dream is to attract more customers so that he can generate a higher income for his family to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Dios Nos Guía está conformado por Nora Yessenia Anaya Z., María Concepción López y Ángela Mercedes Ríos López. Sus actividades económicas son diferentes, pero esto no les impide desarrollar una amistad y lograr sacar adelante a sus familias y negocios. Nora se dedica a la venta de verduras, la ubicación de su negocio es las afueras del mercado, en cambio María se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. La actividad económica de Ángela es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ángela inicio con mucho sacrificio este medio de vida porque tenía que salir adelante con su familia. Por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima. María Concepción es la otra integrante de este grupo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a su actividad. Ella proporciona a sus clientes lo necesario para así que siempre satisfacer la demanda. Es por eso que las 3 deciden realizar este financiamiento con el fin de seguir adelante con sus actividades.
texts.en:
The Dios Nos Guía Solidarity Group is comprised of 3 members: Nora Yessenia Anaya Z. María Concepción López Ángela Mercedes Ríos López

They operate different businesses, but this does not prevent them from developing a friendship and sharing a common goal of moving their families and businesses forward. Nora sells vegetables from a vending location outside the local market. María runs a small grocery store, which is the only source of income for her family. She has been in business for 7 years and always tries to satisfy her customers with what they need. Angela is a clothing retailer who has been in business for 5 years. She made sacrifices to start her business because it was the only way for her to improve her family’s living situation.

Their loan will be used as working capital to buy materials for their respective businesses. They decided to pursue financing so that they could keep their businesses in operation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Concepcion De Maria Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Concepción de María está conformado por Francisca Argentina E. Castellón y Lucas Alfredo E. Castellón. Ambos tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Don Lucas se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de una ruta de transporte, y lo hace con mucho esfuerzo para mantener a su familia. Francisca se dedica a un cafetín. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. En cambio Lucas tiene 20 años que se dedica a este negocio pero le gustaría trabajar más horas y así generar ingresos para su familia. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo ya que ambos necesitan invertir en sus negocios. El sueño de ambos es salir adelante con sus negocios y lograr grandes mejorías en sus viviendas.
texts.en:
The Concepción de María Solidarity Group has 2 members: Francisca Argentina E. Castellón Lucas Alfredo E. Castellón

Both members have different businesses. Don Lucas offers transportation services and operates his own route. He works hard at his job in order to support his family. For 20 years he has been in business and would like to work more hours so that he can earn additional income to meet his family’s needs. Doña Francisca runs a small café. She has been in business for 18 years.

The loan they are requesting will be used as working capital for their businesses. They both dream of moving their businesses forward and undertaking major home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lola Lourdes

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Lola es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Lola tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, gaseosas, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama, además Lola trabaja en una farmacia.
Lola necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente.
Los sueños de Lola son comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Azucenas (White Lilies) community bank. She is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Lola has a store in her house where she sells groceries, soda, and fruit every day, with the help of her mother. Lola also works in a pharmacy. Lola needs a loan of 2,800 PEN that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, and laundry detergent. Lola's dream is to buy land to build a house on.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, laundry detergent

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Maura es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Maura tiene un puesto en el mercado de las Américas en donde comida, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos con la ayuda de sus hijas, además Maura viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende abarrotes en general y de las ferias compra cereales.
Maura necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maura son trabajar para salir adelante y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of communal bank group “Azucenas” (the Lilies).

Maura is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has a vending stall in the Las Américas market where she sells food every Saturday and Sunday. Her daughters help her with the business. Maura travels to different markets to buy groceries and to other markets that sell grain.

Maura is requesting a loan of 1600 soles to buy rice and sugar. She hopes to get ahead and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Antonia Amanda

texts.es: Antonia Amanda G. Q. tiene 40 años. Es una mujer casada, con 2 hijos. Desde muy joven estuvo involucrada en muchos negocios de comercios. Lo cual fue de mucha ayuda pues logro perfeccionar sus habilidades para las ventas. Pues para ella ha sido lo más importante tener su propio negocio. Antonia se dedica a una pulpería. Por lo que debido a sus problemas económicos de una enfermedad que sufrió su esposo. Por lo que Antonia se levanta muy temprano desde las 6 de la mañana hasta a las 9 de la noche. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas en general, galletas y jugos. Su mayor sueño es establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia Amanda G. Q. is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children. From an early age she has been involved in many business ventures. These have helped her to perfect her skills in sales. For Antonia, it has been so important that she has her own business, a neighborhood store. Her financial difficulties are due to an illness her husband suffered from. Thus Antonia gets up very early and works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. The use of her loan will be for working capital to buy staple grains, candy, cookies and juice. Her biggest dream is to establish another business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Timotea es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Timotea junto a sus hijos tiene un taller D. elaboración D. artesanías como tejido D. carteras y tallado en piedra D. Huamanga (alabastro), productos que son comercializados a la ciudad D. Lima y también en el mercado artesanal en donD. tiene un puesto.
Timotea necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. piedra D. Huamanga.
Los sueños D. Timotea son ser una empresaria en artesanía, vender directamente sus productos y tener un puesto en la ciudad D. Lima.
texts.en:
Timotea is a member of the communal bank group “Azucenas” (the Lilies).

Timotea is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. Together with her children, she operates a handicrafts workshop where they make cloth handbags and Huamanga stone carvings (maD. of alabaster). They market their products in the city of Lima and also in the arts and crafts marketplace where they have a vending post.

She needs a loan of 1800 soles to purchase Huamanga stone. She hopes to continue in the crafts business and would like to have her own shop in Lima where she can sell her products directly to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Huamanga stone

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene F. Pérez tiene 30 años. Es una mujer muy atenta, está felizmente casada y tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. A ella le gusta mucho su humilde trabajo, Martha inicio ofreciendo cosméticos y poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario. Su sistema de venta es al contado y al crédito recuperando en abonos los días de pago, su clientela es variada tiene personas del sector y amigas de su hija que la apoya en esta digna actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para niños, ropa para damas y ropa para caballeros. Su deseo es establecer una tienda, para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha Irene F. Pérez is 30 years old. She is a very attentive woman, is happily married, and has 2 children. She sells general merchandise and enjoys her humble work a lot. Martha began selling cosmetics and, little by little, increased her inventory. She sells her goods in cash and on credit, recovering payments in installments on specific days. She has a varied clientele and has people in her sector and friends of her daughters helping her in her business. The loan that she is requesting will be used as capital for her business so that she can buy clothes for children, women, and men. Her dream is to have a store and to support her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hazell Maria

texts.es: Hazell María F. M. tiene la edad de 35 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 35 años y 2 hijos. Hezell se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 5 años, que su negocio da inicio. Por lo que anteriormente solo su marido, laboraba como docente en dos turnos primaria y secundaria, ya que solamente así ayudaría a mantener sus hijos. Es por cuenta propia que Hezell decide ayudarle a su esposo y comienza con la elaboración de frutas y verduras en su vivienda. Pero con mucho esfuerzo logra salir adelante obteniendo clientes fijos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de papaya, sandias, mangos, naranjas y aguacate. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Hazell María F. M. is 35 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children. Hazell sells fruits and vegetables. It has been more than 5 years since her started her business. Before, only her husband worked; he was a teacher, working in two shifts in primary and secondary school, and this was the only way he would help to take care of the children. Because of this, Hazell decided to help her husband and began selling fruits and vegetables from her home. With a lot of effort, she has succeeded in going forward and has fixed clients. This loan will be used as capital for her business so that she can buy papaya, watermelon, mangoes, oranges, and avocadoes. Her biggest dream is for her children to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Carmen es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Carmen tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Carmen viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde también vende ropa.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, chompas y pantalones.
Los sueños de Carmen son mejorar su negocio, implementar un taller de confección de ropa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the White Lilies Community Bank. Carmen is married, is 35 years old, and has two children. Carmen has a stand in the 12th of April Market, where she sells a variety of clothing. She does this every day. Also, Carmen travels to different fairs in the region, where she sells clothing. Carmen needs a loan of 1600 soles, which will be invested to buy jackets, sweaters, and pants. Her dreams are to improve her business and install and workshop to make clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets, sweaters, and pants

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto R. Martínez tiene la edad de 45 años, Está casado. Lamentablemente no tiene hijos con su pareja, pues ella es estéril. Luis se dedica a una librería. Dio inicio hace 4 años, ya que no tenía los suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia, el es un buen hombre, que junto a su esposa luchan para salir adelante a pesar de las duras dificultades que han atravesado juntos. Es crédito que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, engrapadoras y artículos de oficina. Su mayor deseo es poder tener una hija que llene de alegría su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto R. Martínez is 45 years old and married. Unfortunately, his wife was not able to have children. Luis operates a bookstore, which he started 4 years ago because he was not earning enough money to support his family. He is a good man, and together with his wife, they have endured many difficulties in order to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, staplers and other office supplies. He hopes to have a home full of joy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Roxana es soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hija, estudia informática, Roxana tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende carne de cerdo, el cual es adquirido en la ciudad de Lima, además reparte por mayor a los comerciantes de carne.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de cerdo.
Los sueños de Roxana son que su hija sea profesional y que nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Rubi (Ruby) communal bank group.

She is 21 years old, single and has one daughter. In addition, Roxana is studying computer science. She has a vending stall in the Nery García market where she sells pork that she acquires in the city of Lima, primarily from wholesale meat distributors.

Roxana needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy more pork. She dreams that her daughter will pursue a professional career and that her family never lacks anything.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more pork

loans.name: Rony Jeronimo

texts.es: Rony Jerónimo P. tiene la edad de 29 años. Es un joven que tiene 29 años de edad. Tiene 1 hijo que esta al cuido de su esposa. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de llamadas, por lo que el inicio su negocio con capital propio, hace 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, Además Rony habla el idioma ingles, ya que muchos extranjeros llegan a su local y eso es una gran ayuda para sus ingresos. El motivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de recargas electrónicas, compras de sillas entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es establecer otro negocio para tener una mejoría económica.
texts.en:
Rony Jerónimo P. is 29 years old. He has a son who is being cared for by his wife. Two years ago, he went into business by establishing a call center with his own capital. Rony speaks English, so he is a great assistance to visiting foreigners who help boost his income.

He seeks additional funding to purchase electronic phone reloads, more seating for his call center, and other supplies. His biggest dream is to start another business so that he can improve his financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Luisa Benita

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Luisa es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Luisa tiene un establo en el distrito de Chiara en donde se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuna y la producción de leche y quesos, además compra leche de los demás productores y lo vende a una institución publica.
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina para el ganado y para la siembra de alfalfa.
Los sueños de Luisa son aumentar su ganado y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Rubi Community Bank. Luisa is 38, married, and has three children. Luisa has a stable in the Chiara district. She raises cows and produces milk and cheese. She also buys milk from other producers and sells it to public institutions. Luisa needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy medicine for her livestock and to plant alfalfa. Luisa’s dreams are to increase her number of livestock and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine for her livestock and to plant alfalfa

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Yovana es soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Yovana vende muebles como separadores de ambiente, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria en la feria de las Américas los días domingos, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Yovana necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de muebles.
Los sueños de Yovana son ampliar su negocio y tener mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Yovona is a member of Rubi Community Bank. She is 30 years old, single, and has one son. Yovana sells furniture, such as room separators, as an ambulatory vendor in the Americas Fair on Sundays. She purchases these products in Lima.

Yovona needs a loan of 750 soles to invest in the purchase of furniture. Her dream is to expand her business and have more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase Furniture

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Carmen es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Carmen viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, papa, productos que vende en los mercados.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de carmen son ampliar su negocio y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of Rubi Community Bank. She is 54 years old, single, and has three children. Carmen travels to various regional fairs where fruits and groceries are sold and she purchases grains and potatoes to sell in local markets.

Carmen needs a loan of 600 soles to purchase rice and sugar. Her dream is to expand and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase Rice and Sugar

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar P. M. es cliente de Fundación León 2000, pues es un buen cliente nuestro. Oscar tiene situado su negocio en su humilde vivienda. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues él un hombre con muy buenas intenciones, pues desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para salir adelante, pues su única preocupación siempre ha sido que su familia obtenga lo necesario. El financiamiento será destinado para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, jugos, refrescos, y gaseosas. El deseo de Oscar es ampliar su negocio y proveerla de muchos productos diarios.
texts.en:
Oscar P. M. is a client of Fundación León 2000 and is a good client of ours. Oscar's business is located in his humble home. For more than 5 years he has been working in this business. He is a well-intentioned man and ever since he was young he has had to work in order to get ahead in life. His only concern has always been to provide for his family’s needs.

This loan will be used to purchase sweets, bread, cookies, juice, soda and other beverages. Oscar’s dream is to expand his business and provide it with many everyday products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Félix Pedro Téllez tiene 44 años. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica  a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Su pequeño negocio, reúne a todos sus vecinos que llegan a disfrutar de una gaseosa o jugo muy helado, y a conversar en la compañía de Félix, además es un hombre que ha sabido administrar sus ingresos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pollo, aceites, frijoles, gaseosas, jugos y golosinas en general. El sueño de Félix es que su esposa logre recuperarse totalmente para que el pueda salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Félix Pedro Téllez is 44. He has had a mini market for over five years. His business is located in his house. All of his neighbors get together at his market to enjoy a soft drink or chilled juice and chat with Félix. Félix is a man who has known how to manage his income. The loan is for working capital to buy chicken, oil, beans, soft drinks, juice, and sweets. Félix’s dream is for his wife to totally recuperate so that he can have a good future with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. M. G. es pequeño productor agropecuario dedicado a la produccion de arroz en pequeña escala, su familia habita junto a el en la finca, 2 hijos estudian, 1 la primaria y el otro 2do año de secundaria, muy temprano su esposa le perepara sus alimentos para emprender la jornada de trabajo diario, su aspiracion actual esta enfocada a la de participar como socio de la construccion del trillo arrocero COPACSELES para lo que solicita el presente financiamiento  y asi alcanzar la asociatividad de este trillo de arroz que le permitira aprovechar mejor su produccion de arroz y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. M. G. is a farmer doing smallscale production of rice. His family lives with him on the farm. His two children go to school, one is in primary school and the other is in the second year of secondary school. Very early each day, his wife prepares him his food to begin the workday. His current goal is to participate as a partner in the construction of a rice thresher for the agricultural cooperative COPACSELES. He is asking for this loan to invest in the construction of this rice thresher and thus have partial ownership of it. By using a thresher he will be able to better harvest his rice crop and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% towards the construction of a rice thresher

loans.name: Candida Octaviana

texts.es: La Señora Cándida Octaviana B. M. tiene 46 años. Es una mujer viuda. Tiene 4 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Ella comienza este negocio hace 20 años,  porque anteriormente ella vendía sandalias, pero debido a su poco crecimiento con su negocio, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para comprar diferentes zapatos, modelos y tallas. Su mayor sueño es establecer una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Cándida Octaviana B. M. is 46 years old, widowed, and has 4 dependent children. She has been in business for 20 years. Previously, she sold sandals but that type of product did not result in enough growth for her to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy different styles and sizes of shoes. Her biggest dream is to open a store from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Camino De Santidad Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario  Camino de Santidad está conformado por Paula Francisca E. y Margarita del Rosario E.. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas, pero sus ganas de salir adelante con sus negocios son las mejores. Paula se dedica a la venta de dulces y horneados. Tiene 3 hijos  a su cargo y todos estudian. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde oficio, por lo que todos los días por la tarde recorre las calles, para distribuir sus deliciosos productos. En el caso de Margarita se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y entre ambas deciden realizar un financiamiento con el fin de ayudarse a salir adelante con sus actividades económicas.  El deseo que comparten es que Dios le siga proporcionando vida para que cada una de sus familias, pueda obtener el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
The supportive group, Camino de Santidad, is formed by Paula Francisca E. and Margarita del Rosario E.. Both of them have different businesses, but their desire to get ahead in their businesses is the same. Paula sells sweets and baked goods. She is raising three children, and they go to school. She has been working at this humble job for over ten years. Every afternoon she travels the streets to distribute her delicious products. Margarita has a mini market. She has had this business for over seven years. They both decided to ask for a loan in order to help themselves get ahead in their businesses. The wish that they share is that God continues providing them with life so that each one of their families can have their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario Sagrada Familia compuesto por dos personas, tienen 20 créditos y es uno de los más antiguos de la institución, son excelentes clientes.

Amparo Nicoloza S. Guzmán tiene una pulpería desde hace mas de 20 años con la cual ha apoyado el sustento familiar, vive con su familia, goza de buena reputación entre su vecindario y tiene los servicios básicos  como todo ciudadano. Su cónyuge es obrero y  da su aporte para el  bienestar familiar.

La otra señora Aurora Ercilia S. Guzmán, su actividad es la de comercializar carne de cerdo, elaborar comida y  dulces. Vive con su familia, cónyuge y tres hijos donde tienen  uno de los servicios básicos primarios como es la energía, el agua la obtienen a través de otra fuente que no es la red pública.
Su cónyuge labora como obrero en el campo y con su salario ayuda al sustento también de la familia.

Ambas son hermanas y tienen buena coordinación en el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
The Sagrada Familia Solidarity Group is composed of two members who have participated in 20 loans. They are long-standing members of the institution and have been excellent clients.

Amparo Nicoloza S. Guzmán has operated a grocery store for more than 20 years with the support of her family, with whom she lives. She has earned a good reputation within the community. Her family receives basic services as like any other citizen. Her husband also works to contribute toward the family’s welfare.

The other member is Aurora Ercilia S. Guzmán. She sells pork, prepared meals and candy. She lives with her husband and 3 children. In her neighborhood, her family receives basic services such as electricity. However, they obtain their water from another source that is not part of the public network. Her husband is a farm laborer and his salary helps with the family expenses.

Both members are sisters, and they work well together to pay off their debts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora María Guadalupe Sánchez le está haciendo falta un nuevo piso ya que el que tiene está en muy malas condiciones. 
Pero por el momento no cuanta con el dinero para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para que su vivienda esté en mejores condiciones, ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su mama que es una persona mayor de edad y necesita varios cuidados. 
La señora María  trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de producción este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia, y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe Sánchez’s house needs a new floor because the one that is there is in very bad condition. Right now, she does not have the money to be able to buy the material and pay someone to make the improvement. That is why she is asking for a loan to get her house into better condition. She is taking care of her elderly mother, and she needs various accommodations. María works in the area of production in a factory. This is the income that the family has. Part of it will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the floor in her house

loans.name: Reyes Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Reyes Antonio A. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada, el negocio lo atienden el y su mama la señora María Magdalena R..
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero en esté momento no cuanta con el capital necesario para invertir, es por eso que está solicitando una préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía que le están ofreciendo a un buen preció.
Reyes también es empleada de una farmacia y con las ganancias de negocio desea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora María Magdalena quien en ese momento atendía el negocio porque Reyes Antonio se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Reyes Antonio A. has been selling used clothes for over three years. He and his mother, María Magdalena R., tend the business. The business is in need of a greater variety of merchandise. At this time, he does not have the necessary capital to invest. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy the merchandise that they are offering at a good price. Reyes is also an employee of a pharmacy. He wants to pay the loan with the earnings from the business. The woman in the photograph is María Magdalena. At the time the photograph was taken she was tending the store because Reyes Antonio was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes A. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 51 years old. Mercedes is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Mercedes owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling nipa (thatched) hut products to local businesses and community members. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mercedes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Mercedes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
25-year old Brenda P. is one of the hard-working farmers in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, a poor community in Mindanao where Community Economic Ventures operates and extends its services to help farmers sustain their livelihood. " The land was given to us by my parents when I got married. Now, we are propagating seedlings to use for the next planting," she said.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000. She needs a loan to be able to buy 2 gallons of crude oil for land preparation as well as fertilizers. The loan will help a lot especially in meeting the needs of her business growth. Thus, she is expecting a bountiful harvest and a good return on her investment after buying all the farm necessities.

CEVI continues helping people who wish to change their lives. Through credit that we give, we are able to help people start a business and somehow provide families the livelihood that they need for their children.

loans.use: To buy 2 gallons of crude oil for land preparation as well as fertilizers

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa D. is from the village of Purok 2A, Kasinglot Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Felisa is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Felisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising flowers in her flower farm. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.She also just started her variety store as a sideline.

In 2009, Felisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Felisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en: Like any other farmer, Maricor M. dreams of having an abundant harvest on her farm. Her reason? She would be able to provide well the needs of her family. She is now busy preparing her farm. She even asked her husband to buy the needed chemicals that will help prepare the soil before planting. "We were tenants before. Now, we are tilling our own farm," she said. She is asking a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase a sack of complete fertilizers. CEVI's mission states about helping small business grow. It provides its clients with not just loans that they can use for capital in their businesses, it also gives training and insurance coverage services to help sustain their livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of complete fertilizers

Felipa owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling specialty food products like longganisa (Filipino-style sausages), and other sausages in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. loans.name: Bathishig

texts.en:
Bathishig H. is 30 and lives with his wife and three small children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children go to a local high school. Bathishig drives a small passenger car in Ulaanbaatar. Before this passenger transportation business, he used to sell second-hand car accessories at the local black market where most of the car-related products and services are offered.

Since he obtained permission to drive a passenger bus in the city, he decided to pursue the passenger transportation business as he saw brighter opportunities in the transportation business in the city. His wife Hajidmaa also helps in his business; she is the conductor on the bus and makes sure that money does not get lost. Bathishig requests a loan to maintain his house and to buy new tires for the bus.

loans.use: For home maintenance and new tires

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie E. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old, married, and has five adult children. Tessie owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling "RTW" (ready-to-wear) products. This is done through orders from customers in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar T. lives with his wife and two teenage children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children stay with their grandmother in Nalaih, a nearby town, where they both go to a local high school.

Batbaatar had worked for a local police station as a police officer for many years. He has recently quit his job due to poor salary and now drives a cab in the city. His wife also helps in his cab business.

Their living conditions are not very good; thus, Batbaatar decided to send his two children to their grandmother until he gets his old house renovated. He says that he works hard to renovate his old house. Once the house renovation is done, he is looking forward to bringing back his children and living with them together.

Batbaatar requests a loan to repair his car for his taxi business and the rest of the loan will be used to purchase a computer.

loans.use: To repair his car for his taxi business and to buy a computer

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren Y. is 38 years old and lives with his three daughters in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two of his daughters are students in a local high school #84. His youngest daughter is just 3 years old and stays home with her mother. Batsuren's family moved to Ulaanbaatar after selling off all their livestock in the countryside where they were born.

Batsuren's family runs a small convenience store which is located just next to their small house. They sell various food products such as soft-drinks, bread, candies, etc. His wife works as a saleswoman at the store and Batsuren frequently goes to the wholesale markets in the city to purchase food products for his store. Batsuren and his wife dream of making their small convenience store into a large supermarket where they will be able to sell a more diverse range of products in the neighborhood.

Batsuren requests a loan to purchase more food products for their store and, with the left-over money, would also would like to fix the roof of the store before the harsh winter.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for their store and to fix the roof

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen P., a 30-year old mother of three children always dreamed of succeeding in her farm business. For now, she is engaged in farming rice which she sells for 38 Philippine pesos (about 79 cents US) per kilo. However, there are times that she has sold her rice by the sack. Rice has been helping her a lot especially in making ends meet for her family.

She would like to ask for a loan of 7,000 pesos from Community Economic Ventures. She was delighted by CEVI's unique services. She thinks of taking out loans from CEVI to be able to purchase herbicides and fertilizers for her business.

Aireen chose CEVI because they provide not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Ruth is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling green bananas, and at the same time do banana cue vending in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for educational support of children in the near future and supplement income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Daylen

texts.en:
Daylen V. works on a 1.25-hectare farm. She is a tenant and tills the land that she never owned. Her only wish is that, someday she has a farm to own. She and her husband work so hard everyday to be able to realize that dream. Daylen is now 25 years old. Her future plan is to become successful in her business always. 

Knowing the services of Community Economic Ventures Inc., she wants to avail a loan of Php 7,000. She will use the loan to buy one sack of fertilizer and insecticide. She thinks that by making this move, she will be able to save her farm and have an abundant harvest. 

Now, she continues availing CEVI services. She is provided with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy a sack of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean M. is just 18 years old. But despite her age, she knows well the needs of her family. She wants to help especially to guarantee the education of her siblings. What she can do to help supplement the income in their household is planting vegetables, using the 2-hectare farm of her parents. She also is managing a rice farm. She thinks that with her own way of managing their family business, she will be able to help her family a lot.

She wants to make their business grow, that is why, after hearing about Community Economic Ventures Inc. and how it helps people have their own business, she applied for a loan worth Php 7,000. She will use her loan to purchase 1 sack of fertilizer and as payment for labor.

Now, she is happy having the loans, training and insurance coverage services that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase 1 sack of fertilizer and as payment for labor

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en:
T. Phạm Thị H. (20211030049) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu 08 (8).


T. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, T. operates a family member's furniture making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. is requesting her first loan from SEDA.  She is requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by T. from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20211030050) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business selling agricultural equipment.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211030051) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


3.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20211030052) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


4.  Trần Thị K. (20211030053) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20211030054) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Phạm Thị H. (20211030049) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20211030050) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán thiết bị nông nghiệp.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211030051) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20211030052) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  Trần Thị K. (20211030053) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20211030054) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 05 (5).


L. is married and has one adult child.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a business selling herbs & spices in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. is requesting for the first time a L. from SEDA. She is requesting a L. of 5.152.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products.  The L. will be the first L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

L. Trương Thị (20203040030) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ H.n hay không trả được nợ.. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn B. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Judilyn is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Judilyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products like lumpia, banana crackers, and many more in the local community. Judilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Judilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Puli, Carmen, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Zenia H. is still a business-minded woman and courageous enough to take risks in running a business, the same way she took a risk in re-marrying after the death of her first husband, leaving her with six children. Though the decision she made then allowed her see the happiness that life can offer, she doesn't like to be dependent on anyone, even on her new partner, Anastacio, who is a brother of her former husband, because she knows that she has children of her own to raise and send to school.

Her membership in ASHI and the loans she has accessed since she became a member have assisted her in running a business while Anastacio is a laborer and farmer. He is also very supportive of Zenia and his step-children, as well as their own nine-year-old child. Because of this, Zenia has been performing very well in her repayment, attendance, and business thus making her qualified for a higher loan amount.

Zenia's recently received loan was intended as additional capital for her farming (rice planting) business and hog fattening (backyard pig raising) with pigs to be sold after four months. She will also finance her store to be re-opened. Zenia has to have many business to generate bigger income to send all six of her children to school. All in all she has seven children, however, her eldest works as an overseas contract worker and is also helping her finance the education of the siblings.

loans.use: Additional farm inputs, piggery, and finance re-opening of her variety store

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
Hà Ngô Thị T. (20203040024) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Hà is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 04 (4).

Hà is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Hà operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing furniture-rental services to local community members. Hà has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (about $280) a month from these activities.

Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She requests a loan of 5.152.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Ramon Jr.

texts.en:
Ramon C. Jr. is managing a small parcel of rice field which is about 1.5 hectare size. He knows about fishing also since his childhood days. He is 37 years old this year and still single. He is still saving for his future family. Now, his only dream is to have a very established piggery business aside from the farm that he is tilling today.

Learning about the services of Community Economic Ventures Inc., he applied for a loan worth Php 7,000. He will use the loan to purchase fungicides and fertilizers. The loan will help a lot in improving his yield. Thus, he will be able to support his siblings pay their tuition and book needs in their school.

He chose CEVI for it provides not just loans to people. It also provides training and insurance coverage services to help small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase  fungicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Gái's Group

texts.en:
Gái Thị N. was born in 1963. She lives in Luc Canh village, in the Xuan Canh commune, with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a truck driver. The older son is in high school. The younger son is at home. Ms Gai has a small store at home. She has borrowed via microfinance for two years. This time, she needs 5,886,000 VND (or ~$330 US) to buy goods to sell.
No: 010107010001  

 There are four other fund participants in her group:

Thảo Thị Phan was born in 1981. She cooks for a factory and breeds pigs and poultry. She needs 3,270,000 VND (or ~$185 US) to buy food for them.
No: 010107010003 

 Lan Thị Quỳnh N. was born in 1951. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or ~$280 US) for a small business.
No: 010107010002 

 Nga Thị Phạm was born in 1954. She has two children. She has an electrical shop. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or ~$280 US) to buy electrical goods for her shop.
No: 010107010005 

 Hải Thị Hoàng was born in 1976. She has two children of school age. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (or ~$255 US) to buy vegetables to sell at the market.
No:010107010004

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen G. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan De Oro City. She is 36 years old. Gretchen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gretchen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gretchen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gretchen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and support the education of her children.
