loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim T. is an older mother of fifty-eight, married with five children. All five of them are married and have ready started new family homes. Sim T. now stays at home to manage current household tasks such as cooking and house cleaning.

Presently, Sim T. depends on her husband’s work as an interpreter in the garment industry. This older couple is facing difficulties with transportation needs because they do not own a vehicle. Therefore, Sim T. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva and will use her loan to buy a motorbike for her family’s riding needs. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family’s riding needs

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Erlene B. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan De Oro City. She is 53 years old. Erlene is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Erlene owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snack products, including 'polvoron' (a traditional Filipino cake) and homemade candies in the local community. Erlene is just starting this business.

In 2009, Erlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Erlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of family members.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: Puli, Carmen, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel L.'s dream is to own a tricycle (a local three-wheeled transport vehicle). For now, she is busy managing their small rice field to be able to have an abundant harvest to support her siblings. She is 45 years old and still single. She has been a farmer since she was just a small kid.

Believing that buying the farm necessities will help improve their yield, she applied for a loan worth Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase one bag of rice seeds, herbicides and 5 liters of crude oil.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides credit, training, and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase one bag of rice seeds, herbicides and 5 liters of crude oil

loans.name: Tô's Group

texts.en:
N. Tô Thị owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector making general household furniture and selling to local businesses and community members. She is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. N. is married and has two school-age children. N. has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

On 30/12/2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,186,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase materials to expand her product offerings. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional materials to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

N. is the leader of a four member group seeking a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân 05 (5). No. 20213050006

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Tô Thị L. is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. No. 20213050007

2. Đỗ Thị Huệ is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. No. 20213050008

3. Trương Thị L. is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. No. 20213050009

N. Tô Thị (20213050006) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đức Lân 05 (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. Vào 30/12/2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Tô Thị L. (20213050007) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Đỗ Thị Huệ (20213050008) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3. Trương Thị L. (20213050009) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth G. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan De Oro City. She is 49 years old. Ruth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family members as well as the educational needs of her children.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ислом мужчина 50 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей. Ислом работает водителем маршрутного такси.  Ему необходимо переоборудовать машину на газовую систему. Он делает рейсы с города в районы. С бензином ему обходилось дорого , так как бензин дорожал а доходов меньше , он повышал ставку цены, но клиенты предпочитают ехать дешевле.Получив кредит третий раз, он доволен, и планирует получить на ремонт машины в будущем.
texts.en:
Islom is a 50 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. Islom works as a van line driver. He needs to convert his car to run on hydrogen gas. He drives on routes from the city to the outlying neighborhoods. Gas increased his costs, since gas prices went up and profits decreased; he increased rates, but customers prefer to ride at a cheaper price. After taking out a loan for the third time he is happy and plans to take out another loan in the future to make auto repairs.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert automobile

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thủy Thị T. Nguyễn was born in 1979. (no: 010102120026). She lives in Vang village, Co Loa commune with her husband, her son and mother-in-law. Her son takes part in school kindergarten. Her husband is a worker. She has a wedding dress shop.  Her family has a monthly income of about 4.500.000 VND. She has been engaged in financial microfinance for two years. This cycle of capital, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to invest in her shop. There are two other Fund participants in her group:
 Phương K. Nguyễn was born in 1968. (no: 010102120026). She has two children. She is a mechanic. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy clothes.
 Thà Thị Nguyễn was born in 1960. (no: 010102120027).  She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy more vegetables.

Melenia U. is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Melenia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melenia owns & operates a nipa (palm) weaving business. loans.name: Ma. Shirley

texts.en:
Ma. Shirley is 39 years of age and is married to Nestor, who is 42. The two were blessed with six children. Her eldest child is in high school while the youngest is five years old. Ma. Shirley and Nestor have been running a buying and selling business for the last five years until the present time. They wish to grow this business to increase their income and so that they will be able to support the education of their children until college. They also wish to acquire their own space in the municipal market where they can display items they sell and gain more customers/buyers. These dreams however will remain as vision forever if the couple's long time problem which is business capital is not addressed.

In July of 2009, Ma. Shirley found the opportunity she and her husband were hoping for for many years. She knew ASHI and she felt that the institution fits her needs by offering a loan that suits to her capacity to pay.

As a newly recognized member of ASHI and as a beginner, Ma. Shirley's maximum loan amount is still small. However, if she proves that her capacity to pay a larger loan is increased because she was able to grow her business further after her first loan, she can request bigger loans in future loan cycles.

Ma. Shirley believes that the success of her family lies in the success of her business, and the success of her business lies on loans she can request, therefore she promised to herself and her family that she will use her loan to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

Truphena A. is a 29-year-old married mother of one. She lives with her husband Michael and daughter Marion in Mikindani, Mombasa, where she runs a pharmacy and also sells cosmetics. Nabichon is a young 22-year-old single man. Nabichon drives a shuttle bus on the Khujand-Gafurov route. He works according to this schedule: 2 days on and 1 day off. He tries to maximize his earnings on the workdays and works from early morning to late night. He repairs his vehicle on his off days. He wanted to use this loan for the repairs of his Gazel vehicle. Nabichon is saving money for a wedding.

loans.name: Ma. Janeth

texts.en:
Five years ago, Janeth began selling fish her husband catches from the ocean. They don't have their own boat for fishing because they can't afford to buy one. However, her husband borrows the fishing boat of their neighbor. During days when their neighbor's fishing boat is not available, Janeth has no fish to sell, hence, fishing and fish-selling don't give them regular income. 

Fish is not the most in-demand food of people in Janeth's village, yet it is one of the foods people are buying, more than other kinds of meat. It is so because fish is cheaper and common in their place, which is situated near the ocean. Janeth wishes to have this kind of business as their stable source of income. She wants to purchase their own fishing boat to be managed by her husband, thus making fishing as regular as it can be. 

Initially, Janeth had started her fish-selling business after she became a member of ASHI in June 2009. Since the loan she received is not yet enough to purchase a fishing boat for her husband, she will use it to finance her fish business. With her next loan, plus the savings she could generate out of her newly started business, she will be buying her husband a fishing boat. Janeth's husband is so supportive to all her visions, including her dreams for her children. She is determined to work hard in growing her business so that she can send all of her six children to school until college. By then, she foresees their lives coming out of poverty. 

She is so thankful that ASHI has the same vision as hers and that she has the opportunity to help herself and her family. Her loan will lead her towards success.

loans.use: buying fish to sell

      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Фуркат мужчина 33 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей.Фуркат как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги.Жена домохозяйка, нянчит троих детей. Фуркат более 10 лет водит маршрутное такси №18 - Худжанд - Гафуров.Каждый день работает без выходных.Данный кредит берёт для обновления чехлов своего автомобиля марки "Газель" так как они очень износились.
texts.en:
Furkat is a 33-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. As head of household, Furkat works and earns money. His wife is a homemaker, who takes care of their three children. Furkat has been driving a shuttle bus #18 on the Khujand-Gafurov route for over 10 years. He works every day, without days off. He is obtaining this loan in order to update seat covers for his Gazel vehicle because they have become very worn.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Updating vehicle seat covers

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men T. was born in 1944 and is the mother of four children, two married and living independently and two single and  working in a garment factory. Men T. and her husband inherited a plot of farmland from their grandparents and they use this land to cultivate a rice crop to earn a living.  With the coming rice season Men T. hopes to earn additional revenue by using a Kiva loan as capital to order rice from farmers to store and sell later when it commands a higher price.

loans.use: To order rice from farmers to store for later sale.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Рахматулло мужчина 28 лет. Семейный мужчина имеет одного ребёнка. Рахматулло занимается бизнесом несколько лет, куплей- продажей б/у мебели из рук. Он покупает мебель дешево, ремонтирует и продаёт за прибыльную цену на местных базарах. Этот вид бизнеса приносит ему двойную выгоду: он зарабатывает и деньги и учится мастерству своего дела
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rahmatullo is a 28 year old man. He is a family man who has one child. Rahmatullo has been doing business for several years buying and selling used furniture from people. He buys the furniture cheap, then repairs it and sells it for a more profitable price on the local markets. This type of business makes him double profit: he makes money and learns the craft of his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Хасан мужчина 49 лет. Разведённый -живёт с матерью. Он занимается куплей и продажей мебели. Хасан также мастер по изготовлению мебели, у него много учеников. Этим делом он занимается уже 20 лет. Покупает старые мебели и реставрирует и продает за хорошие деньги. У него в цеху целый комплект оборудованный по изготовлению мебели и данный кредит берёт на покупку современных технологий.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Hasan is a 49 year old man. He is divorced and lives with his mother. He buys and sells furniture. Hasan is also a furniture maker and has many students. He has been in this business for more than twenty years. He buys old furniture and then repairs it and sells for good money. He has a completely equipped shop for making of furniture and he is taking this loan to buy modern technology.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy S., a 46-year-old farmer living in the Province of Kompong Cham, Cambodia, currently plants a green bean crop on her own farmland twice a year, selling her mature crop to her buyers every six months.  Her husband helps her in planting the crops. Kuy S. is looking for a loan to enlarge her bean crop in order to increase her income, something that will help her better provide for her four school-aged children.

loans.use: To enlarge her bean crop.

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Nguyên Thị Phạm was born in 1951. (no: 010107010084). She lives in Luc Canh, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her brother and grandson. She has a store at home selling beer, soft drinks, confectionery, tobacco, etc. Her two sons are working away from home. Sometimes they come back home and visit their mother. Ms N. has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 VND. She has taken part in financial microfinance for four years. She is a group leader. This cycle of capital, she needs 5.886.000 VND to buy goods for her store. There are six other Fund participants in her group:

Lan Thị Hoàng was born in 1969. (no: 010107010087) She has three children. She is a laborer. She has a monthly income of about 1.500.000 VND. She breeds pigs and poultry too. She needs to borrow 1.526.000 VND to buy food for the pigs.

Hợp Thị Đỗ was born in 1970. (no: 010107010088). She has two children. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy more clothes..

Loan Thị Nguyễn was born in 1973. (no: 0101070100105). She has two children. She has an electrical shop. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy electrical goods for her shop..

Hồng Thị Hoàng was born in 1976. (no: 0101070100103). She has three children. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy bamboo shoots to resell. .

Chung Thị Hoàng was born in 1974. (no: 010107010082). She has two children. She is a teacher. She raises chickens too. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for the chickens..

Mười thị Vũ was born in 1971. She has a son. (no: 0101070100106). She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ( or 280 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Мавзуна несколько лет торгует детской одеждой на базаре. У нее качественный товар, поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Товар привозит поставщик. Она оплачивает транспортные расходы и даёт деньги за товар, иногда она сама ездит за товаром. 
На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет улучшить свой ассортимент и привозить модные, качественные детские спортивные костюмы. Продает детские вещи. Мавзуна хочет получить займ в сумме 5000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев. Заранее благодарит КИВА за поддержку!
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mavzuna has been selling children's clothing on the market for several years. She has quality merchandise and this is why she has regular customers. She gets the merchandise from a supplier. She pays for the delivery and merchandise and sometimes she also travels for it herself. She wants to use the loan to improve the assortment of goods and bring in modern, quality children's sportswear. She sells children's clothing. Mavzuna wants to get a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni for an eight month term. She is thanking Kiva for support in advance!

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's sportswear

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Байматова Латофат является активным нашим клиентом. Она родилась 1955 году и имеет  4 детей. Латофат работает в Радио Таджикистана оператором и через каждые 2 дня. Остальные дни она занимается продажей лепешек на рынке "Сафариён", магазин №118. Латофат сама печет лепешки по заказу для «Курутоб», а в основном она закупает в оптом.   
У нее много клиентов. Ей нравиться ее работа, она считает, что хлеб всегда будут покупать и это является постоянным источником дохода.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Latofat B. is our active client. She was born in 1955 and has four children. Latofat works on the Tajikistan Radio as an operator every two days. During other days she sells flat breads on the Safariyon market in the store number 118. Latofat makes the flat breads herself, she gets orders from Kurutob and mainly she buys in wholesale. She has many customers. She likes her work and she thinks that bread will always be in demand and it is a stable source of income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for baking

loans.name: Zaurbek

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Хамроев Заурбек родился 1978 году в г.Душанбе. Женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Три года как занимается продажей мужских одежд на  рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Он закупает товар из оптового рынка «Корвон». Заурбек кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Он успешно закончил  предыдущий займа и теперь запрашивает новый займ для закупки летней партии мужских одежд. Он хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zaurbek H. was born in 1978 in the city of Dushanbe. He is married and has one child. He has been selling men's clothing on the Korvon market in Dushanbe for three years now. He buys the merchandise in wholesale on the Korvon market. Zaurbek has been taking loans from us since 2008. He has successfully completed his previous loan and now asking for a new loan to buy a summer batch of men's wear. He wants to get a loan for 1500 somoni for a term of six months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's summer clothing

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Охунова Рано занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на вещевом рынке, находящимся в районе Пачшанбе города Худжанда. Каждую неделю она ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан. Рано в период кредитования расширила свой ассортимент товара и тем самым привлекла много клиентов. На следующий займ она хочет приобрести подростковые футболки и шорты.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rano O. sells children's clothing. She sells on the clothing market which is located in the Panschabe region in the town of Khujand. Every week she goes for merchandise to the town of Istaravshan. Rano has increased the assortment of her inventory during her credit history and by this has attracted many customers. Her next loan she will use to buy t-shirts and shorts for teenagers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts and shorts

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan De Oro City. She is 27 years old. Maricel is single. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a new loan, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

location.town: Puli, Carmen, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ahrorjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Акилов несколько лет записывает, оформляет и продает компакт диски. Спрос на его диски большой, так как они качественные и место продажи расположено в центре рынка Панчшанбе. Для того чтобы запись была еще качественней он хочет на следующий займ приобрести записывающий DVD проигрыватель. Клиент благодарен кредиторам за поддержку его бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Ahrorjon A. records, packages and sells DVD's for several years. The demand for his disks is high because they are of high quality and his vendor location is in the center of the Panschabe market. He wants to use the next loan to buy a DVD recorder so that he can make an even more quality DVD records. He is very thankful to the lenders for the support of his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a DVD recorder

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pov O. is a villager in Srae Kruor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ang Soravuth, is a motorbike taxi driver. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Srey Pov O. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and thus reduce her expenses for plowing the field. She is a 25-year-old mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and for plowing on the field.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay T. has been a local cultivator for 50 years, planting different kinds of crop to earn a living. She also grows rice, vegetables, and some fruit crops, which she can plant 3 or 4 times a year with two seasons, the rainy season and the dry season. To help be responsible for her family’s living needs, her husband also works in construction. Svay T. has now been blessed with two school-age children. Because Svay T. depends on doing farming, she is looking for a loan to purchase a plot of a neighbor’s farmland in order to grow even more various crops on it.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of neighbor’s farmland

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шоира продолжает расширять свой бизнес. У нее большой ассортимент детской одежды и обуви. За период кредитования она увеличила товарооборот и повысила уровень жизни. В этом году она отправила своих детей в летний лагерь. На следующий займ она хочет закупить летние платья для девочек.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Shoira continues to expand her business. She has a large assortment of children's clothing and shoes. During her credit history she has increased her merchandise turnaround and improved her quality of live. This year she has sent her children off to a summer camp. Her next loan she wants to use to buy summer dresses for girls.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer dresses for girls

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy S. lives in Sare Kruor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nean Khim, is a laborer. This couple has six children, two of whom are laborers while three are attending the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Although Mrs. Thy S.’s family members try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need and cannot support their living needs. Thus, Mrs. Thy S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motortaxi driver. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living with this loan. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motortaxi driver

loans.name: Devina

texts.en:
Devina E. is from the town of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 46 years old. Devina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Devina operates a family member's business venture. She has firewood to sell to her local community. Devina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Devina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Devina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Devina is requesting a new loan, which will be used to purchase additional firewood to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Devina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family and support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang K., a farmer in Prey Chhoeur Tel Village in Takeo Province, owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. She also makes Khmer cakes to add to her income. Her husband, Mr. Im Sovann, is a motorbike taxi driver. Heang is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding. 

She is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest is yet too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Kuanputun B1 Group

texts.en:
Adolof N. is the 46-year-old man who leads a group of 15 farmers - Kuanputun B1 - in Bone Village, Nekamese Sub District – Kupang District. Bone village has a beautiful view and there are many coconut, banana, and palm trees. This village has not been contaminated by air pollution, so the community can breathe fresh air. Most of community members of this village are originally from Timor and they usually speak Timorese in everyday conversation.

The villagers have backgrounds as breeders and farmers, raising cows, goats and pigs and cultivating rice fields, the latter fraught with the challenges posed by inconsistent water supplies and diseases. These challenges are also faced by Adolof and the other members of Kuanputun B1 Group.

Adolof is married and has four children. The children are: - Doni N., a 22-year-old high school graduate now attending the selection process to be in the army. - Jackson N., a 20-year-old high school still looking for a job and now spending his days helping his parents on the farm. - Melkior N., 16 years old in the third grade of Junior High School - Alwi N., 9 years old in the fourth grade of Elementary School.

Adolof and his wife are poor farmers but they are really responsible to their children. Even though they only generate a small income from their business, they always support and encourage their children to complete their schooling. For Adolof, education is important for their future.

Another difficulty that Adolof faces as a farmer is the availability of public transportation, which only operates three times a week, and the location of the market, which is situated about 37 km from Bone village, so their agricultural products cannot be sold faster. As a father of four children, Adolof wants to improve the living standard of his family, and the cattle-fattening program seems to offer the best prospect for achieving his goal. He is therefore requesting a loan of IDR 3,400,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. The other group members of Kuanputun B1 are also requesting the same loan, also hoping to improve their lives Note: Martinus was replaced by a family member when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened.
